content: My dad was a golden gloves boxer in the Marine Corps, then a deputy sheriff. My mom worked as an office assistant.
author: Susana Martinez

content: My dad was a carpenter and I would work with him during the summer and umpire on the nights I wasn't playing.
author: Jim Evans

content: I couldn't be a cameraman or a designer or an actor - I have to be a director because I learned how to do that from my dad.
author: Joe Wright

content: My dad instilled in me a great sense of humor. I wasn't bullied at school because my outward attitude was confident, and that helps.
author: Warwick Davis

content: When my dad toured in '91, I think my first gig properly was the Tokyo Dome, 50,000 people indoors. That was pretty scary. I was 12, or 13.
author: Dhani Harrison

content: My dad lived till he was 78, my mum was in her 80s, and I've got two uncles who are in their 90s now.
author: Ron Wood

content: My dad was quiet, angry, shut down. So my thing is: I express everything that's there. I want to get it all out.
author: Glen Hansard

content: My dad always told me that the best way to get somebody to get at you is to talk bad about them to somebody else.
author: T-Pain

content: My dad has always been extremely supportive in every decision I've made and much more interested in me picking what I wanted to do.
author: Colin Hanks

content: My dad taught me to be a leader or a follower, and he said follower ain't fun. So I want to be the leader of Bubba Watson.
author: Bubba Watson

content: The best thing about being a dad? Well, I think it's just the thing that every man wants - to have a son and heir.
author: George Best

content: But more importantly, I think he remembered how very close I was with my own dad, who had died in 1997.
author: Richard Marx

content: My parents were both actors my dad sort of quite early on. My mother acted for a while, and now she's a painter.
author: Sam Rockwell

content: I didn't want to have braces when I was a kid and I'm pretty sure my dad didn't want to pay for them.
author: Jessica Pare

content: So I was always around music and my dad was in his own way a progressive jazzer, a big band jazzer guy.
author: Billy Sherwood

content: Because I was starting out in my 20's. I wanted to do it on my own. I didn't want to use my dad or have people say I was using him.
author: Rosanne Cash

content: My dad is a huge rock and roll lead guitar fan. I didn't even really know that until recently. Everything has to have a guitar solo in it.
author: Slash

content: My dad would always say, 'What can you do to make the world a better place?' Well, I can make people laugh.
author: Jon Lovitz

content: I love my hockey, but if you can do that and go home and just be a dad and husband, then you have the best of both worlds.
author: Curtis Joseph

content: Being an only child, I didn't have any other family but my mom and dad really, since the rest of my family lived quite far away from London.
author: Tom Hardy

content: I'm gonna be the best dad that ever lived. I'll have a ranch with a race car track and a golf course.
author: Jeremy London

content: My dad had been shortstop when he was in college, and you know, when you're a kid, you want to be just like your dad.
author: Derek Jeter

content: My Dad was so open creatively that I was off in search of black turtleneck bathing suits with long sleeves.
author: Moon Unit Zappa

content: Everybody always wants to rebel against their parents' music, but nobody listened to music louder than my dad.
author: Dan Auerbach

content: My dad was very fun and very adventurous, and from a formative age I learned to value men who would do things on a whim.
author: Rachel Hunter

content: I started playing ball when I was a kid. My dad was a pro ball player and he passed on his knowledge to me.
author: Kurt Russell

content: I realised I could run after finding out that my dad used to run and it gave me the morale that if he did it then maybe I could also run.
author: David Rudisha

content: Dad, I'm in some trouble. There's been an accident and you're going to hear all sorts of things about me from now on. Terrible things.
author: Edward Kennedy

content: When I was a teenager, my dad used to call me 'Hollywood' because I wore sunglasses all the time, even at night. Cue song.
author: Michael Weatherly

content: My dad was vehemently opposed to electric guitars. He did not look on that kind of music as legitimate in any way.
author: Dan Fogelberg

content: I've been acting since I was 10. My dad was an entrepreneur, so I guess something along those lines. I wouldn't want a 9-5 job.
author: Will Estes

content: I would ask my dad what he did, and he'd say, 'I listen to people's problems.' In some way what he did for a living is in my genes.
author: Marcia Cross

content: My dad has always been really helpful. He taught me that talent is a bonus, but persistence is what wins out.
author: Zosia Mamet

content: I think women look for that quality in a man of being a good dad whether they're immediately wanting to be a parent or not.
author: Emily VanCamp

content: I'm just as insufferable and useless as every other dad is. The dynamic never changes, no matter what you do for a living.
author: Glenn Frey

content: From my dad I learned to be good to people, to always be honest and straightforward. I learned hard work and perseverance.
author: Luke Bryan

content: I suppose not everyone has a dad who wrote a book saying he didn't believe in the Parliamentary road to socialism.
author: Ed Miliband

content: I started off playing the clarinet, after I was inspired by listening to my dad's Benny Goodman records.
author: Alvin Lee

content: I absolutely love working with my dad because there is such an ease about it, and I also love his company.
author: Samuel West

content: My little son, Atticus, desperately needs his dad and I haven't been there for him... and that's sad.
author: Daniel Baldwin

content: I love being a dad. I'd have more kids if I could. I'd take a couple more, one or two more before I croak.
author: Richie Sambora

content: I recruited my dad to be my bass player and fired him on several occasions. He stayed on as a bus driver.
author: Chely Wright

content: My dad keeps joking about sneaking into my grandparents' house and switching out their HBO for PBS so they think I'm on 'Downton Abbey.'
author: Allison Williams

content: My dad never told me that when you audition, you might not get the role. He wanted to wait until my first disappointment to tell me.
author: Haley Joel Osment

content: When I was little, I used to work with my dad on the engine of his car. Mostly this was a matter of me handing him wrenches.
author: Mireille Enos

content: My dad has no control over who works with me. Me, me and me alone has to take responsibility for anything.
author: Shane MacGowan

content: My dad served in two wars has been flying airplanes for 60 years now. He was certainly quite an inspiration.
author: John L. Phillips

content: I remember my dad, who coached football, would buy some of his players football shoes when they couldn't afford it.
author: Chaske Spencer

content: We all have roles in life. I'm a dad, a husband, this and that, but basically I only feel justified in being alive when I'm on the stage.
author: Jack Bruce

content: Dad worked his entire career as an aviation technician. Mom was a legal secretary who became a teacher. We lived a simple American life.
author: Brian Sandoval

content: My dad was a good athlete. My mom had longevity. There were some athletic genes that certainly got passed down.
author: Hale Irwin

content: I've always had an affinity for lawyers. My dad is a lawyer. He's retired now. My brother is a lawyer.
author: Scott Bakula

content: I was brought up in a car family, my dad loved cars and I was taught the art of making an Austin 7 operate.
author: Nick Mason

content: My dad was an inventor, and I think I've always had a rosy view of technology, or at least its potential.
author: Scott McCloud

content: I also turn down what's probably a good amount of coinage to be made out of playing dads, an incredible number of obnoxious dad.
author: Bill Pullman

content: I lost my mother, who suffered from Alzheimer's disease, and we had to relocate my dad after 58 years in the family home. That was tough.
author: Doug Davidson

content: Nothing is perfect. Life is messy. Relationships are complex. Outcomes are uncertain. People are irrational.
author: Hugh Mackay

content: It seems essential, in relationships and all tasks, that we concentrate only on what is most significant and important.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

content: Personally, I don't like a girlfriend to have a husband. If she'll fool her husband, I figure she'll fool me.
author: Orson Welles

content: You know when I feel inwardly beautiful? When I am with my girlfriends and we are having a 'goddess circle'.
author: Jennifer Aniston

content: If you don't have a valentine, hang out with your girlfriends, don't go looking for someone. When it's right, they'll come to you.
author: Carmen Electra

content: I'm 31 now. I think I'm beginning to understand what life is, what romance is, and what a relationship means.
author: Adam Sandler

content: Watching your daughter being collected by her date feels like handing over a million dollar Stradivarius to a gorilla.
author: Jim Bishop

content: I can't even find someone for a platonic relationship, much less the kind where someone wants to see me naked.
author: Gilbert Gottfried

content: I suppose I was a little bit of what would be called today a nerd. I didn't have girlfriends, and really I wasn't a very social boy.
author: Charles Kuralt

content: Practically all the relationships I know are based on a foundation of lies and mutually accepted delusion.
author: Kim Cattrall

content: My boyfriend calls me 'princess', but I think of myself more along the lines of 'monkey' and 'retard'.
author: Alicia Silverstone

content: I have a lot of boyfriends, I want you to write that. Every country I visit, I have a different boyfriend. And I kiss them all.
author: Anna Kournikova

content: I always say now that I'm in my blonde years. Because since the end of my marriage, all of my girlfriends have been blonde.
author: Hugh Hefner

content: Maybe the most that you can expect from a relationship that goes bad is to come out of it with a few good songs.
author: Marianne Faithfull

content: You show your vulnerability through relationships, and those feelings are your soft spot. You need to have a soft spot.
author: Victoria Pratt

content: I think if I could have a boyfriend like my brothers I'd be really happy. But without the brother thing.
author: Patricia Velasquez

content: Relationships in general make people a bit nervous. It's about trust. Do I trust you enough to go there?
author: Neil LaBute

content: I started dating older men, and I would fall in love with them. I thought they could teach me about life.
author: Daphne Zuniga

content: Appearance is something you should definitely consider when you're going out. Have your girlfriend clip your nails or something like that.
author: Usher

content: I want my audience to know me for my work, not because of who I'm dating or what drugs I'm on or what club I went to.
author: Shia LaBeouf

content: Good-looking individuals are treated better than homely ones in virtually every social situation, from dating to trial by jury.
author: Martha Beck

content: When I was first divorced, I started dating younger women, and it was really exciting. But after a while I was like, 'This is just dumb.'
author: Louis C. K.

content: I can't imagine dating a boy, meeting him only outside the home. What's a home and family for if it's not the center of one's life?
author: Loretta Young

content: I give dating advice on a regular basis. It's not that I'm any expert, but it's always nice to share that with your friends.
author: Ashley Tisdale

content: I grew up in the world of bad television, on my dad's sets and then as a young schmuck on dating shows and so on.
author: George Clooney

content: No one knew me until I met my wife Lulu. Lulu's mother used to ask, Which one is Maurice? For six months she thought Lulu was dating Barry.
author: Maurice Gibb

content: I don't know why anyone would want to ask an actor for dating advice. We are not the poster children for healthy relationships.
author: Ginnifer Goodwin

content: Dating is really hard because everyone puts on a front. It's really difficult to see who is who, so it is important to be yourself.
author: Brooke Burke

content: At the time that I knew them, they were not living together. They began dating again after their divorce, so I didn't really see fighting.
author: Kato Kaelin

content: Dodi got a lot of criticism when he began dating Princess Diana. No one seemed to think he was good enough for her.
author: Lorna Luft

content: I've had a little bad, bad media luck the new year. Well, apparently I'm dating Bill Clinton, which makes me nervous. I didn't know, though.
author: Julie Bowen

content: Dating is different when you get older. You're not as trusting, or as eager to get back out there and expose yourself to someone.
author: Toni Braxton

content: Stuff about me dating Kim Kardashian - I have no idea where that came from and all these other rumors. I don't think I'm that type.
author: Jeremy Lin

content: My daughter's mother and I are no longer dating, and the people I'm most likely to date are those around me, who are athletes.
author: Tyson Gay

content: Work takes up a lot of my brain space. So when I work, it's one thing. I don't have a lot of time to think about dating.
author: Chris Pine

content: I can't wait for my little sisters to start dating, because it will really be fun to pick on their boyfriends.
author: David Gallagher

content: My original inspiration was my mom: a few years after the death of my dad, she started dating one my teachers!
author: Meg Cabot

content: I was dating a guy that was a huge wrestling fan and I'm embarrassed to say it now but I used to make fun of him for watching it.
author: Torrie Wilson

content: To be idle is a short road to death and to be diligent is a way of life foolish people are idle, wise people are diligent.
author: Buddha

content: The fear of death is the most unjustified of all fears, for there's no risk of accident for someone who's dead.
author: Albert Einstein

content: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.
author: Mark Twain

content: What we have done for ourselves alone dies with us what we have done for others and the world remains and is immortal.
author: Albert Pike

content: Life is hard. Then you die. Then they throw dirt in your face. Then the worms eat you. Be grateful it happens in that order.
author: David Gerrold

content: Death most resembles a prophet who is without honor in his own land or a poet who is a stranger among his people.
author: Khalil Gibran

content: Let no one weep for me, or celebrate my funeral with mourning for I still live, as I pass to and fro through the mouths of men.
author: Quintus Ennius

content: A dying man needs to die, as a sleepy man needs to sleep, and there comes a time when it is wrong, as well as useless, to resist.
author: Stewart Alsop

content: I've told my children that when I die, to release balloons in the sky to celebrate that I graduated. For me, death is a graduation.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

content: Death is a very dull, dreary affair, and my advice to you is to have nothing whatsoever to do with it.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

content: Millions long for immortality who don't know what to do with themselves on a rainy Sunday afternoon.
author: Susan Ertz

content: Life is better than death, I believe, if only because it is less boring, and because it has fresh peaches in it.
author: Alice Walker

content: To himself everyone is immortal he may know that he is going to die, but he can never know that he is dead.
author: Samuel Butler

content: Men fear death as children fear to go in the dark and as that natural fear in children is increased by tales, so is the other.
author: Francis Bacon

content: It is possible to provide security against other ills, but as far as death is concerned, we men live in a city without walls.
author: Epicurus

content: He who is completely sanctified, or cleansed from all sin, and dies in this state, is fit for glory.
author: Adam Clarke

content: We cannot banish dangers, but we can banish fears. We must not demean life by standing in awe of death.
author: David Sarnoff

content: John Candy knew he was going to die. He told me on his 40th birthday. He said, well, Maureen, I'm on borrowed time.
author: Maureen O'Hara

content: A nation or civilization that continues to produce soft-minded men purchases its own spiritual death on the installment plan.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

content: You can change your world by changing your words... Remember, death and life are in the power of the tongue.
author: Joel Osteen

content: The only difference between death and taxes is that death doesn't get worse every time Congress meets.
author: Will Rogers

content: Fear of death makes us devoid both of valour and religion. For want of valour is want of religious faith.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: One can survive everything, nowadays, except death, and live down everything except a good reputation.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: Death comes to all, but great achievements build a monument which shall endure until the sun grows cold.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: I look upon death to be as necessary to our constitution as sleep. We shall rise refreshed in the morning.
author: Benjamin Franklin

content: The boundaries which divide Life from Death are at best shadowy and vague. Who shall say where the one ends, and where the other begins?
author: Edgar Allan Poe

content: Death is a challenge. It tells us not to waste time... It tells us to tell each other right now that we love each other.
author: Leo Buscaglia

content: The 'kingdom of Heaven' is a condition of the heart - not something that comes 'upon the earth' or 'after death.'
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: Let us beware of saying that death is the opposite of life. The living being is only a species of the dead, and a very rare species.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: I have thought there was some advantage even in death, by which we mingle with the herd of common men.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: Men are convinced of your arguments, your sincerity, and the seriousness of your efforts only by your death.
author: Albert Camus

content: There will be no lasting peace either in the heart of individuals or in social customs until death is outlawed.
author: Albert Camus

content: The safest course is to do nothing against one's conscience. With this secret, we can enjoy life and have no fear from death.
author: Voltaire

content: We cast away priceless time in dreams, born of imagination, fed upon illusion, and put to death by reality.
author: Judy Garland

content: Madame, all stories, if continued far enough, end in death, and he is no true-story teller who would keep that from you.
author: Ernest Hemingway

content: Know one knows whether death, which people fear to be the greatest evil, may not be the greatest good.
author: Plato

content: I simply can't build my hopes on a foundation of confusion, misery and death... I think... peace and tranquillity will return again.
author: Anne Frank

content: It is vain for the coward to flee death follows close behind it is only by defying it that the brave escape.
author: Voltaire

content: Death is a commingling of eternity with time in the death of a good man, eternity is seen looking through time.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: Because I could not stop for death, He kindly stopped for me The carriage held but just ourselves and immortality.
author: Emily Dickinson

content: The death of my father is probably the biggest thing that I ever faced. Daddy and I were best friends.
author: Joel Osteen

content: As long as your body is healthy and under control and death is distant, try to save your soul when death is immanent what can you do?
author: Chanakya

content: If a man can bridge the gap between life and death, if he can live on after he's dead, then maybe he was a great man.
author: James Dean

content: There are worse things in life than death. Have you ever spent an evening with an insurance salesman?
author: Woody Allen

content: If death meant just leaving the stage long enough to change costume and come back as a new character, would you slow down? Or speed up?
author: Chuck Palahniuk

content: There's something about death that is comforting. The thought that you could die tomorrow frees you to appreciate your life now.
author: Angelina Jolie

content: Any man's death diminishes me, because I am involved in Mankind And therefore never send to know for whom the bell tolls it tolls for thee.
author: John Donne

content: Prohibit the taking of omens, and do away with superstitious doubts. Then, until death itself comes, no calamity need be feared.
author: Sun Tzu

content: There is no such thing as inner peace. There is only nervousness or death. Any attempt to prove otherwise constitutes unacceptable behavior.
author: Fran Lebowitz

content: He who is the author of a war lets loose the whole contagion of hell and opens a vein that bleeds a nation to death.
author: Thomas Paine

content: If I think more about death than some other people, it is probably because I love life more than they do.
author: Angelina Jolie

content: No matter how prepared you think you are for the death of a loved one, it still comes as a shock, and it still hurts very deeply.
author: Billy Graham

content: Death does not concern us, because as long as we exist, death is not here. And when it does come, we no longer exist.
author: Epicurus

content: A complainer is like a Death Eater because there's a suction of negative energy. You can catch a great attitude from great people.
author: Barbara Corcoran

content: The symbolic language of the crucifixion is the death of the old paradigm resurrection is a leap into a whole new way of thinking.
author: Deepak Chopra

content: Shrinking away from death is something unhealthy and abnormal which robs the second half of life of its purpose.
author: Carl Jung

content: We need men with moral courage to speak and write their real thoughts, and to stand by their convictions, even to the very death.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

content: Since change is constant, you wonder if people crave death because it's the only way they can get anything really finished.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

content: If we have been pleased with life, we should not be displeased with death, since it comes from the hand of the same master.
author: Michelangelo

content: Death is the king of this world: 'Tis his park where he breeds life to feed him. Cries of pain are music for his banquet.
author: George Eliot

content: Death is not natural for a state as it is for a human being, for whom death is not only necessary, but frequently even desirable.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

content: I don't fear death because I don't fear anything I don't understand. When I start to think about it, I order a massage and it goes away.
author: Hedy Lamarr

content: When death, the great reconciler, has come, it is never our tenderness that we repent of, but our severity.
author: George Eliot

content: All violence consists in some people forcing others, under threat of suffering or death, to do what they do not want to do.
author: Leo Tolstoy

content: I thank my God for graciously granting me the opportunity of learning that death is the key which unlocks the door to our true happiness.
author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

content: One is still what one is going to cease to be and already what one is going to become. One lives one's death, one dies one's life.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

content: Wild animals never kill for sport. Man is the only one to whom the torture and death of his fellow creatures is amusing in itself.
author: James Anthony Froude

content: A man must be willing to die for justice. Death is an inescapable reality and men die daily, but good deeds live forever.
author: Jesse Jackson

content: We sometimes congratulate ourselves at the moment of waking from a troubled dream it may be so the moment after death.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

content: When the will defies fear, when duty throws the gauntlet down to fate, when honor scorns to compromise with death - that is heroism.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

content: Some people think football is a matter of life and death. I assure you, it's much more serious than that.
author: Bill Shankly

content: People have their own deaths as well as their own lives, and even if there is nothing beyond death, we shall differ in our nothingness.
author: E. M. Forster

content: Men do not accept their prophets and slay them, but they love their martyrs and worship those whom they have tortured to death.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

content: Don't be afraid to feel as angry or as loving as you can, because when you feel nothing, it's just death.
author: Lena Horne

content: A country that relies on aid? Death is better than that. It stops you from achieving your potential, just as colonialism did.
author: Imran Khan

content: The Teutons have been singing the swan song ever since they entered the ranks of history. They have always confounded truth with death.
author: Henry Miller

content: What you possess in the world will be found at the day of your death to belong to someone else. But what you are will be yours forever.
author: Henry Van Dyke

content: The darkness of death is like the evening twilight it makes all objects appear more lovely to the dying.
author: Jean Paul

content: I've looked that old scoundrel death in the eye many times but this time I think he has me on the ropes.
author: Douglas MacArthur

content: Death doesn't affect the living because it has not happened yet. Death doesn't concern the dead because they have ceased to exist.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

content: A tragedy need not have blood and death it's enough that it all be filled with that majestic sadness that is the pleasure of tragedy.
author: Jean Racine

content: The fear of death often proves mortal, and sets people on methods to save their Lives, which infallibly destroy them.
author: Joseph Addison

content: As long as you have capital punishment there is no guarantee that innocent people won't be put to death.
author: Paul Simon

content: A real hangover is nothing to try out family remedies on. The only cure for a real hangover is death.
author: Robert Benchley

content: Death comes at you no matter what you do in this life, and to equate drugs with death is a facile comparison.
author: Jerry Garcia

content: The government is tottering. We must deal it the death blow an any cost. To delay action is the same as death.
author: Vladimir Lenin

content: I was court-martialled in my absence, and sentenced to death in my absence, so I said they could shoot me in my absence.
author: Brendan Behan

content: I went to medical school because I wanted to ask the big questions. Do we have a soul? Does God exist? What happens after death?
author: Deepak Chopra

content: Communism possesses a language which every people can understand - its elements are hunger, envy, and death.
author: Heinrich Heine

content: Man, as long as he lives, is immortal. One minute before his death he shall be immortal. But one minute later, God wins.
author: Elie Wiesel

content: Death is not the biggest fear we have our biggest fear is taking the risk to be alive - the risk to be alive and express what we really are.
author: Miguel Angel Ruiz

content: I never really got on that well with Yoko anyway. Strangely enough, I only started to get to know her after John's death.
author: Paul McCartney

content: Success is like death. The more successful you become, the higher the houses in the hills get and the higer the fences get.
author: Kevin Spacey

content: All societies on the verge of death are masculine. A society can survive with only one man no society will survive a shortage of women.
author: Germaine Greer

content: Being an old maid is like death by drowning, a really delightful sensation after you cease to struggle.
author: Edna Ferber

content: The acceptance of death gives you more of a stake in life, in living life happily, as it should be lived. Living for the moment.
author: Sting

content: What is the value of sticking a microphone in a man's face right after he has learned of his wife's death?
author: Jessica Savitch

content: 'Til the infallibility of human judgements shall have been proved to me, I shall demand the abolition of the penalty of death.
author: Marquis de Sade

content: An insatiable appetite for glory leads to sacrifice and death, but innate instinct leads to self-preservation and life.
author: Jose Marti

content: Salman Rushdie, indeed any writer who abuses the prophet or indeed any prophet under Islamic law, the sentence for that is actually death.
author: Cat Stevens

content: It is natural to indulge in the illusions of hope. We are apt to shut our eyes to that siren until she allures us to our death.
author: Gertrude Stein

content: Death is the great hope of all life the desire to expend itself to be used and consumed by its own longing for itself.
author: Bryant H. McGill

content: O Death, rock me asleep, bring me to quiet rest, let pass my weary guiltless ghost out of my careful breast.
author: Anne Boleyn

content: Death comes in a flash, and that's the truth of it, the person's gone in less than 24 frames of film.
author: Martin Scorsese

content: I was court-martial in my absence, and sentenced to death in my absence, so I said they could shoot me in my absence.
author: Thomas Hardy

content: You've never seen death? Look in the mirror every day and you will see it like bees working in a glass hive.
author: Jean Cocteau

content: The world is put back by the death of every one who has to sacrifice the development of his or her peculiar gifts to conventionality.
author: Florence Nightingale

content: Andrew Wood's death changed things for a few weeks. I probably got even heavier into drugs after that.
author: Layne Staley

content: Nothing endears so much a friend as sorrow for his death. The pleasure of his company has not so powerful an influence.
author: David Hume

content: I saw also that there was an ocean of darkness and death, but an infinite ocean of light and love, which flowed over the ocean of darkness.
author: George Fox

content: As long as you don't make waves, ripples, life seems easy. But that's condemning yourself to impotence and death before you are dead.
author: Jeanne Moreau

content: Old age, calm, expanded, broad with the haughty breadth of the universe, old age flowing free with the delicious near-by freedom of death.
author: Edith Wharton

content: People praise virtue, but they hate it, they run away from it. It freezes you to death, and in this world you've got to keep your feet warm.
author: Denis Diderot

content: Families survive, one way or another. You have a tie, a connection that exists long after death, through many lifetimes.
author: Jessica Lange

content: In the last analysis, it is our conception of death which decides our answers to all the questions that life puts to us.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

content: The compact which exists between the North and the South is a covenant with death and an agreement with hell.
author: William Lloyd Garrison

content: I don't think kids have a problem with death. It's us older ones who are nearer to it, that start being frightened.
author: Helena Bonham Carter

content: Take everything easy and quit dreaming and brooding and you will be well guarded from a thousand evils.
author: Amy Lowell

content: Cherish your visions and your dreams as they are the children of your soul, the blueprints of your ultimate achievements.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams who looks inside, awakes.
author: Carl Jung

content: I prefer to be a dreamer among the humblest, with visions to be realized, than lord among those without dreams and desires.
author: Khalil Gibran

content: But I, being poor, have only my dreams I have spread my dreams under your feet Tread softly because you tread on my dreams.
author: William Butler Yeats

content: A man is a god in ruins. When men are innocent, life shall be longer, and shall pass into the immortal, as gently as we awake from dreams.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: I really had a lot of dreams when I was a kid, and I think a great deal of that grew out of the fact that I had a chance to read a lot.
author: Bill Gates

content: We cast away priceless time in dreams, born of imagination, fed upon illusion, and put to death by reality.
author: Judy Garland

content: Man, alone, has the power to transform his thoughts into physical reality man, alone, can dream and make his dreams come true.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: I'd say it's been my biggest problem all my life... it's money. It takes a lot of money to make these dreams come true.
author: Walt Disney

content: If you dream the proper dreams, and share the myths with people, they will want to grow up to be like you.
author: Ray Bradbury

content: Dreams do come true, if we only wish hard enough, You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.
author: James M. Barrie

content: It is not true that people stop pursuing dreams because they grow old, they grow old because they stop pursuing dreams.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

content: In my dreams I hear again the crash of guns, the rattle of musketry, the strange, mournful mutter of the battlefield.

content: No matter how carefully you plan your goals they will never be more than pipe dreams unless you pursue them with gusto.
author: W. Clement Stone

content: I never ask a man what his business is, for it never interests me. What I ask him about are his thoughts and dreams.
author: H. P. Lovecraft

content: The life of a man consists not in seeing visions and in dreaming dreams, but in active charity and in willing service.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

content: You have all the reason in the world to achieve your grandest dreams. Imagination plus innovation equals realization.
author: Denis Waitley

content: There's nothing as exciting as a comeback - seeing someone with dreams, watching them fail, and then getting a second chance.
author: Rachel Griffiths

content: The world is seldom what it seems to man, who dimly sees, realities appear as dreams, and dreams realities.
author: Samuel Johnson

content: Common sense tells us that the things of the earth exist only a little, and that true reality is only in dreams.
author: Charles Baudelaire

content: An athlete cannot run with money in his pockets. He must run with hope in his heart and dreams in his head.
author: Emil Zatopek

content: I want my boys to have an understanding of people's emotions, their insecurities, people's distress, and their hopes and dreams.
author: Princess Diana

content: To the degree we're not living our dreams, our comfort zone has more control of us than we have over ourselves.
author: Peter McWilliams

content: It takes someone with a vision of the possibilities to attain new levels of experience. Someone with the courage to live his dreams.
author: Les Brown

content: Our dreams must be stronger than our memories. We must be pulled by our dreams, rater than pushed by our memories.

content: I can never decide whether my dreams are the result of my thoughts, or my thoughts the result of my dreams.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

content: A test of what is real is that it is hard and rough. Joys are found in it, not pleasure. What is pleasant belongs to dreams.

content: Dreams are not without meaning wherever thay may come from-from fantasy, from the elements, or from other inspiration.
author: Paracelsus

content: I just write what I wanted to write. I write what amuses me. It's totally for myself. I never in my wildest dreams expected this popularity.
author: J. K. Rowling

content: People are never more insecure than when they become obsessed with their fears at the expense of their dreams.
author: Norman Cousins

content: Much can be inferred about a man from his mistress: in her one beholds his weaknesses and his dreams.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

content: I just kind of wake up with a new idea and new dreams every day, and I follow that dream, as they say.

content: I'm aware of the mystery around us, so I write about coincidences, premonitions, emotions, dreams, the power of nature, magic.
author: Isabel Allende

content: Dreams don't have deadlines. I'm thinking of doing bigger and better things and having more fun with it.
author: LL Cool J

content: Hope lies in dreams, in imagination, and in the courage of those who dare to make dreams into reality.
author: Jonas Salk

content: Take pleasure in your dreams relish your principles and drape your purest feelings on the heart of a precious lover.

content: A friend told me that teenage girls are always looking for someone to pin their dreams on. That doesn't make it any less weird though.
author: Orlando Bloom

content: I have had dreams and I have had nightmares, but I have conquered my nightmares because of my dreams.

content: A successful life is one that is lived through understanding and pursuing one's own path, not chasing after the dreams of others.
author: Chin-Ning Chu

content: Do It Under the Influence Yourself! That's what we're shooting for! Get drunk and make your dreams come true.
author: Aziz Ansari

content: I've had quite a lot of luck with dreams. I've often awoken in the night with a phrase or even a whole song in my head.

content: With unemployment still abysmally high, the Obama economy is crushing Hispanics' dreams for their children to live a better life.
author: Marco Rubio

content: The curse of the romantic is a greed for dreams, an intensity of expectation that, in the end, diminishes the reality.
author: Marya Mannes

content: Reality seems valueless by comparison with the dreams of fevered imaginations reality is therefore abandoned.
author: Emile Durkheim

content: Acting is also working with people who invite you into their dreams and trust you with their innermost being.
author: Catherine Deneuve

content: I was not looking for my dreams to interpret my life, but rather for my life to interpret my dreams.

content: My mother taught me that we all have the power to achieve our dreams. What I lacked was the courage.

content: People ask how can a Jewish kid from the Bronx do preppy clothes? Does it have to do with class and money? It has to do with dreams.
author: Ralph Lauren

content: Death is the mother of Beauty hence from her, alone, shall come fulfillment to our dreams and our desires.
author: Wallace Stevens

content: Our politics are our deepest form of expression: they mirror our past experiences and reflect our dreams and aspirations for the future.
author: Paul Wellstone

content: Dreams do come true, even for someone who couldn't speak English and never had a music lesson or much of an education.
author: Lawrence Welk

content: Believe it or not, lots of people change their majors and abandon their dreams just to avoid a couple of math classes in college.
author: Danica McKellar

content: Dreams are the seeds of change. Nothing ever grows without a seed, and nothing ever changes without a dream.
author: Debby Boone

content: Worse than not realizing the dreams of your youth, would be to have been young and never dreamed at all.

content: Only in dreams, in poetry, in play do we sometimes arrive at what we were before we were this thing that, who knows, we are.

content: Seems like God don't see fit to give the black man nothing but dreams - but He did give us children to make them dreams seem worthwhile.

content: I paint what cannot be photographed, that which comes from the imagination or from dreams, or from an unconscious drive.

content: Today, I'm very happy about myself, because I realized my dreams. I learned how to understand what people want.

content: Women are not in love with me but with the picture of me on the screen. I am merely the canvas on which women paint their dreams.

content: It's not like I don't have my own wants and dreams anymore - it's just that the kids come first. It's primal.

content: In a couple, sometimes, one or both people have to give up their personal life, dreams and ambitions for the good of the family.

content: I am consumed with the fear of failing. Reaching deep down and finding confidence has made all my dreams come true.
author: Arsenio Hall

content: Everyone wants to look their best, everyone has dreams of wanting to look like something else. But we are who we are.

content: A player dreams of being a superstar, but he doesn't want people flocking all over him asking for an autograph.

content: Cherish your visions and your dreams, as they are the children of your soul the blueprints of your ultimate achievements.
author: Napolean Hill

content: Never set limits, go after your dreams, don't be afraid to push the boundaries. And laugh a lot - it's good for you!
author: Paula Radcliffe

content: Those born into poverty or on the margins of society require our extra support to realize their dreams.

content: I know it sounds corny, but when you follow your dreams, it happens. And if it's music, take it seriously.
author: Enrique Iglesias

content: You have the dreams that you want, and then you have to do other jobs until you can get to that dream.

content: I save my dreams and hopes for my kids. When I'm making a wish under a bridge or tunnel, it's always for them.

content: My father, his spirit is with me constantly, and I'm a believer in that world and the world of dreams and that stuff.

content: I've been interested in dreams since I as a kid and I've wanted to do a film about them for a long time.
author: Christopher Nolan

content: There is hope in dreams, imagination, and in the courage of those who wish to make those dreams a reality.
author: Jonas Salk

content: Dreams have always expanded our understanding of reality by challenging our boundaries of the real, of the possible.

content: I was always someone who lived in the future all the time, it was always the next thing - dreams of escape.

content: My dreams and aspirations when I was a child for as long as I can remember was to be an entertainer.

content: I'd really like to get the girl, shoot the gun, drive the car, have fun. I even have these kind of action dreams, where I'm the action guy.

content: I have shared my whole life. My private and my show business life. It helps me actually to feel my songs and to go on with my dreams.

content: I try to help people realize their dreams by using magic to tell stories that educate, move, and inspire.

content: Whoever I can go out every week and motivate to do better and to try to go after their dreams, I'm up for that.

content: Catcher in the Rye had a profound impact on me-the idea that we all have lots of dreams that are slowly being chipped away as we grow up.

content: Though I know he loves me, tonight my heart is sad his kiss was not so wonderful as all the dreams I had.

content: I am very lucky because I am realizing my childhood dreams, and after presenting my shows it's like a party.

content: That disturbs people when they know they didn't have the guts or integrity to stick to their dreams.

content: My work is to reach people with ideas, hopes, dreams, encouragement, insight, and revelation. That's what an actor wants to do.

content: My wife is beginning to instruct me on means to retrieve dreams, and bit by bit, it does seem to be working.

content: It never occurred to me that I'd be on a television show or in feature films but when those came into play my dreams changed along the way.

content: I can't sing but I can understand wanting to keep a balance, trying to pursue dreams, while creating a stable environment for my children.

content: Everyone dreams, but not everybody remembers their dreams because some people go into delta they go too low.

content: My mother was really my partner in every project that I had. She was just the great enabler of my dreams.
author: Diane Keaton

content: What's interesting is, for myself, when I become really attracted to somebody, I find them in my dreams... conversations, nothing more.

content: I think dreams can come true, but not necessarily like fairy-tales. It's not always so perfect like that.

content: As a kid, this is what I wanted my life to be. Not in my wildest dreams did I ever dare to dream that it would be this.

content: 'The Cut' is going to give someone the opportunity of a lifetime and help that person achieve his or her dreams.

content: I am a child of Hollywood and dreams. To me, to be on the red carpet is the best place in the world.

content: The old studios that mass-produced dreams are gone with the wind, just like the old downtown theaters that were the temples of the dreams.

content: When I first left Iran at the age of 13, Iran had become such a shining star - it was the point to which all my desires and dreams returned.

content: You have to work hard for what you want to achieve and you have to set goals and dreams and really go for them.

content: Ever since we were little, we were so on fire for our dreams. We never let anyone blow our flames out.

content: My childhood dreams were focused on being part of the effort to make humanity a multiplanetary species.

content: Men act out like they're horrified by marriage, but when they find the woman of their dreams, they love it.

content: If our dreams were more regular, more connected, more stable, they would also have more practical importance for us.

content: Humanity needs dreams to be able to survive the miseries of daily existence, even if only for an instant.

content: I want to still be singing at 70 years old. I want to be open to the dreams I haven't even dreamed up.

content: Man is firmly convinced that he is awake in reality he is caught in a net of sleep and dreams which he has unconsciously woven himself.

content: My dream life is just to go back to my job full-time. And be with my family. You know, regular dreams, common dreams that everyone has.

content: Dreams can still come true you need a great deal of energy and determination, and a little bit of luck.
author: Stefano Gabbana

content: When you're a young English person who wants to be an actress and you have dreams, you dream of being Vanessa Redgrave or Judi Dench.

content: Follow your passion, be prepared to work hard and sacrifice, and, above all, don't let anyone limit your dreams.

content: Jazz to me is a living music. It's a music that since its beginning has expressed the feelings, the dreams, hopes, of the people.

content: Horror, for me, has to involve some sort of fantasy. Horror is something that is in your dreams or your nightmares.

content: I don't remember my dreams. I'm one of those weird people. I know there are tricks and things you can do, but I never remember my dreams.

author: Edward Carpenter

content: I had dreams, but I didn't have the sense that they would necessarily work out. They seemed very far-fetched.
author: Greta Gerwig

content: Our fathers had their dreams we have ours the generation that follows will have its own. Without dreams and phantoms man cannot exist.

content: When you're a kid, you have these big ideas and these big dreams to make a change, or maybe you feel like you can't make a difference.

content: If you choose not to pursue your dreams, you'll still be a part of a dream - only it will be someone else's.

content: I love my early movies, but naturalism is an artist's early style. Now I want to deal with feelings, dreams, an acceptance of irrationality.

content: Books that distribute things... with as daring a freedom as we use in dreams, put us on our feet again.
author: Marsilio Ficino

content: I adore this adventure, I adore working with youth. For me it's a daily challenge, working to help these youths realize their dreams.
author: Patrick Roy

content: I appreciate everything that has been done for me. After a difficult start, I've just followed my dreams.
author: Victor Ortiz

content: My mom taught me to go after my dreams. I have this faith in myself that I must have gotten from her.
author: Amy Jo Johnson

content: Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence.

content: Education is the best friend. An educated person is respected everywhere. Education beats the beauty and the youth.
author: Chanakya

content: A liberal education is at the heart of a civil society, and at the heart of a liberal education is the act of teaching.

content: It is a thousand times better to have common sense without education than to have education without common sense.

content: I would rather entertain and hope that people learned something than educate people and hope they were entertained.

content: Why should society feel responsible only for the education of children, and not for the education of all adults of every age?

content: Data is not information, information is not knowledge, knowledge is not understanding, understanding is not wisdom.

content: The illiterate of the future will not be the person who cannot read. It will be the person who does not know how to learn.

content: Some people will never learn anything, for this reason, because they understand everything too soon.

content: Education, n.: That which discloses to the wise and disguises from the foolish their lack of understanding.
author: Ambrose Bierce

content: No man who worships education has got the best out of education... Without a gentle contempt for education no man's education is complete.

content: I prefer the company of peasants because they have not been educated sufficiently to reason incorrectly.

content: If I were again beginning my studies, I would follow the advice of Plato and start with mathematics.

content: Education... has produced a vast population able to read but unable to distinguish what is worth reading.

content: If an ignorant person is attracted by the things of the world, that is bad. But if a learned person is thus attracted, it is worse.

content: Men and women must be educated, in a great degree, by the opinions and manners of the society they live in.

content: The simplest schoolboy is now familiar with truths for which Archimedes would have sacrificed his life.

content: To penetrate and dissipate these clouds of darkness, the general mind must be strengthened by education.
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: A fool's brain digests philosophy into folly, science into superstition, and art into pedantry. Hence University education.

content: Our progress as a nation can be no swifter than our progress in education. The human mind is our fundamental resource.

content: If someone is going down the wrong road, he doesn't need motivation to speed him up. What he needs is education to turn him around.

content: Sex education may be a good idea in the schools, but I don't believe the kids should be given homework.

content: In large states public education will always be mediocre, for the same reason that in large kitchens the cooking is usually bad.

content: No man should bring children into the world who is unwilling to persevere to the end in their nature and education.

content: The highest education is that which does not merely give us information but makes our life in harmony with all existence.

content: Natural ability without education has more often raised a man to glory and virtue than education without natural ability.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: Academic qualifications are important and so is financial education. They're both important and schools are forgetting one of them.

content: The Church is not a gallery for the exhibition of eminent Christians, but a school for the education of imperfect ones.

content: We are faced with the paradoxical fact that education has become one of the chief obstacles to intelligence and freedom of thought.

content: Knowledge is power. Information is liberating. Education is the premise of progress, in every society, in every family.

content: Education is that whole system of human training within and without the school house walls, which molds and develops men.

content: At the bottom of education, at the bottom of politics, even at the bottom of religion, there must be for our race economic independence.
author: Booker T. Washington

content: America believes in education: the average professor earns more money in a year than a professional athlete earns in a whole week.
author: Evan Esar

content: I doubt whether classical education ever has been or can be successfully carried out without corporal punishment.

content: I add this, that rational ability without education has oftener raised man to glory and virtue, than education without natural ability.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

content: Education is the period during which you are being instructed by somebody you do not know, about something you do not want to know.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

content: Game shows are designed to make us feel better about the random, useless facts that are all we have left of our education.

content: Natural ability without education has more often attained to glory and virtue than education without natural ability.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

content: Upon books the collective education of the race depends they are the sole instruments of registering, perpetuating and transmitting thought.

content: Anyone who tries to make a distinction between education and entertainment doesn't know the first thing about either.
author: Marshall McLuhan

content: I think art education, especially in this country, which government pretty much ignores, is so important for young people.
author: Mikhail Baryshnikov

content: The belief that all genuine education comes about through experience does not mean that all experiences are genuinely or equally educative.

content: Education has failed in a very serious way to convey the most important lesson science can teach: skepticism.
author: David Suzuki

content: You know there is a problem with the education system when you realize that out of the 3 R's only one begins with an R.
author: Dennis Miller

content: Education is the key to success in life, and teachers make a lasting impact in the lives of their students.

content: I believe that education is all about being excited about something. Seeing passion and enthusiasm helps push an educational message.
author: Steve Irwin

content: Education is the power to think clearly, the power to act well in the worlds work, and the power to appreciate life.

content: Only a liberal senator from Massachusetts would say that a 49 percent increase in funding for education was not enough.
author: George W. Bush

content: 'Tis well enough for a servant to be bred at an University. But the education is a little too pedantic for a gentleman.
author: William Congreve

content: The main part of intellectual education is not the acquisition of facts but learning how to make facts live.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

content: Documentaries are the first line of education, and the second line of education is dramatization, such as 'The Pacific'.
author: Steven Spielberg

content: Television could perform a great service in mass education, but there's no indication its sponsors have anything like this on their minds.
author: Tallulah Bankhead

content: English usage is sometimes more than mere taste, judgment and education - sometimes it's sheer luck, like getting across the street.
author: E. B. White

content: How is it that little children are so intelligent and men so stupid? It must be education that does it.
author: Alexandre Dumas

content: Do I dare set forth here the most important, the most useful rule of all education? It is not to save time, but to squander it.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

content: Education alone can conduct us to that enjoyment which is, at once, best in quality and infinite in quantity.
author: Horace Mann

content: I always felt that I came up short in the education department, but I've come to the conclusion that we all get an education.
author: Michael J. Fox

content: A wise system of education will at last teach us how little man yet knows, how much he has still to learn.
author: John Lubbock

content: We never had it as rough as the kids have it today. Look at the price of a gallon of gas or a piece of real estate or a college education.

content: The internet could be a very positive step towards education, organisation and participation in a meaningful society.
author: Noam Chomsky

content: Those outside of autism need to understand this is an epidemic and we need more government funding, insurance coverage and education reform.
author: Jenny McCarthy

content: Versatility of education can be found in our best poetry, but the depth of mankind should be found in the philosopher.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

content: Let woman out of the home, let man into it, should be the aim of education. The home needs man, and the world outside needs woman.
author: Pearl S. Buck

content: We will invest in our people, quality education, job opportunity, family, neighborhood, and yes, a thing we call America.
author: Dan Quayle

content: Sixty years ago I knew everything now I know nothing education is a progressive discovery of our own ignorance.
author: Will Durant

content: Dialogue and education for peace can help free our hearts from the impulse toward intolerance and the rejection of others.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

content: In an era ruled by materialism and unstable geopolitics, art must be restored to the center of public education.
author: Camille Paglia

content: My education was the liberty I had to read indiscriminately and all the time, with my eyes hanging out.
author: Dylan Thomas

content: Instruction ends in the schoolroom, but education ends only with life. A child is given to the universe to be educated.

content: The primary purpose of a liberal education is to make one's mind a pleasant place in which to spend one's leisure.
author: Sydney J. Harris

content: It seems to me that at this time we need education in the obvious more than the investigation of the obscure.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

content: We pay a price when we deprive children of the exposure to the values, principles, and education they need to make them good citizens.
author: Sandra Day O'Connor

content: The main failure of education is that it has not prepared people to comprehend matters concerning human destiny.
author: Norman Cousins

content: The length of your education is less important than its breadth, and the length of your life is less important than its depth.
author: Marilyn vos Savant

content: On the diffusion of education among the people rest the preservation and perpetuation of our free institutions.
author: Daniel Webster

content: All provisions of federal, state or local law requiring or permitting discrimination in public education must yield.
author: Earl Warren

content: When I was a young musician, the only option available to pursue secondary education in music was to attend a classical conservatory.
author: Billy Joel

content: We're first on executions. We're 49th in funding public education. We're in a race with Mississippi for the bottom, and we're winning.
author: Kinky Friedman

content: There is nothing of any consequence in education, in the economy, in city planning, in social policy that does not concern black people.
author: Toni Morrison

content: Dreams do come true, even for someone who couldn't speak English and never had a music lesson or much of an education.
author: Lawrence Welk

content: The difference in the education of men and women must give the former great advantages over the latter, even where geniuses are equal.
author: Samuel Richardson

content: The world we build tomorrow is born in the stories we tell our children today. Politics moves the pieces. Education changes the game.
author: Jonathan Sacks

content: Outright bans on plastic bags may not be the best solution, but education and incentives to get people to stop using them are necessary.
author: David Suzuki

content: The trouble with people like Tony Blair is they get confused, they think intelligence is education when they're two different things.
author: David Bailey

content: There are many truths of which the full meaning cannot be realized until personal experience has brought it home.

content: My experiences have taught me a lot and I'm happy with my learnings, if not with what I went through to learn.

content: Your experiences will be yours alone. But truth and best friendship will rarely if ever disappoint you.

content: Most of the images of reality on which we base our actions are really based on vicarious experience.

content: Dramatic experience is not logical it may be subdued to the kind of coherence that we indicate when we speak, in criticism, of form.

content: Every adversity, every failure, and every heartache, carries with it the Seed of an equivalent or greater Benefit.

content: Women, like men, should try to do the impossible. And when they fail, their failure should be a challenge to others.

content: There is no loneliness greater than the loneliness of a failure. The failure is a stranger in his own house.

content: Know one knows whether death, which people fear to be the greatest evil, may not be the greatest good.

content: The weeds keep multiplying in our garden, which is our mind ruled by fear. Rip them out and call them by name.

content: I do respect people's faith, but I don't respect their manipulation of that faith in order to create fear and control.

content: It is better for you to be free of fear lying upon a pallet, than to have a golden couch and a rich table and be full of trouble.

content: Friendship is a plant of slow growth and must undergo and withstand the shocks of adversity before it is entitled to the appellation.

content: The last person they expected to connect with a screenplay was the comedic, blonde actress with the funny voice.

content: I do not want to foresee the future. I am concerned with taking care of the present. God has given me no control over the moment following.

content: Stop acting as if life is a rehearsal. Live this day as if it were your last. The past is over and gone. The future is not guaranteed.

content: Destiny is no matter of chance. It is a matter of choice. It is not a thing to be waited for, it is a thing to be achieved.
author: William Jennings Bryan

content: God wants us to prosper financially, to have plenty of money, to fulfill the destiny He has laid out for us.
author: Joel Osteen

content: Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.

content: The future rewards those who press on. I don't have time to feel sorry for myself. I don't have time to complain. I'm going to press on.

content: Happy is the person who knows what to remember of the past, what to enjoy in the present, and what to plan for in the future.
author: Arnold H. Glasow

content: Look back over the past, with its changing empires that rose and fell, and you can foresee the future, too.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: Trying to predict the future is like trying to drive down a country road at night with no lights while looking out the back window.
author: Peter Drucker

content: There is never time in the future in which we will work out our salvation. The challenge is in the moment the time is always now.
author: James A. Baldwin

content: Every man has his own destiny: the only imperative is to follow it, to accept it, no matter where it leads him.
author: Henry Miller

content: I am tomorrow, or some future day, what I establish today. I am today what I established yesterday or some previous day.
author: James Joyce

content: We must respect the past, and mistrust the present, if we wish to provide for the safety of the future.
author: Joseph Joubert

content: Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future.

content: Learn from the past, set vivid, detailed goals for the future, and live in the only moment of time over which you have any control: now.

content: Future. That period of time in which our affairs prosper, our friends are true and our happiness is assured.
author: Ambrose Bierce

content: Prejudice is a burden that confuses the past, threatens the future and renders the present inaccessible.
author: Maya Angelou

content: The future is something which everyone reaches at the rate of 60 minutes an hour, whatever he does, whoever he is.

content: History is a relentless master. It has no present, only the past rushing into the future. To try to hold fast is to be swept aside.
author: John F. Kennedy

content: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change his future by merely changing his attitude.

content: Life is a series of collisions with the future it is not the sum of what we have been, but what we yearn to be.

content: A mother's happiness is like a beacon, lighting up the future but reflected also on the past in the guise of fond memories.

content: Everyone here has the sense that right now is one of those moments when we are influencing the future.

content: Take time to gather up the past so that you will be able to draw from your experience and invest them in the future.

content: People respond when you tell them there is a great future in front of you, you can leave your past behind.

content: It is by no means an irrational fancy that, in a future existence, we shall look upon what we think our present existence, as a dream.

content: Yesterday's the past, tomorrow's the future, but today is a gift. That's why it's called the present.

content: Losers live in the past. Winners learn from the past and enjoy working in the present toward the future.

content: The danger of the past was that men became slaves. The danger of the future is that man may become robots.

content: America is false to the past, false to the present, and solemnly binds herself to be false to the future.

content: I try to learn from the past, but I plan for the future by focusing exclusively on the present. That's were the fun is.

author: John Wooden

content: The essence of statesmanship is not a rigid adherence to the past, but a prudent and probing concern for the future.

content: Neither a wise man nor a brave man lies down on the tracks of history to wait for the train of the future to run over him.

content: The worst thing that can happen in a democracy - as well as in an individual's life - is to become cynical about the future and lose hope.

content: I have realized that the past and future are real illusions, that they exist in the present, which is what there is and all there is.

content: My wish for the new millennium is for all children... to grow up wiser, and stronger and more prosperous for the future than ever before.

content: To make no mistakes is not in the power of man but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.

content: The country that is more developed industrially only shows, to the less developed, the image of its own future.

content: Philosophy finds it an easy matter to vanquish past and future evils, but the present are commonly too hard for it.

content: I welcome and seek your ideas, but do not bring me small ideas bring me big ideas to match our future.

content: If you are truly serious abut preparing your child for the future, don't teach him to subtract teach him to deduct.

content: I haven't had that one great love, which is good. I don't want that to be in the past - I want it to be in the future.

content: The future which we hold in trust for our own children will be shaped by our fairness to other people's children.

content: We cannot always assure the future of our friends we have a better chance of assuring our future if we remember who our friends are.

content: If we have to use force, it is because we are America. We are the indispensable nation. We stand tall. We see further into the future.

content: Drugs are the enemies of ambition and hope - and when we fight against drugs we are fighting for the future.

content: Map out your future - but do it in pencil. The road ahead is as long as you make it. Make it worth the trip.

content: What is past is past, there is a future left to all men, who have the virtue to repent and the energy to atone.

content: I think that the present is worth attention, one shouldn't sacrifice it to future conceptions of, of this future or that future.

content: To live for some future goal is shallow. It's the sides of the mountain that sustain life, not the top.

content: We should all be concerned about the future because we will have to spend the rest of our lives there.

content: I think that in the future, clocks won't say three o'clock anymore. They'll just get right to the point and rename three o'clock 'Pepsi.'

content: It also allows you to look as though you're not particularly from the present, future or past, either.

content: If my future were determined just by my performance on a standardized test, I wouldn't be here. I guarantee you that.

content: At every crossroads on the path that leads to the future, tradition has placed 10,000 men to guard the past.

content: To be able to sit in Donald Trump's apartment and talk about the future of corporate real estate was amazing.

content: Without memory, there is no culture. Without memory, there would be no civilization, no society, no future.

content: This time, instead of moving oceans and healing planets, let's get our bills in order and pay down the debt so we control our own future.

content: The past is not dead, it is living in us, and will be alive in the future which we are now helping to make.

content: I would like to see a future where artists think that they have a right to contemplate things like global warming.

content: As more people use social media to tell the story of the future, the wants and needs of more people will be reflected.

content: Language is the armory of the human mind, and at once contains the trophies of its past and the weapons of its future conquests.

content: You can get your money and you put it in the bank, or you can put it in the youth. You can put it in our future.

content: Kids are meeting in coffee shops and basements figuring out what's unsustainable in their communities. That's the future.

content: Ensuring quality higher education is one of the most important things we can do for future generations.

content: To live only for some future goal is shallow. It's the sides of the mountain that sustain life, not the top.

content: I'm not surfing much anymore, but I love hiking and gardening, and I'm always wearing a hat and sunblock.

content: All who call on God in true faith, earnestly from the heart, will certainly be heard, and will receive what they have asked and desired.

content: Before the throne of the Almighty, man will be judged not by his acts but by his intentions. For God alone reads our hearts.

content: God cannot give us a happiness and peace apart from Himself, because it is not there. There is no such thing.

content: There are people in the world so hungry, that God cannot appear to them except in the form of bread.

content: The more we come out and do good to others, the more our hearts will be purified, and God will be in them.

content: God is a metaphor for that which transcends all levels of intellectual thought. It's as simple as that.

content: Thank God every morning when you get up that you have something to do that day, which must be done, whether you like it or not.

content: Hope is some extraordinary spiritual grace that God gives us to control our fears, not to oust them.

content: Infinite striving to be the best is man's duty it is its own reward. Everything else is in God's hands.

content: God will prepare everything for our perfect happiness in heaven, and if it takes my dog being there, I believe he'll be there.

content: Only God Himself fully appreciates the influence of a Christian mother in the molding of character in her children.

content: He who is unable to live in society, or who has no need because he is sufficient for himself, must be either a beast or a god.

content: I distrust those people who know so well what God wants them to do, because I notice it always coincides with their own desires.

content: Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is God's gift, that's why we call it the present.

content: God writes the Gospel not in the Bible alone, but also on trees, and in the flowers and clouds and stars.

content: God wants us to prosper financially, to have plenty of money, to fulfill the destiny He has laid out for us.

content: Faith is a living, daring confidence in God's grace, so sure and certain that a man could stake his life on it a thousand times.

content: What is human warfare but just this an effort to make the laws of God and nature take sides with one party.

content: Ah, mon cher, for anyone who is alone, without God and without a master, the weight of days is dreadful.

content: You can safely assume that you've created God in your own image when it turns out that God hates all the same people you do.

content: For God so loved the World that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.

content: God lets everything happen for a reason. It's all a learning process, and you have to go from one level to another.

content: God cannot give us a happiness and peace apart from Himself, because it is not there. There is no such thing.
