author: Henry Ford

content: We all want to help one another. Human beings are like that. We want to live by each other's happiness, not by each other's misery.
author: Charlie Chaplin

content: Happiness is a ball after which we run wherever it rolls, and we push it with our feet when it stops.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: The supreme happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved loved for ourselves, or rather in spite of ourselves.
author: Victor Hugo

content: The essence of philosophy is that a man should so live that his happiness shall depend as little as possible on external things.
author: Epictetus

content: One of the first conditions of happiness is that the link between Man and Nature shall not be broken.
author: Leo Tolstoy

content: Happiness? A good cigar, a good meal, a good cigar and a good woman - or a bad woman it depends on how much happiness you can handle.
author: George Burns

content: Contempt for happiness is usually contempt for other people's happiness, and is an elegant disguise for hatred of the human race.
author: Bertrand Russell

content: Friendship improves happiness and abates misery, by the doubling of our joy and the dividing of our grief.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

content: To be perfectly happy it does not suffice to possess happiness, it is necessary to have deserved it.
author: Victor Hugo

content: Procrastination is one of the most common and deadliest of diseases and its toll on success and happiness is heavy.
author: Wayne Gretzky

content: If all our happiness is bound up entirely in our personal circumstances it is difficult not to demand of life more than it has to give.
author: Bertrand Russell

content: Morality is not the doctrine of how we may make ourselves happy, but how we may make ourselves worthy of happiness.
author: Immanuel Kant

content: My happiness grows in direct proportion to my acceptance, and in inverse proportion to my expectations.
author: Michael J. Fox

content: Fun I love, but too much fun is of all things the most loathsome. Mirth is better than fun, and happiness is better than mirth.
author: William Blake

content: Did perpetual happiness in the Garden of Eden maybe get so boring that eating the apple was justified?
author: Chuck Palahniuk

content: Imagination disposes of everything it creates beauty, justice, and happiness, which are everything in this world.
author: Blaise Pascal

content: Happiness is a byproduct of function, purpose, and conflict those who seek happiness for itself seek victory without war.
author: William S. Burroughs

content: The only happiness a brave person ever troubles themselves in asking about, is happiness enough to get their work done.
author: Thomas Carlyle

content: We're taught to be ashamed of confusion, anger, fear and sadness, and to me they're of equal value to happiness, excitement and inspiration.
author: Alanis Morissette

content: In friendship as well as love, ignorance very often contributes more to our happiness than knowledge.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

content: The health of the people is really the foundation upon which all their happiness and all their powers as a state depend.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

content: I've learned from experience that the greater part of our happiness or misery depends on our dispositions and not on our circumstances.
author: Martha Washington

content: To be stupid, selfish, and have good health are three requirements for happiness, though if stupidity is lacking, all is lost.
author: Gustave Flaubert

content: Life does not agree with philosophy: There is no happiness that is not idleness, and only what is useless is pleasurable.
author: Anton Chekhov

content: Nothing flatters a man as much as the happiness of his wife he is always proud of himself as the source of it.
author: Samuel Johnson

content: Why love if losing hurts so much? I have no answers anymore only the life I have lived. The pain now is part of the happiness then.
author: Anthony Hopkins

content: People say that money is not the key to happiness, but I always figured if you have enough money, you can have a key made.
author: Joan Rivers

content: Every possession and every happiness is but lent by chance for an uncertain time, and may therefore be demanded back the next hour.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

content: No man is happy without a delusion of some kind. Delusions are as necessary to our happiness as realities.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

content: Happiness is different from pleasure. Happiness has something to do with struggling and enduring and accomplishing.
author: George A. Sheehan

content: I have learned to seek my happiness by limiting my desires, rather than in attempting to satisfy them.
author: John Stuart Mill

content: Subordination tends greatly to human happiness. Were we all upon an equality, we should have no other enjoyment than mere animal pleasure.
author: Samuel Johnson

content: I thank my God for graciously granting me the opportunity of learning that death is the key which unlocks the door to our true happiness.
author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

content: Self-pity comes so naturally to all of us. The most solid happiness can be shaken by the compassion of a fool.
author: Andre Maurois

content: The happiness of the bee and the dolphin is to exist. For man it is to know that and to wonder at it.
author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

content: Beauty for some provides escape, who gain a happiness in eyeing the gorgeous buttocks of the ape or Autumn sunsets exquisitely dying.
author: Langston Hughes

content: While we are focusing on fear, worry, or hate, it is not possible for us to be experiencing happiness, enthusiasm or love.
author: Bo Bennett

content: Caring about others, running the risk of feeling, and leaving an impact on people, brings happiness.
author: Harold Kushner

content: Plenty of people miss their share of happiness, not because they never found it, but because they didn't stop to enjoy it.
author: William Feather

content: There is no end of craving. Hence contentment alone is the best way to happiness. Therefore, acquire contentment.
author: Sivananda

content: I refuse to accept other people's ideas of happiness for me. As if there's a 'one size fits all' standard for happiness.
author: Kanye West

content: There is nothing which has yet been contrived by man, by which so much happiness is produced as by a good tavern.
author: Samuel Johnson

content: Happiness is the only sanction of life where happiness fails, existence remains a mad and lamentable experiment.
author: George Santayana

content: You traverse the world in search of happiness, which is within the reach of every man. A contented mind confers it on all.
author: Horace

content: To suppose that any form of government will secure liberty or happiness without any virtue in the people, is a chimerical idea.
author: James Madison

content: Self-esteem is as important to our well-being as legs are to a table. It is essential for physical and mental health and for happiness.
author: Louise Hart

content: Happiness is inward, and not outward and so, it does not depend on what we have, but on what we are.
author: Henry Van Dyke

content: If you ever find happiness by hunting for it, you will find it, as the old woman did her lost spectacles, safe on her own nose all the time.
author: Josh Billings

content: People are surprised at how down-to-earth I am. I like to stay home on Friday nights and listen to 'The Art of Happiness' by the Dalai Lama.
author: Carmen Electra

content: Happiness always looks small while you hold it in your hands, but let it go, and you learn at once how big and precious it is.
author: Maxim Gorky

content: What would there be in a story of happiness? Only what prepares it, only what destroys it can be told.
author: Andre Gide

content: You take away all the other luxuries in life, and if you can make someone smile and laugh, you have given the most special gift: happiness.
author: Brad Garrett

content: Happiness is your dentist telling you it won't hurt and then having him catch his hand in the drill.
author: Johnny Carson

content: And one who is just of his own free will shall not lack for happiness and he will never come to utter ruin.
author: Aeschylus

content: To be obliged to beg our daily happiness from others bespeaks a more lamentable poverty than that of him who begs his daily bread.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

content: One of the indictments of civilizations is that happiness and intelligence are so rarely found in the same person.
author: William Feather

content: If you have not taken the time to define what happiness means to you, what have your spent your whole life pursuing?
author: Bo Bennett

content: There is only one way to achieve happiness on this terrestrial ball, and that is to have either a clear conscience or none at all.
author: Ogden Nash

content: So long as you don't feel life's paltry and a miserable business, the rest doesn't matter, happiness or unhappiness.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

content: Happiness is an attitude of mind, born of the simple determination to be happy under all outward circumstances.
author: J. Donald Walters

content: Grief knits two hearts in closer bonds than happiness ever can and common sufferings are far stronger links than common joys.
author: Alphonse de Lamartine

content: I wish people could acheive what they think would bring them happiness in order for them to realize that thats not really what happiness is.
author: Alanis Morissette

content: Success is getting and achieving what you want. Happiness is wanting and being content with what you get.
author: Bernard Meltzer

content: Happiness and virtue rest upon each other the best are not only the happiest, but the happiest are usually the best.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

content: An act of goodness is of itself an act of happiness. No reward coming after the event can compare with the sweet reward that went with it.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

content: In theory there is a possibility of perfect happiness: To believe in the indestructible element within one, and not to strive towards it.
author: Franz Kafka

content: I really love being alive. I love my family and my work. I love the opportunity I have to do things. That's what happiness is.
author: Michael J. Fox

content: If thou be industrious to procure wealth, be generous in the disposal of it. Man never is so happy as when he giveth happiness unto another.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

content: Objects we ardently pursue bring little happiness when gained most of our pleasures come from unexpected sources.
author: Herbert Spencer

content: Life is to be fortified by many friendships. To love and to be loved is the greatest happiness of existence.
author: Sydney Smith

content: The happiness of the creature consists in rejoicing in God, by which also God is magnified and exalted.
author: Jonathan Edwards

content: The said truth is that it is the greatest happiness of the greatest number that is the measure of right and wrong.
author: Jeremy Bentham

content: Off with you! You're a happy fellow, for you'll give happiness and joy to many other people. There is nothing better or greater than that!
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

content: You get to a certain age where you prepare yourself for happiness. Sometimes you never remember to actually get happy.
author: John Mayer

content: Sorrow happens, hardship happens, the hell with it, who never knew the price of happiness, will not be happy.
author: Yevgeny Yevtushenko

content: Happiness is spiritual, born of truth and love. It is unselfish therefore it cannot exist alone, but requires all mankind to share it.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

content: Happiness and peace will come to earth only as the light of love and human compassion enter the souls of men.
author: David O. McKay

content: Since every man desires happiness, it is evidently no small matter whether he conceives of happiness in terms of work or of enjoyment.
author: Irving Babbitt

content: The office of government is not to confer happiness, but to give men the opportunity to work out happiness for themselves.
author: William Ellery Channing

content: What can be added to the happiness of a man who is in health, out of debt, and has a clear conscience?
author: Adam Smith

content: To be able to throw one's self away for the sake of a moment, to be able to sacrifice years for a woman's smile - that is happiness.
author: Hermann Hesse

content: Maturity - among other things, the unclouded happiness of the child at play, who takes it for granted that he is at one with his play-mates.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

content: Fate often puts all the material for happiness and prosperity into a man's hands just to see how miserable he can make himself with them.
author: Don Marquis

content: As to happiness in this life it is hardly compatible with that diminished respect which ever attends the relinquishing of labour.
author: Anthony Trollope

content: As a child is indulged or checked in its early follies, a ground is generally laid for the happiness or misery of the future man.
author: Samuel Richardson

content: Happiness is a matter of one's most ordinary and everyday mode of consciousness being busy and lively and unconcerned with self.
author: Iris Murdoch

content: It is not the possession of truth, but the success which attends the seeking after it, that enriches the seeker and brings happiness to him.
author: Max Planck

content: It's horrible when people are only interested in buying labels, because it doesn't bring them the happiness they think it will.
author: Miuccia Prada

content: I enjoy being happy every day, and hopefully you can hear my happiness in my music. Life is beautiful.
author: Christina Milian

content: Most people ask for happiness on condition. Happiness can only be felt if you don't set any condition.
author: Arthur Rubinstein

content: True religion... is giving and finding one's happiness by bringing happiness into the lives of others.
author: William J. H. Boetcker

content: People will survive, and they will find happiness. Happiness only comes when you're not looking for it.
author: Hugh Laurie

content: Every poll about the Left, the Right, and happiness reveals that the farther left one goes, the less happy the person is likely to be.
author: Dennis Prager

content: I am happy as happiness goes, for a woman who has so many memories and who lives the lonely life of an actress.
author: Lillie Langtry

content: Lucky that man whose children make his happiness in life and not his grief, the anguished disappointment of his hopes.
author: Euripedes

content: You've got to ask! Asking is, in my opinion, the world's most powerful - and neglected - secret to success and happiness.
author: Percy Ross

content: You believe happiness to be derived from the place in which once you have been happy, but in truth it is centered in ourselves.
author: Franz Schubert

content: Friendship is a strong and habitual inclination in two persons to promote the good and happiness of one another.
author: Eustace Budgell

content: A comfortable house is a great source of happiness. It ranks immediately after health and a good conscience.
author: Sydney Smith

content: The purpose of human life and the sense of happiness is to give the maximum what the man is able to give.
author: Alexander Alekhine

content: It's afterwards you realize that the feeling of happiness you had with a man didn't necessarily prove that you loved him.
author: Marguerite Duras

content: So, my happiness doesn't come from money or fame. My happiness comes from seeing life without struggle.
author: Nicki Minaj

content: There is an old saying that money can't buy happiness. If it could, I would buy myself four hits every game.
author: Pete Rose

content: Remember that happiness is as contagious as gloom. It should be the first duty of those who are happy to let others know of their gladness.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

content: Happiness comes of the capacity to feel deeply, to enjoy simply, to think freely, to risk life, to be needed.
author: Storm Jameson

content: To show a child what once delighted you, to find the child's delight added to your own - this is happiness.
author: J. B. Priestley

content: I believe that my clothes can give people a better image of themselves - that it can increase their feelings of confidence and happiness.
author: Giorgio Armani

content: And perfect happiness? Man, that's a... the pool is about 92 degrees, the Jacuzzi is about 102 and an avocado farm.
author: Jamie Foxx

content: There is something in the pang of change More than the heart can bear, Unhappiness remembering happiness.
author: Euripedes

content: Pleasure only starts once the worm has got into the fruit, to become delightful happiness must be tainted with poison.
author: Georges Bataille

content: I think the secret to happiness is having a Teflon soul. Whatever comes your way, you either let it slide or you cook with it.
author: Diane Lane

content: My travels led me to where I am today. Sometimes these steps have felt painful, difficult, but led me to greater happiness and opportunites.
author: Diana Ross

content: If someday they say of me that in my work I have contributed something to the welfare and happiness of my fellow man, I shall be satisfied.
author: George Westinghouse

content: My mother was a public school teacher in Virginia, and we didn't have any money, we just survived on happiness, on being a happy family.
author: Dave Grohl

content: I love walking down the street and seeing faces and drama and happiness and sadness and dirt and cleanliness.
author: Ric Ocasek

content: So even though I consider myself a fairly upbeat person, energetic and things like that, I never do very well on happiness tests.
author: Barbara Ehrenreich

content: Joe E. Lewis said, 'Money doesn't buy happiness but it calms the nerves.' And that is how I feel about a film being well-received.
author: Alexander Payne

content: I think people really marry far too much it is such a lottery after all, and for a poor woman a very doubtful happiness.
author: Queen Victoria

content: Aye, I'm tellin' ye, happiness is one of the few things in this world that doubles every time you share it with someone else.
author: Harry Lauder

content: You can have a lot of unhappiness by not having money, but the reverse is no guarantee of happiness.
author: Philip Kaufman

content: Happiness must be cultivated. It is like character. It is not a thing to be safely let alone for a moment, or it will run to weeds.
author: Elizabeth Stuart Phelps

content: I've often thought if I didn't make my marriage work, I would have failed at my one true shot at happiness.
author: Bethenny Frankel

content: How often we fail to realize our good fortune in living in a country where happiness is more than a lack of tragedy.
author: Paul Sweeney

content: Feminism's agenda is basic: It asks that women not be forced to choose between public justice and private happiness.
author: Susan Faludi

content: Happiness, I do not know where to turn to discover you on earth, in the air or the sky yet I know you exist and are no futile dream.
author: Rosalia de Castro

content: The greatest happiness comes from being vitally interested in something that excites all your energies.
author: Walter Annenberg

content: Seek happiness for its own sake, and you will not find it seek for duty, and happiness will follow as the shadow comes with the sunshine.
author: Tryon Edwards

content: Inside every adult there's still a child that lingers. We're happiness merchants - giving people the opportunity to dream like children.
author: Guy Laliberte

content: The People have a right to the Truth as they have a right to life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness.
author: Frank Norris

content: Suspicion is far more to be wrong than right more often unjust than just. It is no friend to virtue, and always an enemy to happiness.
author: Hosea Ballou

content: The secret of happiness is the determination to be happy always, rather than wait for outer circumstances to make one happy.
author: J. Donald Walters

content: You do the right thing even if it makes you feel bad. The purpose of life is not to be happy but to be worthy of happiness.
author: Tracy Kidder

content: I think my capacity to change has given me tremendous happiness, because who I am today I am completely content to be.
author: Jamie Lee Curtis

content: The happiness of every country depends upon the character of its people, rather than the form of its government.
author: Thomas Chandler Haliburton

content: Money is not necessarily, although it helps a lot for happiness, it's not necessarily the best way to be happy, to be rich, you know.
author: Eric Ripert

content: Fame is indeed beautiful and benign and gentle and satisfying, but happiness is something at once tender and brilliant beyond all things.
author: Mary MacLane

content: I come before you to declare that my sex are entitled to the inalienable right to life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness.
author: Victoria Woodhull

content: So, after awhile, you can only get so much happiness from a guy who's drunk come up and tell you you're great.
author: Rick Derringer

content: Happiness is not that easy to achieve, but having a handsome husband, a beautiful baby, and a great job helps.
author: Ellen Pompeo

content: It's obvious, but perhaps worth saying, that happiness has virtually nothing to do with the state of your intellect.
author: Daniel Keys Moran

content: I envy the happiness of others... I envy the sense of belonging... I seem always to be remaking myself.
author: Richard Eyre

content: To seduce a woman famous for strict morals, religious fervor and the happiness of her marriage: what could possibly be more prestigious?
author: Christopher Hampton

content: Many a happiness in life, as many a disaster, can be due to chance, but the peace within us can never be governed by chance.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

content: The object of government in peace and in war is not the glory of rulers or of races, but the happiness of common man.
author: William Beveridge

content: Bring love and peace and happiness and beautiful lives into the world in my honor. Thank you. Love you.
author: Aron Ralston

content: Time the great destroyer of other men's happiness, only enlarges the patrimony of literature to its possessor.
author: Isaac D'Israeli

content: The lesson I have thoroughly learnt, and wish to pass on to others, is to know the enduring happiness that the love of a garden gives.
author: Gertrude Jekyll

content: I have a theory that the secret of marital happiness is simple: drink in different pubs to your other half.
author: Jilly Cooper

content: Michael has a connection with children, just like Mickey Mouse does, and he brings happiness to them, and joy.
author: Jermaine Jackson

content: I'm an inherently happy person. It comes from the inside, which means you can achieve happiness under any circumstance.
author: Patrick Duffy

content: I ask the rights to pursue happiness by having a voice in that government to which I am accountable.
author: Victoria Woodhull

content: The secret of happiness is: Find something more important than you are and dedicate your life to it.
author: Daniel Dennett

content: My family didn't have a lot of money, and I'm grateful for that. Money is the longest route to happiness.
author: Evangeline Lilly

content: I always looked for a man to rescue me and bring me happiness. I bought into that myth, of course, and looked for my own Prince Charming.
author: Linda Evans

content: Virtue is simply happiness, and happiness is a by-product of function. You are happy when you are functioning.
author: William Burroughs

content: He who never sacrificed a present to a future good or a personal to a general one can speak of happiness only as the blind do of colors.
author: Olympia Brown

content: Character is power it makes friends, draws patronage and support and opens the way to wealth, honor and happiness.
author: John Howe

content: For Mythology is the handmaid of literature and literature is one of the best allies of virtue and promoters of happiness.
author: Thomas Bulfinch

content: I've never seen an obese person who has said, 'I am well in my mind.' Happiness stops food being a compensation.
author: Pierre Dukan

content: It's good to follow the path of personal happiness to some extent. People tend to get upset however when you drive a steamroller down it.
author: Simon Travaglia

content: We all have to work for happiness. And you cannot listen to other people. That is the worst mistake you can make.
author: Jillian Michaels

content: Marriage is wild. I thought it was this perfect land of happiness and joy. Wrong! After you say you do, you don't for a long time.
author: John Leguizamo

content: If you can measure success in this business based on happiness alone I feel like I've hit the lottery.
author: Justin Long

content: As long as you understand that you find happiness through family, friends and love, then money is just a nice bonus.
author: Ioan Gruffudd

content: 90%, 100% are going there to hear the singing. The story is another thing. Nobody's interested in the story. Happiness is happiness.
author: Cab Calloway

content: That which makes people dissatisfied with their condition, is the chimerical idea they form of the happiness of others.
author: James Thomson

content: I've done an informal, anecdotal survey about marriage, and I've found no evidence that it brings happiness.
author: Mary McCormack

content: Although one may fail to find happiness in theatrical life, one never wishes to give it up after having once tasted its fruits.
author: Anna Pavlova

content: This is why I belong, and why I believe. I commend to all this same search for happiness and for the truth.
author: Clayton Christensen

content: If we did not look to marriage as the principal source of happiness, fewer marriages would end in tears.
author: Anthony Storr

content: I think I am missing a gene that most people have to enable them to feel happiness about success and these kind of things.
author: Bennett Miller

content: The secular world looks to the church and to its chagrin, finds no love, no life, no laughter, no hope and no happiness.
author: Rod Parsley

content: I always remembered that when I saw people get married they got on a rocketship and went to Planet Happiness, Population: Them.
author: Marc Webb

content: The only real happiness a ballplayer has is when he is playing a ball game and accomplishes something he didn't think he could do.
author: Ring Lardner

content: We pray that every field of science may contribute in bringing happiness - not disaster - to human beings.
author: Kenichi Fukui

content: Too much good fortune can make you smug and unaware. Happiness should be like an oasis, the greener for the desert that surrounds it.
author: Rachel Field

content: No period of my life has been one of such unmixed happiness as the four years which have been spent within college walls.
author: Horatio Alger

content: Although Freud said happiness is composed of love and work, reality often forces us to choose love or work.
author: Letty Cottin Pogrebin

content: The principles we live by, in business and in social life, are the most important part of happiness.
author: Harry Harrison

content: Purring would seem to be, in her case, an automatic safety valve device for dealing with happiness overflow.
author: Monica Edwards

content: To keep the body in good health is a duty... otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear.
author: Buddha

content: Everybody needs beauty as well as bread, places to play in and pray in, where nature may heal and give strength to body and soul.
author: John Muir

content: Give a man health and a course to steer, and he'll never stop to trouble about whether he's happy or not.
author: George Bernard Shaw

content: You know, all that really matters is that the people you love are happy and healthy. Everything else is just sprinkles on the sundae.
author: Paul Walker

content: Rest when you're weary. Refresh and renew yourself, your body, your mind, your spirit. Then get back to work.
author: Ralph Marston

content: True silence is the rest of the mind, and is to the spirit what sleep is to the body, nourishment and refreshment.
author: William Penn

content: When you are young and healthy, it never occurs to you that in a single second your whole life could change.
author: Annette Funicello

content: America's health care system is in crisis precisely because we systematically neglect wellness and prevention.
author: Tom Harkin

content: People who don't know how to keep themselves healthy ought to have the decency to get themselves buried, and not waste time about it.
author: Henrik Ibsen

content: My health may be better preserved if I exert myself less, but in the end doesn't each person give his life for his calling?
author: Clara Schumann

content: The minute anyone's getting anxious I say, You must eat and you must sleep. They're the two vital elements for a healthy life.
author: Francesca Annis

content: The average, healthy, well-adjusted adult gets up at seven-thirty in the morning feeling just plain terrible.
author: Jean Kerr

content: Health is the greatest possession. Contentment is the greatest treasure. Confidence is the greatest friend. Non-being is the greatest joy.
author: Lao Tzu

content: The devil has put a penalty on all things we enjoy in life. Either we suffer in health or we suffer in soul or we get fat.
author: Albert Einstein

content: The only way to keep your health is to eat what you don't want, drink what you don't like, and do what you'd rather not.
author: Mark Twain

content: When wealth is lost, nothing is lost when health is lost, something is lost when character is lost, all is lost.
author: Billy Graham

content: I heard a definition once: Happiness is health and a short memory! I wish I'd invented it, because it is very true.
author: Audrey Hepburn

content: Use your health, even to the point of wearing it out. That is what it is for. Spend all you have before you die do not outlive yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

content: The health of the eye seems to demand a horizon. We are never tired, so long as we can see far enough.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Time and health are two precious assets that we don't recognize and appreciate until they have been depleted.
author: Denis Waitley

content: Perfect freedom is as necessary to the health and vigor of commerce as it is to the health and vigor of citizenship.
author: Patrick Henry

content: All mankind... being all equal and independent, no one ought to harm another in his life, health, liberty or possessions.
author: John Locke

content: Capital is reckless of the health or length of life of the laborer, unless under compulsion from society.
author: Karl Marx

content: Health is the soul that animates all the enjoyments of life, which fade and are tasteless without it.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

content: The health of the people is really the foundation upon which all their happiness and all their powers as a state depend.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

content: To be stupid, selfish, and have good health are three requirements for happiness, though if stupidity is lacking, all is lost.
author: Gustave Flaubert

content: The worst thing that can happen to a man is to lose his money, the next worst his health, the next worst his reputation.
author: Samuel Butler

content: But the real secret to lifelong good health is actually the opposite: Let your body take care of you.
author: Deepak Chopra

content: Medicine to produce health must examine disease and music, to create harmony must investigate discord.
author: Plutarch

content: Mental health needs a great deal of attention. It's the final taboo and it needs to be faced and dealt with.
author: Adam Ant

content: What some call health, if purchased by perpetual anxiety about diet, isn't much better than tedious disease.
author: Alexander Pope

content: The health of a democratic society may be measured by the quality of functions performed by private citizens.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

content: You end up as you deserve. In old age you must put up with the face, the friends, the health, and the children you have earned.
author: Judith Viorst

content: Self-esteem is as important to our well-being as legs are to a table. It is essential for physical and mental health and for happiness.
author: Louise Hart

content: I've never had very high regard for therapists. I owe my health, my mental survival, to my friends and loved ones.
author: Salman Rushdie

content: There's a lot of people in this world who spend so much time watching their health that they haven't the time to enjoy it.
author: Josh Billings

content: Avoid lawsuits beyond all things they pervert your conscience, impair your health, and dissipate your property.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

content: And I believe that the best buy in public health today must be a combination of regular physical exercise and a healthy diet.
author: Julie Bishop

author: Amy Winehouse

content: I have been alone since my husband died. I stay in my home. I don't date. It's hard to date when you're at home. Nobody knows you.
author: Anna Nicole Smith

content: A novelist is, like all mortals, more fully at home on the surface of the present than in the ooze of the past.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

content: So I got home, and the phone was ringing. I picked it up, and said 'Who's speaking please?' And a voice said 'You are.'
author: Tim Vine

content: Home is, I suppose just a child's idea. A house at night, and a lamp in the house. A place to feel safe.
author: V. S. Naipaul

content: I always knew who I was and where I had come from. I was not looking for a home in other people's lands.
author: V. S. Naipaul

content: His claim to his home is deep, but there are too many ghosts. He must absorb without being absorbed.
author: Willie Morris

content: My work in the House of Representatives, at this time in my life, is completed. It is time to return home.
author: J. C. Watts

content: Most of American life consists of driving somewhere and then returning home, wondering why the hell you went.
author: John Updike

content: I'm a home cook and love to read about food, but I'm not trained as a chef. I'm just really into cooking and passionate about it.
author: Ted Allen

content: The only instrument I can play is piano. Whenever I make songs at home, I play the piano and make them on the piano.
author: Yoko Ono

content: I often feel very guilty because of the time that I spend outside of my home and the little time that sometimes I have for my kids.
author: Antonio Banderas

content: I have a fantastic studio in my home, and it's my biggest toy. I have about a half a million dollars worth of musical equipment in my house.
author: Antonio Banderas

content: I have a three-year-old and a four-year-old at home, and my mornings are about just dealing with the fact of that. I oddly enjoy it.
author: Damian Lewis

content: At home, you always have to be a politician when you're abroad, you almost feel yourself a statesman.
author: Harold MacMillan

content: The wonderful world of home appliances now makes it possible to cook indoors with charcoal and outdoors with gas.
author: Bill Vaughan

content: It is often easier to become outraged by injustice half a world away than by oppression and discrimination half a block from home.
author: Carl T. Rowan

content: The show doesn't drive home a lesson, but it can open up people's minds enough for them to see how stupid every kind of prejudice can be.
author: Redd Foxx

content: I bought a Yamaha-1 and I was doing 180 miles per hour home on the 405 and that's really, really crazy but I did it.
author: Nicolas Cage

content: Just as the police review their operational tactics, so we in the Home Office will review the powers available to the police.
author: Theresa May

content: Believe me, you can get into a lot of trouble being sixteen years old in a foreign country with no adult telling you when to come home.
author: Cameron Diaz

content: The silver and black may have another home, but the Raiders will always belong to the people of Los Angeles.
author: Ice Cube

content: You're always tellin' me to go out more, Go ahead, get out and see the world, But then I think, why should I? I'd rather stay home and cry.
author: Gwen Stefani

content: My family went through divorces and remarriages and the later, blended home - and then watched that home explode, too.
author: Jeffrey Kluger

content: You want to come home to a nice firm bed with the corners tucked in so you start over, like each night is like a new night.
author: Gabrielle Union

content: I don't need to be asking for money for local museums and other projects just to make me look good back home.
author: Jim DeMint

content: I chose America as my home because I value freedom and democracy, civil liberties and an open society.
author: George Soros

content: I really see myself as a homegirl. Wales is my first home. London is my second home - I've been there 14 years now.
author: Katherine Jenkins

content: In general, shorter is better. If you can encapsulate your idea into a single captivating sentence, you're halfway home.
author: Len Wein

content: An education program is, by definition, a societal program. Work should be done at school, rather than at home.
author: Francois Hollande

content: I'm not squeamish at all. As a child I dragged a dead squirrel home on my skateboard and cut it open and tried to look at its brain.
author: Jessica Biel

content: The earth is my altar, the sky is my dome, mind is my garden, the heart is my home and I'm always at home - yea, I'm always at Om.
author: Eden Ahbez

content: A girl's got to do what she's got to do to make somebody pay her a compliment. If that means moaning 'til the cows come home, then so be it.
author: Cat Deeley

content: My grandmother always taught me, 'If you don't have a home, family, and church, you don't have anything.'
author: Jennifer Hudson

content: I love being at home, being with friends and family. I'm of European stock, brought up in Australia. I'm a passionate guy. I just love life.
author: Eric Bana

content: I've done a lot of partying in my time because I didn't want to go home and I didn't know what to do.
author: Natalie Imbruglia

content: My favorite show is America's Funniest Home Videos. People will get hit on the head and I feel bad cause I'm laughing my head off!
author: Corbin Bleu

content: I'm kind of a homebody. My husband says I like to just stay home and do nothing, but that's just how I am.
author: Kristi Yamaguchi

content: I keep my own personality in a cupboard under the stairs at home so that no one else can see it or nick it.
author: Dawn French

content: New England is the home of all that is good and noble with all her sternness and uncompromising opinions.
author: Ellen Henrietta Swallow Richards

content: Mr. Bean is at his best when he is not using words, but I am equally at home in both verbal and nonverbal expression.
author: Rowan Atkinson

content: I'm very lucky. I am one of those people who is able to go home, shut the front door and completely focus on the kids.
author: Nick Clegg

content: The day I finished 'Twilight,' I came home and started bulking up. For 'New Moon,' I'm 30 pounds heavier than I was in 'Twilight.'
author: Taylor Lautner

content: Unless you have been to boarding-school when you are very young, it is absolutely impossible to appreciate the delights of living at home.
author: Roald Dahl

content: My mom enlisted in the U.S. Navy in World War II, and my parents actually bought our home thanks to the loan she got through the GI Bill.
author: Thomas Friedman

content: There's an internal battle. I need to work, I need to work, I need to work and I need to be home with my kids and the kids win.
author: Jennifer Garner

content: Five thousand people every day lose their home because of a medical bankruptcy. Most of them had insurance.
author: Debbie Stabenow

content: At one point my dad called me and said, 'You have always been a great salesman. I think it's time you come home and sell swimming pools.'
author: Courteney Cox

content: I live a dual life. On the red carpet, it's complete glam. But at home, I'm a jeans and T-shirt kind of girl. Simple can be beautiful.
author: Ashley Greene

content: I still cook at home. A lot of chefs I think don't cook at home. But I still do, I love cooking at home, I love having friends.
author: Rene Redzepi

content: If you're a misanthrope you stay at home. There are certain writers who really don't like other people. I'm not like that, I don't think.
author: Paul Theroux

content: Sometimes I do envision just being a stay at home mom but not working isn't an option for me currently.
author: Tori Spelling

content: I'm hoping someday that some kid, black or white, will hit more home runs than myself. Whoever it is, I'd be pulling for him.
author: Hank Aaron

content: When we started the show, 'Dallas' was known as the city where JFK was assassinated. By the end it was known as JR's home town.
author: Larry Hagman

content: I came home after a year and although my profession was only hairdressing, I knew I could change it.
author: Vidal Sassoon

content: I have two homes in Malibu, a home in Canada that I'm building, and I just love pouring my heart out into this part of my life.
author: Pamela Anderson

content: Reading the play at home, however fulfilling, can never be the vivacious experience that Shakespeare intended.
author: Arthur Smith

content: Christianity is not about religion. It's about faith, about being held, about being forgiven. It's about finding joy and finding home.
author: Bear Grylls

content: I only scream and scratch when something's only 'really good' or 'good', I want to be great, or let's go home.
author: Jeremy Renner

content: At home, growing up, we weren't really poor. We had everything we needed, we just didn't have what we wanted.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

content: My wife is the boss at home, and my daughters are the bosses. I am just the worker. We are a very warm family and very happy.
author: Jet Li

content: Praying privately in churches, I began to discover that heaven was my true home and also that it was here and now, woven into this life.
author: Lionel Blue

content: During the Second World War, evacuated to non-Jewish households, I encountered Christianity at home and in school.
author: Lionel Blue

content: Why go for a costly, sickly, mass-produced purebred when shelters are full of one-of-a-kind mixed breeds who are literally dying for a home?
author: Ingrid Newkirk

content: Part of the reason I sort of shot out like a cannon out of Michigan and left home at such an early age is because I had to feel independent.
author: Madonna Ciccone

content: When you have the paparazzi hiding in the bushes outside your home, the only thing you can control is how you respond publicly.
author: Portia de Rossi

content: My divorce came to me as a complete surprise. That's what happens when you haven't been home in eighteen years.
author: Lee Trevino

content: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is not to stop questioning.
author: Albert Einstein

content: My great hope is to laugh as much as I cry to get my work done and try to love somebody and have the courage to accept the love in return.
author: Maya Angelou

content: I hope to stand firm enough to not go backward, and yet not go forward fast enough to wreck the country's cause.
author: Abraham Lincoln

content: A little more persistence, a little more effort, and what seemed hopeless failure may turn to glorious success.
author: Elbert Hubbard

content: Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul - and sings the tunes without the words - and never stops at all.
author: Emily Dickinson

content: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.
author: Epicurus

content: Be careful to leave your sons well instructed rather than rich, for the hopes of the instructed are better than the wealth of the ignorant.
author: Epictetus

content: Three grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.
author: Joseph Addison

content: We must free ourselves of the hope that the sea will ever rest. We must learn to sail in high winds.
author: Aristotle Onassis

content: In the end, that's what this election is about. Do we participate in a politics of cynicism or a politics of hope?
author: Barack Obama

content: I simply can't build my hopes on a foundation of confusion, misery and death... I think... peace and tranquillity will return again.
author: Anne Frank

content: In this world you've just got to hope for the best and prepare for the worst and take whatever God sends.
author: Lucy Maud Montgomery

content: We have always held to the hope, the belief, the conviction that there is a better life, a better world, beyond the horizon.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

content: The trouble with most people is that they think with their hopes or fears or wishes rather than with their minds.
author: Will Durant

content: I have tried to keep on with my striving because this is the only hope I have of ever achieving anything worthwhile and lasting.
author: Arthur Ashe

content: It's time to get real, folks. Hope and change ain't working. Hope and change is not a solution. Hope and change is not a job.
author: Herman Cain

content: The world is bad but not without hope. It is only hopeless when you look at it from an ideal viewpoint.
author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

content: There is hope in dreams, imagination, and in the courage of those who wish to make those dreams a reality.
author: Jonas Salk

content: If people are good only because they fear punishment, and hope for reward, then we are a sorry lot indeed.
author: Albert Einstein

content: All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.
author: Winston Churchill

content: Love recognizes no barriers. It jumps hurdles, leaps fences, penetrates walls to arrive at its destination full of hope.
author: Maya Angelou

content: The hope of a secure and livable world lies with disciplined nonconformists who are dedicated to justice, peace and brotherhood.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

content: My dream is of a place and a time where America will once again be seen as the last best hope of earth.
author: Abraham Lincoln

content: Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.
author: Dale Carnegie

content: I hope our wisdom will grow with our power, and teach us, that the less we use our power the greater it will be.
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: I totally disagree with the view that the Tibet struggle will die, and there will be no hope for Tibet, after the Dalai Lama passes away.
author: Dalai Lama

content: My theory has always been, that if we are to dream, the flatteries of hope are as cheap, and pleasanter, than the gloom of despair.
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: Hope is some extraordinary spiritual grace that God gives us to control our fears, not to oust them.
author: Vincent McNabb

content: What is true of the individual will be tomorrow true of the whole nation if individuals will but refuse to lose heart and hope.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: Disappointment is a sort of bankruptcy - the bankruptcy of a soul that expends too much in hope and expectation.
author: Eric Hoffer

content: It is only by not paying one's bills that one can hope to live in the memory of the commercial classes.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: Desire is the starting point of all achievement, not a hope, not a wish, but a keen pulsating desire which transcends everything.
author: Napoleon Hill

content: And God help Bruce Springsteen when they decide he's no longer God... They'll turn on him, and I hope he survives it.
author: John Lennon

content: I would rather entertain and hope that people learned something than educate people and hope they were entertained.
author: Walt Disney

content: Depression can seem worse than terminal cancer, because most cancer patients feel loved and they have hope and self-esteem.
author: David D. Burns

content: It is difficult to say what is impossible, for the dream of yesterday is the hope of today and the reality of tomorrow.
author: Robert H. Schuller

content: For love would be love of the wrong thing there is yet faith, But the faith and the love and the hope are all in the waiting.
author: T. S. Eliot

content: Desperation is the raw material of drastic change. Only those who can leave behind everything they have ever believed in can hope to escape.
author: William S. Burroughs

content: The sudden disappointment of a hope leaves a scar which the ultimate fulfillment of that hope never entirely removes.
author: Thomas Hardy

content: I tremble for my country when I hear of confidence expressed in me. I know too well my weakness, that our only hope is in God.
author: Robert E. Lee

content: Posterity: you will never know how much it has cost my generation to preserve your freedom. I hope you will make good use of it.
author: John Quincy Adams

content: I've seen the ticket, and I still can't believe it. When I see the money, I hope I don't hit the floor.
author: Judy Garland

content: Together we will build an America where hope is a new job with a paycheck, not a faded word on an old bumper sticker.
author: Mitt Romney

content: The worst thing that can happen in a democracy - as well as in an individual's life - is to become cynical about the future and lose hope.
author: Hillary Clinton

content: Middle age is when you're sitting at home on a Saturday night and the telephone rings and you hope it isn't for you.
author: Ogden Nash

content: To hope means to be ready at every moment for that which is not yet born, and yet not become desperate if there is no birth in our lifetime.
author: Erich Fromm

content: There is no medicine like hope, no incentive so great, and no tonic so powerful as expectation of something tomorrow.
author: Orison Swett Marden

content: Fifty percent of people won't vote, and fifty percent don't read newspapers. I hope it's the same fifty percent.
author: Gore Vidal

content: I'm a romantic a sentimental person thinks things will last, a romantic person hopes against hope that they won't.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

content: Man is, properly speaking, based upon hope, he has no other possession but hope this world of his is emphatically the place of hope.
author: Thomas Carlyle

content: Man needs, for his happiness, not only the enjoyment of this or that, but hope and enterprise and change.
author: Bertrand Russell

content: Confidence is that feeling by which the mind embarks in great and honorable courses with a sure hope and trust in itself.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

content: Woe to the man whose heart has not learned while young to hope, to love - and to put its trust in life.
author: Joseph Conrad

content: Every parent is at some time the father of the unreturned prodigal, with nothing to do but keep his house open to hope.
author: John Ciardi

content: Little progress can be made by merely attempting to repress what is evil. Our great hope lies in developing what is good.
author: Calvin Coolidge

content: The charm of fishing is that it is the pursuit of what is elusive but attainable, a perpetual series of occasions for hope.
author: John Buchan

content: Ideology, politics and journalism, which luxuriate in failure, are impotent in the face of hope and joy.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

content: One thing I hope I'll never be is drunk with my own power. And anybody who says I am will never work in this town again.
author: Jim Carrey

content: Love is a springtime plant that perfumes everything with its hope, even the ruins to which it clings.
author: Gustave Flaubert

content: Yesterday I was a dog. Today I'm a dog. Tomorrow I'll probably still be a dog. Sigh! There's so little hope for advancement.
author: Charles M. Schulz

content: Compromise is but the sacrifice of one right or good in the hope of retaining another - too often ending in the loss of both.
author: Tryon Edwards

content: The happy Union of these States is a wonder their Constitution a miracle their example the hope of Liberty throughout the world.
author: James Madison

content: None who have always been free can understand the terrible fascinating power of the hope of freedom to those who are not free.
author: Pearl S. Buck

content: The sea, the great unifier, is man's only hope. Now, as never before, the old phrase has a literal meaning: we are all in the same boat.
author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

content: Your ordinary acts of love and hope point to the extraordinary promise that every human life is of inestimable value.
author: Desmond Tutu

content: If I had to choose between betraying my country and betraying my friend, I hope I should have the guts to betray my country.
author: E. M. Forster

content: If you keep thinking about what you want to do or what you hope will happen, you don't do it, and it won't happen.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

content: You cannot hope to sweep someone else away by the force of your writing until it has been done to you.
author: Stephen King

content: An athlete cannot run with money in his pockets. He must run with hope in his heart and dreams in his head.
author: Emil Zatopek

content: All people hope Islam helps everything in life. Islam will make jobs. Islam will make freedom. Islam will make everything.
author: Ahmed Ali

content: Drugs are the enemies of ambition and hope - and when we fight against drugs we are fighting for the future.
author: Bob Riley

content: In economics, hope and faith coexist with great scientific pretension and also a deep desire for respectability.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

content: Hope is the best possession. None are completely wretched but those who are without hope. Few are reduced so low as that.
author: William Hazlitt

content: If we hope for what we are not likely to possess, we act and think in vain, and make life a greater dream and shadow than it really is.
author: Joseph Addison

content: Acting provides the fulfillment of never being fulfilled. You're never as good as you'd like to be. So there's always something to hope for.
author: Washington Irving

content: It is the around-the-corner brand of hope that prompts people to action, while the distant hope acts as an opiate.
author: Eric Hoffer

content: About the most originality that any writer can hope to achieve honestly is to steal with good judgment.
author: Josh Billings

content: I can only hope to be 10 percent of the mom mine was to me. She encouraged me to be confident and enjoy life. That's what I want for my son.
author: Charlize Theron

content: Theater is, of course, a reflection of life. Maybe we have to improve life before we can hope to improve theater.
author: William Ralph Inge

content: When he is late for dinner and I know he must be either having an affair or lying dead in the street, I always hope he's dead.
author: Judith Viorst

content: I hope that you will learn to take responsibility for your decisions. don't take counsel of your fears.
author: Thomas S. Monson

content: Just as despair can come to one only from other human beings, hope, too, can be given to one only by other human beings.
author: Elie Wiesel

content: My hope is that gays will be running the world, because then there would be no war. Just a greater emphasis on military apparel.
author: Roseanne Barr

content: I hope that people will finally come to realize that there is only one 'race' - the human race - and that we are all members of it.
author: Margaret Atwood

content: Architecture is basically a container of something. I hope they will enjoy not so much the teacup, but the tea.
author: Yoshio Taniguchi

content: Hope is not the conviction that something will turn out well but the certainty that something makes sense, regardless of how it turns out.
author: Vaclav Havel

content: The origin of the absurd idea of immortal life is easy to discover it is kept alive by hope and fear, by childish faith, and by cowardice.
author: Clarence Darrow

content: There are only two lasting bequests we can hope to give our children. One of these is roots, the other, wings.
author: Hodding Carter

content: Designing a house is like doing a movie: Once you're done, you want to say, 'I hope you all enjoy it.'
author: Jennifer Aniston

content: Hope lies in dreams, in imagination, and in the courage of those who dare to make dreams into reality.
author: Jonas Salk

content: We really feel happier when things look bleak. Hope is endurance. Hope is holding on and going on and trusting in the Lord.
author: Michael Novak

content: I hope that women everywhere will wear this jewelry and feel the passion and love that is, to me, the real spirit of True Harmony.
author: Carol Alt

content: One of my favorite people is Gypsy Rose Lee. She bears out the Biblical promise that he who has, gets. And I hope she gets a lot more.
author: Hedy Lamarr

content: If you use your imagination, you can look at any actress and see her nude... I hope to make you use your imagination.
author: Hedy Lamarr

content: It is natural to indulge in the illusions of hope. We are apt to shut our eyes to that siren until she allures us to our death.
author: Gertrude Stein

content: Death is the great hope of all life the desire to expend itself to be used and consumed by its own longing for itself.
author: Bryant H. McGill

content: In the company of the accomplished, people hope it will rub off on themselves, in the company of the misfortunate, they fear it!
author: Bryant H. McGill

content: When hope is not pinned wriggling onto a shiny image or expectation, it sometimes floats forth and opens.
author: Anne Lamott

content: What greater aspiration and challenge are there for a mother than the hope of raising a great son or daughter?
author: Rose Kennedy

content: Every night when I go to bed, I hope that I may never wake again, and every morning renews my grief.
author: Franz Schubert

content: People always ask me if I'm going to stop modeling because I have started an acting career. I hope to continue to model for years to come.
author: Tyra Banks

content: They say a person needs just three things to be truly happy in this world: someone to love, something to do, and something to hope for.
author: Tom Bodett

content: That's all a man can hope for during his lifetime - to set an example - and when he is dead, to be an inspiration for history.
author: William McKinley

content: I'm going home now. I apologize for what I said. I hope you can forget it, but I'm going home right now.
author: Benjamin Day

content: We would not be interested in human beings if we did not have the hope of someday meeting someone worse off than ourselves.
author: Emile M. Cioran

content: I would hope they would be our fellow artists, rather than trying to emulate or idolize clowns like us.
author: Maynard James Keenan

content: Evil communication corrupts good manners. I hope to live to hear that good communication corrects bad manners.
author: Benjamin Banneker

content: My hope is that we continue to nurture the places that we love, but that we also look outside our immediate worlds.
author: Annie Leibovitz

content: And as far as false hope, there is no such thing. There is only hope or the absence of hope-nothing else.
author: Patti Davis

content: Unless our conception of patriotism is progressive, it cannot hope to embody the real affection and the real interest of the nation.
author: Jane Addams

content: A lot of presidential memoirs, they say, are dull and self-serving. I hope mine is interesting and self-serving.
author: William J. Clinton

content: I hope to bring much more attention to important issues and change for issues and practices that are harming animals.
author: Kesha

content: To cherish what remains of the Earth and to foster its renewal is our only legitimate hope of survival.
author: Wendell Berry

content: I have been coaching recently. I coached high school basketball in Arizona, and I hope that more opportunities become available.
author: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar

content: Make big plans aim high in hope and work, remembering that a noble, logical diagram once recorded will not die.
author: Daniel Burnham

content: Hope... is the companion of power, and the mother of success for who so hopes has within him the gift of miracles.
author: Samuel Smiles

content: My hope is that that person will come forward that can win the presidency that we can all get behind.
author: Rick Perry

content: Faith, like a jackal, feeds among the tombs, and even from these dead doubts she gathers her most vital hope.
author: Herman Melville

content: Hope is a feeling that life and work have meaning. You either have it or you don't, regardless of the state of the world that surrounds you.
author: Vaclav Havel

content: The very least you can do in your life is to figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

content: I've been pleased to work with so many wonderful stars through the years. This has been an amazing journey. I hope it continues.
author: Keanu Reeves

content: If we become too scared to confront the chief problems of our time, there is no hope of ever solving them.
author: Jim DeMint

content: To withdraw is not to run away, and to stay is no wise action, when there's more reason to fear than to hope.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

content: Hope is the struggle of the soul, breaking loose from what is perishable, and attesting her eternity.
author: Herman Melville

content: Good news doesn't necessarily have to be a positive thing. Bringing good news is imparting hope to one's fellow man.
author: Patti Smith

content: If it is nothingness that awaits us, let us make an injustice of it let us fight against destiny, even though without hope of victory.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

content: Fear is a very explosive emotion, but it has a short life span. It's the sprint. The marathon is hope.
author: Mike Huckabee

content: On the other hand, I believe there's hope, because the breakdown and the repair are happening simultaneously.
author: Kathryn Bigelow

content: In government you carry each hope each disillusion. And in politics it's always about the next challenge.
author: Tony Blair

content: My hope for my children must be that they respond to the still, small voice of God in their own hearts.
author: Andrew Young

content: As long as we can tell stories about our ability to survive, the more we will hope, not self-destruct.
author: Christina Ricci

content: I've convinced myself - I hope I'm right - that children despair of you if you don't tell them the truth.
author: Maurice Sendak

content: The climate, the economic situation, rising birth rates none of these things give me a lot of hope or reason to be optimistic.
author: David Attenborough

content: Being a star has made it possible for me to get insulted in places where the average Negro could never hope to go and get insulted.
author: Sammy Davis, Jr.

content: In our recovery package we put new standards of accountability and transparency, which we hope will now apply.
author: Nancy Pelosi

content: We hope that the long darkness through which the Burmese people have lived may now be coming to an end.
author: William Hague

content: See, my hope and dream is that people have a good time watching basketball. It's not church. It's not serious.
author: Charles Barkley

content: You always hear people saying, 'I hope I'm not turning into my dad', but I'd be honoured if I became half as decent a bloke as he is.
author: Johnny Vegas

content: I hope I live long enough to see every hungry school child in the world being fed under the so-called McGovern-Dole program.
author: George McGovern

content: I hope in my lifetime we can all continue to laugh at ourselves and not put down anyone for what they weigh.
author: Richard Simmons

content: We hope that, when the insects take over the world, they will remember with gratitude how we took them along on all our picnics.
author: Bill Vaughan

content: I, for one, hope that youth will again revolt and again demoralize the dead weight of conformity that now lies upon us.
author: Howard Mumford Jones

content: I try to make my life about service, and hope that one day we can all 'see' a little better because God is with everyone and everywhere.
author: Russell Simmons

content: Hope is like a road in the country there was never a road, but when many people walk on it, the road comes into existence.
author: Lin Yutang

content: For now, I'm just going to keep doing the work and hope I don't get fired. If people want to put me up on their walls, I'll love it.
author: Ryan Gosling

content: One of the greatest delusions in the world is the hope that the evils in this world are to be cured by legislation.
author: Thomas Reed

content: There is nothing so well known as that we should not expect something for nothing - but we all do and call it Hope.
author: E. W. Howe

content: Loss of hope rather than loss of life is what decides the issues of war. But helplessness induces hopelessness.
author: B. H. Liddell Hart

content: I don't want to make films that give you the answer. If there is a message to my films - and I hope there isn't - it's to be open-minded.

content: So, influenced by these advisors and this hope, I have at length allowed my friends to publish the work, as they had long besought me to do.

content: As a black man, my hope is that I can touch more and more people all over the world of different races and different colours.

content: For a person who promised hope and civility in politics, Mr. Obama has shown a borderline obsessiveness in blaming Mr. Bush.

content: If we all worked on the assumption that what is accepted as true is really true, there would be little hope of advance.

content: I don't want to hope anymore. I don't think we should hope anymore. We hoped enough. Now we have to do. We all have to do now.

content: I hope I left behind a legacy that people will enjoy. But whatever they want to say, I can't predict.

content: To my utter despair I have discovered, and discover every day anew, that there is in the masses no revolutionary idea or hope or passion.

content: I think by now I have made it fairly clear that I am not very happy with the word hope. I don't believe in people just hoping.

content: I hope I'm not a tourist attraction - I'm sure that they come here really because St. Andrews is just amazing, a beautiful place.

content: I hope that none of the countries in the Middle East are planning anything but the peaceful utilization of nuclear energy.

content: At the end of the day we want to bring stability and hope to Iraq. That's the only way to defeat terrorism.

content: In the kind of world we have today, transformation of humanity might well be our only real hope for survival.

content: I have more awareness of other people and, I hope, more sensitivity to their needs. I also find that I'm more direct and outspoken.

content: I have always striven to raise the voice of hope for a world where hate gives way to respect and oppression to liberation.

content: I love being able to sing for my job. I am blessed beyond words and I hope my fans can feel that while I'm on stage!

content: It was an amazing adventure, it was my dream to be in an American musical... I really hope you are going to love what you are going to see.
author: Marion Cotillard

content: There are hurdles, there are handicaps, hardships you have to face in life, but you hope for a great future.

content: I think the way IBM has embraced the open source philosophy has been quite astonishing, but gratifying. I hope they'll do very well with it.

content: I hope to find the roles that are age appropriate but not yearning to be younger, or parenting ad nauseam.

content: When you are kind to someone in trouble, you hope they'll remember and be kind to someone else. And it'll become like a wildfire.

content: I hope what I do has an art to it, and as an artist you have to try new things and keep yourself entertained.

content: I hope to be around past the 90's. I don't want to just be categorized as one of this era. My goal is to have a career that stands.

content: Journalists say a thing that they know isn't true, in the hope that if they keep on saying it long enough it will be true.

content: Everybody, sooner or later, will have to go under the knife. Let's hope they make out as well as I did.

content: I do insist on making what I hope is sense so there's always a coherent narrative or argument that the reader can follow.

content: Few people know so clearly what they want. Most people can't even think what to hope for when they throw a penny in a fountain.

content: Ironically, Latin American countries, in their instability, give writers and intellectuals the hope that they are needed.

content: I think it's impossible to judge whether another person should come out. You just hope they will on their own time and their own terms.

content: It would be fun to do a reunion show. I hope we do it some day, but it better be soon. We're all getting on.

content: The only thing I hope I did was never put in question my love for the game, or my passion to be counted on when it mattered most.

content: You know, in my hometown of Hope, Arkansas, the three sacred heroes were Jesus, Elvis, and FDR, not necessarily in that order.

content: Like all parents, my husband and I just do the best we can, hold our breath and hope we've set aside enough money for our kid's therapy.

content: Hope is a flatterer, but the most upright of all parasites for she frequents the poor man's hut, as well as the palace of his superior.

content: You can always get the truth from an American statesman after he has turned seventy, or given up all hope of the Presidency.

content: You hope people are going to be listening to you after you're gone. And they like you better after you're gone.

content: Being an artist is a very long game. It is not a 10-year game. I hope I'll be around making art when I'm 80.

content: Your own experience keeps taking you towards something. My book adds the hope that it's a better something.

content: Chemistry is not anything an executive producer or writer can orchestrate or plan you just hope for it.

content: You probably found 'How to Survive a Robot Uprising' in the humor section. Let's just hope that is where it belongs.

content: We are all here to be a service to those who can't be a service to themselves. We can give people hope and more reasons for being human.

content: My hope is that countries like Morocco will have investment to create work, so people don't have to leave.

content: Yes, well I really hope I can make a difference, even in the smallest way. I am looking forward to helping as much as I can.

content: I love making movies and hope to write my own screenplay someday and do some producing and be behind-the-scenes as well.

content: Would it be possible that I should not in any degree succeed? I can scarcely think so. Ah delusive hope, how much further wilt thou lead me?

content: I do hope that our spring will be starting shortly and we will all be able to enjoy some sunshine again.

content: I'm more than open to hope, but I think men and women have a difficult time dealing with each other and often take the low road.

content: Fighting a war on terrorism is like fighting against crime. We can never hope to eradicate crime, so we shouldn't bother fighting it.

content: I hope that just what I sing about and how I relate to my audience is as much of a political statement as I need to make.

content: Helplessness induces hopelessness, and history attests that loss of hope and not loss of lives is what decides the issue of war.

content: Well I certainly have learned and I hope I'm moving on and certainly two years of prison was a terrible punishment.

content: I am making amends and seeking forgiveness. My only hope is that some good can come out of my situation.

content: I would not run for president. I really like what I'm doing now. People say I'm giving them energy and hope.

content: I hope we don't get to the point where we have to have the cat stop chasing the mouse to teach him glassblowing and basket weaving.

content: My hope is that we will turn Greece into maybe the most transparent country in the world with everything on the web.

content: There's a lot of great people out here, I just appreciate it and hope everybody has had fun because I've enjoyed my ride.

content: Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he is not a sense of humor to console him for what he is.

content: There seems to be no lengths to which humorless people will not go to analyze humor. It seems to worry them.

content: Humor must not professedly teach and it must not professedly preach, but it must do both if it would live forever.

content: A woman has to be intelligent, have charm, a sense of humor, and be kind. It's the same qualities I require from a man.

content: The problem with having a sense of humor is often that people you use it on aren't in a very good mood.

content: Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he isn't. A sense of humor was provided to console him for what he is.

content: Humor can help you cope with the unbearable so that you can stay on the bright side of things until the bright side actually comes along.

content: When we can find some humor in our upsets, they no longer seem as large or as important as they once did.

content: Philip Larkin has a tough honesty and sense of humor that I find irresistible, as a contemporary poet.

content: Men love it. They have a sense of humor, whereas a lot of women are threatened or just don't get it.

content: Bob Hope, like Mark Twain, had a sense of humor that was uniquely American, and like Twain, we'll likely not see another like him.

content: You probably found 'How to Survive a Robot Uprising' in the humor section. Let's just hope that is where it belongs.
author: Daniel H. Wilson

content: Sometimes Americans don't quite get my sense of humor. My good ol' British sarcasm seems to go over their heads.

content: My parents armed me with an amazing sense of humor, and it's what you need when, well, it's what anyone needs in this world.

content: I liked the humor of it, I've always enjoyed a sense of humor in God and in religion and in spirituality.

content: The waltz is a very important part of my life. It's a very important way for me to express my positiveness, bringing humor to the world.

content: Probably it is impossible for humor to be ever a revolutionary weapon. Candide can do little more than generate irony.

content: Suspense is very important. Even though this is humor and they're short stories, that theory of building suspense is still there.

content: Athletes tend to have less of a sense of humor than most people. They are heroes to so many. That might be part of it.

content: Humor has always been important to me. If there is a shield of faith that you can keep up against difficulties, humor is the Teflon coating.

content: Robert Walker as Bruno was excellent. He had elegance and humor, and the proper fondness for his mother.
author: Patricia Highsmith

content: If you can understand the humor in the drawing part you'll probably get the humor in the audio part.
author: Eric San

content: Kindness and a generous spirit go a long way. And a sense of humor. It's like medicine - very healing.

content: The man with the real sense of humor is the man who can put himself in the spectator's place and laugh at his own misfortune.

content: I met Elton John at an Interview dinner, and we just sort of became friends. He's got such a wicked sense of humor.

content: My family has been amazing, and they understand how blessed I am. They've been able to keep my sense of humor.

content: Humor was not important only for me, humor was important for this nation for centuries, to survive, you know.
author: Milos Forman

content: At NBC I wasn't really sure if the grandparents were going to get my sense of humor on a particular topic.

content: All the people who follow me on Twitter know my sense of humor. I sometimes forget the blogosphere will give it more weight than I intended.

content: Men will confess to treason, murder, arson, false teeth, or a wig. How many of them will own up to a lack of humor?

content: I often have said that to be a college president, you need a thick skin, a good sense of humor, and nerves like sewer pipes.

content: We have a certain warped sense of humor in Scandinavia, and that is what comes across in the choices in a lot of our movies.

content: The President has a wonderful sense of humor, which is one of the reasons it is so much fun to work for him.

content: I think that sense of humor is important in marriage. A sense of humor gets people through marriage.

content: It's self-effacing, it's hard-luck, the shtetl stories. All those Coasters things are an amalgam of Yiddish and black humor.

content: I like a very dry wit, not the big kind of humor like Robin Williams. I don't think I'm capable of that.

content: I've always been really dark, and drawn to darker humor. Nothing has been forced, and I don't say anything for shock value.

content: Although Kurt Vonnegut may not be considered a humor writer, 'Breakfast of Champions' is one of the funniest books I've ever read.

content: Prior to Wordsworth, humor was an essential part of poetry. I mean, they don't call them Shakespeare comedies for nothing.

content: I think my sense of humor is Jewish. I'm smarter than most white people, which is kind of a Jewish thing, too.

content: Incongruity, they say, is one of the main ingredients of humor. Maybe it's because everybody can feel superior to me. I honestly don't know.
