content: Humor results when society says you can't scratch certain things in public, but they itch in public.
author: Tom Walsh

content: I cannot imagine a God who rewards and punishes the objects of his creation and is but a reflection of human frailty.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Think left and think right and think low and think high. Oh, the thinks you can think up if only you try!
author: Dr. Seuss

content: A rock pile ceases to be a rock pile the moment a single man contemplates it, bearing within him the image of a cathedral.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

content: It is impossible to imagine the universe run by a wise, just and omnipotent God, but it is quite easy to imagine it run by a board of gods.
author: H. L. Mencken

content: Imagination is the voice of daring. If there is anything Godlike about God it is that. He dared to imagine everything.
author: Henry Miller

content: Imagine for yourself a character, a model personality, whose example you determine to follow, in private as well as in public.
author: Epictetus

content: I am imagination. I can see what the eyes cannot see. I can hear what the ears cannot hear. I can feel what the heart cannot feel.
author: Peter Nivio Zarlenga

content: People who lean on logic and philosophy and rational exposition end by starving the best part of the mind.
author: William Butler Yeats

content: There is a boundary to men's passions when they act from feelings but none when they are under the influence of imagination.
author: Edmund Burke

content: Imagination grows by exercise, and contrary to common belief, is more powerful in the mature than in the young.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

content: It is the eye of ignorance that assigns a fixed and unchangeable color to every object beware of this stumbling block.
author: Paul Gauguin

content: I doubt that the imagination can be suppressed. If you truly eradicated it in a child, he would grow up to be an eggplant.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin

content: I never did very well in math - I could never seem to persuade the teacher that I hadn't meant my answers literally.
author: Calvin Trillin

content: We imagine that we want to escape our selfish and commonplace existence, but we cling desperately to our chains.
author: Anne Sullivan Macy

content: The moment a person forms a theory, his imagination sees in every object only the traits which favor that theory.
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he is not a sense of humor to console him for what he is.
author: Francis Bacon

content: There are no great limits to growth because there are no limits of human intelligence, imagination, and wonder.
author: Ronald Reagan

content: It is usually the imagination that is wounded first, rather than the heart it being much more sensitive.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: Generally speaking, a howling wilderness does not howl: it is the imagination of the traveler that does the howling.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: Imagination is the beginning of creation. You imagine what you desire, you will what you imagine and at last you create what you will.
author: George Bernard Shaw

content: Disneyland will never be completed. It will continue to grow as long as there is imagination left in the world.
author: Walt Disney

content: We cast away priceless time in dreams, born of imagination, fed upon illusion, and put to death by reality.
author: Judy Garland

content: All the works of man have their origin in creative fantasy. What right have we then to depreciate imagination.
author: Carl Jung

content: Aptitude found in the understanding and is often inherited. Genius coming from reason and imagination, rarely.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: America was not built on fear. America was built on courage, on imagination and an unbeatable determination to do the job at hand.
author: Harry S. Truman

content: Without leaps of imagination, or dreaming, we lose the excitement of possibilities. Dreaming, after all, is a form of planning.
author: Gloria Steinem

content: A lady's imagination is very rapid it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment.
author: Jane Austen

content: Imagination disposes of everything it creates beauty, justice, and happiness, which are everything in this world.
author: Blaise Pascal

content: Imagination was given to man to compensate him for what he isn't. A sense of humor was provided to console him for what he is.
author: Horace Walpole

content: The use of travelling is to regulate imagination by reality, and instead of thinking how things may be, to see them as they are.
author: Samuel Johnson

content: My view is that at a younger age your optimism is more and you have more imagination etc. You have less bias.
author: Abdul Kalam

content: A certificate of live birth is not the same thing by any stretch of the imagination as a birth certificate.
author: Donald Trump

content: For me, insanity is super sanity. The normal is psychotic. Normal means lack of imagination, lack of creativity.
author: Jean Dubuffet

content: Men often take their imagination for their heart and they believe they are converted as soon as they think of being converted.
author: Blaise Pascal

content: You have all the reason in the world to achieve your grandest dreams. Imagination plus innovation equals realization.
author: Denis Waitley

content: Being an actor is the loneliest thing in the world. You are all alone with your concentration and imagination, and that's all you have.
author: James Dean

content: Those Dutchmen had hardly any imagination or fantasy, but their good taste and their scientific knowledge of composition were enormous.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

content: My country has contrived for me the most insignificant office that ever the invention of man contrived or his imagination conceived.
author: John Adams

content: We especially need imagination in science. It is not all mathematics, nor all logic, but it is somewhat beauty and poetry.

content: First, I have the privilege of being Chairman of the Senate Intelligence Committee. It is not an oxymoron I assure you.
author: Pat Roberts

content: Intelligence we gathered at the time indicated that this was in fact leadership and we struck the leadership.
author: Peter Pace

content: I am not opposed to intelligence reform on its face, but any changes should reflect the current context.
author: Ted Stevens

content: As a former attorney general. I have the greatest respect for the criminal justice system. But it is not good at intelligence gathering.
author: Kelly Ayotte

content: Millions of dollars' worth of advertising shows such little respect for the reader's intelligence that it amounts almost to outright insult.
author: James Randolph Adams

content: Of course I believe in aliens. I think it's very egocentric to think that there's nothing else with intelligence in the whole universe.
author: Lizzie Brochere

content: Week after week, the heads of Red Army Intelligence received updates on the Wehrmacht's preparations.
author: Leopold Trepper

content: The danger of having the military take over intelligence is that the military has a very different perspective on the world.
author: Pete Hoekstra

content: Sometimes, surely, truth is closer to imagination or to intelligence, to love than to fact? To be accurate is not to be right.
author: Shirley Hazzard

content: I think America has more than enough maturity and intelligence to start exercising its world leadership responsibly.
author: Cristina Kirchner

content: There are whole precincts of voters in this country whose united intelligence does not equal that of one representative American woman.
author: Carrie Chapman Catt

content: We had periodic crises in this country when the technical intelligence didn't support the policy. We had the bomber gap, the missile gap.
author: Aldrich Ames

content: A competent and self-confident person is incapable of jealousy in anything. Jealousy is invariably a symptom of neurotic insecurity.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

content: It will be found an unjust and unwise jealousy to deprive a man of his natural liberty upon the supposition he may abuse it.
author: George Washington

content: Never underestimate the power of jealousy and the power of envy to destroy. Never underestimate that.
author: Oliver Stone

content: My wife's jealousy is getting ridiculous. The other day she looked at my calendar and wanted to know who May was.
author: Rodney Dangerfield

content: Jealous, adj. Unduly concerned about the preservation of that which can be lost only if not worth keeping.
author: Ambrose Bierce

content: Jealousy is never satisfied with anything short of an omniscience that would detect the subtlest fold of the heart.
author: George Eliot

content: If one of two lovers is loyal, and the other jealous and false, how may their friendship last, for Love is slain!
author: Marie de France

content: Nothing is more capable of troubling our reason, and consuming our health, than secret notions of jealousy in solitude.
author: Aphra Behn

content: Jealousy is bred in doubts. When those doubts change into certainties, then the passion either ceases or turns absolute madness.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

content: Jealousy lives upon doubts. It becomes madness or ceases entirely as soon as we pass from doubt to certainty.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

content: What makes the pain we feel from shame and jealousy so cutting is that vanity can give us no assistance in bearing them.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

content: The surest route to breeding jealousy is to compare. Since jealousy comes from feeling less than another, comparisons only fan the fires.
author: Dorothy Corkville Briggs

content: Jealousy would be far less torturous if we understood that love is a passion entirely unrelated to our merits.
author: Paul Eldridge

content: But when I would see the surrogate, my first instinct, my first reaction would be jealousy, because she was doing what I wanted to do.
author: Cheryl Tiegs

content: The jealousy and resentment that animate the terrorists also affect many of our former cold war allies.
author: Richard Perle

content: You will not accept credit that is due to another, or harbor jealousy of an explorer who is more fortunate.
author: Abbott L. Lowell

content: I don't watch that much comedy. I think it's professional jealousy. That and a lack of support for my community.
author: Michael Ian Black

content: When I see a good singer, I get teary-eyed. Part of it is jealousy because all comedians are frustrated rock stars. That's a fact.
author: Jeff Ross

content: A people without the knowledge of their past history, origin and culture is like a tree without roots.
author: Marcus Garvey

content: He who knows nothing is closer to the truth than he whose mind is filled with falsehoods and errors.
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: When you know a thing, to hold that you know it, and when you do not know a thing, to allow that you do not know it - this is knowledge.
author: Confucius

content: Pain and foolishness lead to great bliss and complete knowledge, for Eternal Wisdom created nothing under the sun in vain.
author: Khalil Gibran

content: No man can reveal to you nothing but that which already lies half-asleep in the dawning of your knowledge.
author: Khalil Gibran

content: It is not when truth is dirty, but when it is shallow, that the lover of knowledge is reluctant to step into its waters.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: To know that we know what we know, and to know that we do not know what we do not know, that is true knowledge.
author: Nicolaus Copernicus

content: The learning and knowledge that we have, is, at the most, but little compared with that of which we are ignorant.
author: Plato

content: The possession of knowledge does not kill the sense of wonder and mystery. There is always more mystery.
author: Anais Nin

content: The only real security that a man can have in this world is a reserve of knowledge, experience and ability.
author: Henry Ford

content: Let us tenderly and kindly cherish, therefore, the means of knowledge. Let us dare to read, think, speak, and write.
author: John Adams

content: Even the knowledge of my own fallibility cannot keep me from making mistakes. Only when I fall do I get up again.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

content: All our knowledge begins with the senses, proceeds then to the understanding, and ends with reason. There is nothing higher than reason.
author: Immanuel Kant

content: Knowledge is power. Information is liberating. Education is the premise of progress, in every society, in every family.
author: Kofi Annan

content: Reading furnishes the mind only with materials of knowledge it is thinking that makes what we read ours.
author: John Locke

content: Knowledge is of two kinds. We know a subject ourselves, or we know where we can find information upon it.
author: Samuel Johnson

content: I would rather excel in the knowledge of what is excellent, than in the extent of my power and possessions.
author: Plutarch

content: They say a little knowledge is a dangerous thing, but it's not one half so bad as a lot of ignorance.
author: Terry Pratchett

content: Knowledge is like money: to be of value it must circulate, and in circulating it can increase in quantity and, hopefully, in value.
author: Louis L'Amour

content: We live on an island surrounded by a sea of ignorance. As our island of knowledge grows, so does the shore of our ignorance.
author: John Archibald Wheeler

content: Any knowledge that doesn't lead to new questions quickly dies out: it fails to maintain the temperature required for sustaining life.
author: Wislawa Szymborska

content: The knowledge of anything, since all things have causes, is not acquired or complete unless it is known by its causes.
author: Avicenna

content: Having knowledge but lacking the power to express it clearly is no better than never having any ideas at all.
author: Pericles

content: The difference between a successful person and others is not a lack of strength, not a lack of knowledge, but rather a lack of will.
author: Vince Lombardi

content: Whoever undertakes to set himself up as a judge of Truth and Knowledge is shipwrecked by the laughter of the gods.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Science investigates religion interprets. Science gives man knowledge which is power religion gives man wisdom which is control.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

content: There comes a time when the mind takes a higher plane of knowledge but can never prove how it got there.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Carry out a random act of kindness, with no expectation of reward, safe in the knowledge that one day someone might do the same for you.
author: Princess Diana

content: I wash my hands of those who imagine chattering to be knowledge, silence to be ignorance, and affection to be art.
author: Khalil Gibran

content: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
author: Isaac Asimov

content: The recipe for perpetual ignorance is: Be satisfied with your opinions and content with your knowledge.
author: Elbert Hubbard

content: In a battle all you need to make you fight is a little hot blood and the knowledge that it's more dangerous to lose than to win.
author: George Bernard Shaw

content: Where is the Life we have lost in living? Where is the wisdom we have lost in knowledge? Where is the knowledge we have lost in information?
author: T. S. Eliot

content: Good nature is worth more than knowledge, more than money, more than honor, to the persons who possess it.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

content: What we want is to see the child in pursuit of knowledge, and not knowledge in pursuit of the child.
author: George Bernard Shaw

content: The interpretation of dreams is the royal road to a knowledge of the unconscious activities of the mind.
author: Sigmund Freud

content: I think I have a duty as a recovering guy to help, to make my knowledge of what I went through accessible.
author: Charlie Sheen

content: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
author: Lord Byron

content: Data is not information, information is not knowledge, knowledge is not understanding, understanding is not wisdom.
author: Clifford Stoll

content: I'm a student of world religion, so to me, it's hugely important to have knowledge and to understand what people are doing.
author: Will Smith

content: Music is the one incorporeal entrance into the higher world of knowledge which comprehends mankind but which mankind cannot comprehend.
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

content: The wise man should restrain his senses like the crane and accomplish his purpose with due knowledge of his place, time and ability.
author: Chanakya

content: There's only one effectively redemptive sacrifice, the sacrifice of self-will to make room for the knowledge of God.
author: Aldous Huxley

content: Knowledge about life is one thing effective occupation of a place in life, with its dynamic currents passing through your being, is another.
author: William James

content: Knowledge is invariably a matter of degree: you cannot put your finger upon even the simplest datum and say this we know.
author: T. S. Eliot

content: Integrity without knowledge is weak and useless, and knowledge without integrity is dangerous and dreadful.
author: Samuel Johnson

content: Faith: Belief without evidence in what is told by one who speaks without knowledge, of things without parallel.
author: Ambrose Bierce

content: Illness is the doctor to whom we pay most heed to kindness, to knowledge, we make promise only pain we obey.
author: Marcel Proust

content: In friendship as well as love, ignorance very often contributes more to our happiness than knowledge.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

content: The study and knowledge of the universe would somehow be lame and defective were no practical results to follow.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

content: It is now common knowledge that the average American gains 7 pounds between Thanksgiving and New Year's Day.
author: Marilu Henner

content: The more extensive a man's knowledge of what has been done, the greater will be his power of knowing what to do.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

content: Those Dutchmen had hardly any imagination or fantasy, but their good taste and their scientific knowledge of composition were enormous.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

content: The price one pays for pursuing any profession, or calling, is an intimate knowledge of its ugly side.
author: James A. Baldwin

content: The two operations of our understanding, intuition and deduction, on which alone we have said we must rely in the acquisition of knowledge.
author: Rene Descartes

content: Although modesty is natural to man, it is not natural to children. Modesty only begins with the knowledge of evil.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

content: It's very strange that most people don't care if their knowledge of their family history only goes back three generations.
author: Doug Coupland

content: Leisure and curiosity might soon make great advances in useful knowledge, were they not diverted by minute emulation and laborious trifles.
author: Samuel Johnson

content: I had rather excel others in the knowledge of what is excellent, than in the extent of my power and dominion.
author: Alexander the Great

content: A novel that does not uncover a hitherto unknown segment of existence is immoral. Knowledge is the novel's only morality.
author: Milan Kundera

content: It is not knowledge, but the act of learning, not possession but the act of getting there, which grants the greatest enjoyment.
author: Carl Friedrich Gauss

content: The seat of knowledge is in the head of wisdom, in the heart. We are sure to judge wrong, if we do not feel right.
author: William Hazlitt

content: We can't have full knowledge all at once. We must start by believing then afterwards we may be led on to master the evidence for ourselves.
author: Thomas Aquinas

content: My mom took me to see Carnal Knowledge and The Wild Bunch and all these kind of movies when I was a kid.
author: Quentin Tarantino

content: But although all our knowledge begins with experience, it does not follow that it arises from experience.
author: Immanuel Kant

content: The universal Mind contains all knowledge. It is the potential ultimate of all things. To it, all things are possible.
author: Ernest Holmes

content: In complete darkness we are all the same, it is only our knowledge and wisdom that separates us, don't let your eyes deceive you.
author: Janet Jackson

content: Knowledge is two-fold, and consists not only in an affirmation of what is true, but in the negation of that which is false.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

content: That writer does the most who gives his reader the most knowledge and takes from him the least time.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

content: I would rather excel others in the knowledge of what is excellent than in the extent of my powers and dominion.
author: Alexander the Great

content: Men honor what lies within the sphere of their knowledge, but do not realize how dependent they are on what lies beyond it.
author: Zhuangzi

content: Technology is so much fun but we can drown in our technology. The fog of information can drive out knowledge.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

content: How can smart women be so stupid about men sometimes? Lack of knowledge. It's what men have kept secret for so long.
author: Steve Harvey

content: Lost wealth may be replaced by industry, lost knowledge by study, lost health by temperance or medicine, but lost time is gone forever.
author: Samuel Smiles

content: Men are limited by the knowledge of their minds, the worth of their characters and the principles upon which they are building their lives.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

content: I don't think any person has any special knowledge about what God has planned for me and you any more than me and you do.
author: Willie Nelson

content: There is a general knowledge that I am multi-dimensional, that when you are creative you do a lot of things.
author: Suzanne Somers

content: G is Grace, the Flaming Star is the Torch of Reason. Those who possess this knowledge are indeed Illuminati.
author: Adam Weishaupt

content: What is called an acute knowledge of human nature is mostly nothing but the observer's own weaknesses reflected back from others.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

content: People of small caliber are always carping. They are bent on showing their own superiority, their knowledge or prowess or good breeding.
author: Van Wyck Brooks

content: When knowledge is limited - it leads to folly... When knowledge exceeds a certain limit, it leads to exploitation.
author: Abu Bakr

content: Knowledge is not simply another commodity. On the contrary. Knowledge is never used up. It increases by diffusion and grows by dispersion.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

content: We have today a fairly thorough knowledge of the early Greco-Roman period because our motivations are the same.
author: Arthur Erickson

content: We don't focus as much in schools on educational knowledge which requires thinking and application, as we do on acquiring facts.
author: William Glasser

content: Most North Americans know that human-caused global warming is real, even if political leaders don't always reflect or act on that knowledge.
author: David Suzuki

content: This means that no single logic is strong enough to support the total construction of human knowledge.
author: Jean Piaget

content: Wild Bill was anything but a quarrelsome man yet I have personal knowledge of at least half a dozen men whom he had at various times killed.
author: Buffalo Bill

content: Fullness of knowledge always means some understanding of the depths of our ignorance and that is always conducive to humility and reverence.
author: Robert Millikan

content: If they exert it not for good, they will for evil if they advance not knowledge, they will perpetuate ignorance.
author: Frances Wright

content: It takes a couple of years just to get the background and knowledge that you need before you can go into detailed training for your mission.
author: Sally Ride

content: Although your knowledge is weak and small, you need not be silent: since you cannot be judges be at least witnesses.
author: Franz Grillparzer

content: The most wonderful study of mankind is man. Relieving human suffering and diffusing universal knowledge is humanitarian.
author: Daniel D. Palmer

content: As a young man, I went to Paris and soaked up many hours of film knowledge from Robert Hakim in my efforts to become a producer.
author: Harvey Weinstein

content: Getting along with men isn't what's truly important. The vital knowledge is how to get along with a man, one man.
author: Phyllis McGinley

content: A man of knowledge chooses a path with a heart and follows it and then he looks and rejoices and laughs and then he sees and knows.
author: Carlos Castenada

content: Science knows no country, because knowledge belongs to humanity, and is the torch which illuminates the world.
author: Louis Pasteur

content: Doubt is the middle position between knowledge and ignorance. It encompasses cynicism but also genuine questioning.
author: Vera Farmiga

content: Compassion is a practically acquired knowledge, like dancing. You must do it and practice diligently day by day.
author: Karen Armstrong

content: At each increase of knowledge, as well as on the contrivance of every new tool, human labour becomes abridged.
author: Charles Babbage

content: Every mind was made for growth, for knowledge, and its nature is sinned against when it is doomed to ignorance.
author: William Ellery Channing

content: But because many endeavor to get knowledge rather than to live well, they are often deceived and reap little or no benefit from their labor.
author: Thomas a Kempis

content: I am conscious of my inability to grasp, in all its details and positive developments, any very large portion of human knowledge.
author: Mikhail Bakunin

content: It takes most men five years to recover from a college education, and to learn that poetry is as vital to thinking as knowledge.
author: Brooks Atkinson

content: The knowledge that there is a part of the psychic functions that are out of conscious reach, we did not need to wait for Freud to know this!
author: Jacques Lacan

content: Use your gifts faithfully, and they shall be enlarged practice what you know, and you shall attain to higher knowledge.
author: Matthew Arnold

content: Imagine a world in which every single person on the planet is given free access to the sum of all human knowledge. That's what we're doing.
author: Jimmy Wales

content: I think it's a mistake to treat different realms of knowledge as if they are some how fundamentally the same.
author: Jimmy Wales

content: Once we know of atrocities we cannot remain silent, and knowledge inevitably leads to an urge to protect the innocent.
author: Azar Nafisi

content: Security... it's simply the recognition that changes will take place and the knowledge that you're willing to deal with whatever happens.
author: Harry Browne

content: There's a period of life when we swallow a knowledge of ourselves and it becomes either good or sour inside.
author: Pearl Bailey

content: The understanding of art depends finally upon one's willingness to extend one's humanity and one's knowledge of human life.
author: Ralph Ellison

content: There is no knowledge, no light, no wisdom that you are in possession of, but what you have received it from some source.
author: Brigham Young

content: So I think it is common knowledge that Hitchcock had fantasies or whatever you want to call them about his leading ladies.
author: Tippi Hedren

content: But the scientific importance of a change in knowledge of fact consists precisely in j its having consequences for a system of theory.
author: Talcott Parsons

content: The past is a source of knowledge, and the future is a source of hope. Love of the past implies faith in the future.
author: Stephen Ambrose

content: In a world in which the total of human knowledge is doubling about every ten years, our security can rest only on our ability to learn.
author: Nathaniel Branden

content: To my knowledge, I was the first guy really to do what I do. And then later on different comedians started trying doing it.
author: Don Rickles

content: Books minister to our knowledge, to our guidance, and to our delight, by their truth, their uprightness, and their art.
author: George Henry Lewes

content: The minuses of celebrity include having to live with security and the knowledge that you may be stalked.
author: Enya

content: The general knowledge of time on the island depends, curiously enough, on the direction of the wind.
author: John Millington Synge

content: The greater the step forward in knowledge, the greater is the one taken backward in search of wisdom.
author: Stephen Gardiner

content: Without a knowledge of mythology much of the elegant literature of our own language cannot be understood and appreciated.
author: Thomas Bulfinch

content: Knowledge of other people's beliefs and ways of thinking must be used to build bridges, not to create conflicts.
author: Kjell Magne Bondevik

content: I gained direct knowledge of the life of the poor in big towns: I have lived the narrowing mechanism of its conditioning and feared it.
author: Ella Maillart

content: It has been a privilege to pursue knowledge for its own sake and to see how it might help mankind in more practical ways.
author: Paul Nurse

content: Exclusively oral cultures are unencumbered by dead knowledge, dead facts. Libraries, on the other hand, are full of them.
author: Huston Smith

content: If you know you are on the right track, if you have this inner knowledge, then nobody can turn you off... no matter what they say.
author: Barbara McClintock

content: While knowledge may provide useful point of reference, it cannot become a force to guide the future.
author: Herbie Hancock

content: Science is knowledge arranged and classified according to truth, facts, and the general laws of nature.
author: Luther Burbank

content: If the past has been an obstacle and a burden, knowledge of the past is the safest and the surest emancipation.
author: John Acton

content: Courage is... the knowledge of how to fear what ought to be feared and how not to fear what ought not to be feared.
author: David Ben-Gurion

content: There was never a nation great until it came to the knowledge that it had nowhere in the world to go for help.
author: Charles Dudley Warner

content: I don't know what is better than the work that is given to the actor-to teach the human heart the knowledge of itself.
author: Laurence Olivier

content: I came literally to the table with a wealth of knowledge by simply understanding how food should taste.
author: Rocco DiSpirito

content: My whole life, I had been taught to read and study, to seek understanding in knowledge of history, of cultures.
author: Meghan O'Rourke

content: The accumulation of cultural capital - the acquisition of knowledge - is the key to social mobility.
author: Michael Gove

content: Each department of knowledge passes through three stages. The theoretic stage the theological stage and the metaphysical or abstract stage.
author: Auguste Comte

content: Our civilization has evolved through the continuous adjustment of society to the stimulus of new knowledge.
author: John Boyd Orr

content: These will vary in every human being but knowledge is the same for every mind, and every mind may and ought to be trained to receive it.
author: Frances Wright

content: Shakespeare also introduces the supernatural into some of his tragedies he introduces ghosts, and witches who have supernatural knowledge.
author: Andrew Coyle Bradley

content: The knowledge of languages was very useful. I have a university degree in foreign languages and literature.
author: Emma Bonino

content: It is no good to try to stop knowledge from going forward. Ignorance is never better than knowledge.
author: Enrico Fermi

content: No one person invented Mulberry. The knowledge that we had to have this floating harbor slowly grew.
author: Lord Mountbatten

content: The role of the teacher is to create the conditions for invention rather than provide ready-made knowledge.
author: Seymour Papert

content: I think it will be found that experience, the true source and foundation of all knowledge, invariably confirms its truth.
author: Thomas Malthus

content: The future of publishing is about having connections to readers and the knowledge of what those readers want.
author: Seth Godin

content: Those who want to row on the ocean of human knowledge do not get far, and the storm drives those out of their course who set sail.
author: Franz Grillparzer

content: I think my knowledge of music theory is rooted in jazz theory, and a lot of the writers of standards - Rodgers and Hart, and Gershwin.
author: Zooey Deschanel

content: Kids are smart. Knowledge is power. Let them figure things out. Don't turn into that grown-up who they won't come to.
author: Lauren Myracle

content: The knowledge that we have about what it is to be human that we have as a child is something we necessarily must lose.
author: Dennis Potter

content: Seldom ever was any knowledge given to keep, but to impart the grace of this rich jewel is lost in concealment.
author: Wendell Phillips

content: Science consists exactly of those forms of knowledge that can be verified and duplicated by anybody.
author: Seth Lloyd

content: Intuition does not in itself amount to knowledge, yet cannot be disregarded by philosophers and psychologists.
author: Corliss Lamont

content: Bobby Fischer has an enormous knowledge of chess and his familiarity with the chess literature of the USSR is immense.
author: Boris Spassky

content: If one must fight or create, it is necessary that this be preceded by the broadest possible knowledge.
author: Karel Capek

content: The deductive method is the mode of using knowledge, and the inductive method the mode of acquiring it.
author: Henry Mayhew

content: Every branch of human knowledge, if traced up to its source and final principles, vanishes into mystery.
author: Arthur Machen

content: Sane judgment abhors nothing so much as a picture perpetrated with no technical knowledge, although with plenty of care and diligence.
author: Albrecht Durer

content: Imparting knowledge is only lighting other men's candles at our lamp without depriving ourselves of any flame.
author: Jane Porter

content: Through the mythology of Einstein, the world blissfully regained the image of knowledge reduced to a formula.
author: Roland Barthes

content: I started playing ball when I was a kid. My dad was a pro ball player and he passed on his knowledge to me.
author: Kurt Russell

content: Useless knowledge can be made directly contributory to a force of sound and disinterested public opinion.
author: Albert J. Nock

content: It has been common knowledge to informed collectors that many times the finest and rarest art glass is found unsigned.
author: James Lafferty

content: The idea of trying to create things that last - forever knowledge - has guided my work for a long time now.
author: Edward Tufte

content: I think all the knowledge and all the travels that I've done, I'm going to do a lot of great work in the future.
author: Chris Tucker

content: Lawrence Ferlinghetti had a tremendous education as an artist and also an enormous knowledge of literarture.
author: David Amram

content: I think Lenat is headed in the right direction, but someone needs to include a knowledge base about learning.
author: Marvin Minsky

content: It is my deliberate opinion that the one essential requisite of human welfare in all ways is scientific knowledge of human nature.
author: Harriet Martineau

content: I have the same sense of the power and virtue of knowledge that some people get from a religious background.
author: Walter Gilbert

content: The benefit of the radio is, something beyond your realm of knowledge can surprise you, can enter your realm of knowledge.
author: Esperanza Spalding

content: That test should not be about ratings. What should weigh is the knowledge that a public broadcaster delivers programmes that matter.
author: Jonathan Dimbleby

content: Education is a private matter between the person and the world of knowledge and experience, and has little to do with school or college.
author: Lillian Smith

content: Breaking into a system or exposing its weaknesses is a good thing because truth and knowledge must win out.
author: Dan Farmer

content: Like all science, psychology is knowledge and like science again, it is knowledge of a definite thing, the mind.
author: James M. Baldwin

content: As the body dieth when the soul departeth, so the soul of man dieth, when it hath not the knowledge of God.
author: John Jewel

content: Wisdom is a kind of knowledge. It is knowledge of the nature, career, and consequences of human values.
author: Sidney Hook

content: Everyone, young and old, must have access to the knowledge and skills to participate in the evolving economy.
author: James H. Douglas

content: I think it's wrong that so many people pass on from this existence, and take all their knowledge with them.
author: Rex Hunt

content: Obama has already rejected the bright sunlight of public knowledge, which is democracy's great disinfectant and cure.
author: David K. Shipler

content: Let no one be deluded that a knowledge of the path can substitute for putting one foot in front of the other.
author: Mary Richards

content: Golf is about knowledge, and studying another player - more than listening to a teacher - is the best way to get it.
author: Vijay Singh

content: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
author: Lao Tzu

content: Effective leadership is not about making speeches or being liked leadership is defined by results not attributes.
author: Peter Drucker

content: Be careful the environment you choose for it will shape you be careful the friends you choose for you will become like them.
author: W. Clement Stone

content: Leadership is the art of getting someone else to do something you want done because he wants to do it.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

content: If your actions inspire others to dream more, learn more, do more and become more, you are a leader.
author: John Quincy Adams

content: Effective leadership is putting first things first. Effective management is discipline, carrying it out.
author: Stephen Covey

content: A good leader takes a little more than his share of the blame, a little less than his share of the credit.
author: Arnold H. Glasow

content: No matter how carefully you plan your goals they will never be more than pipe dreams unless you pursue them with gusto.
author: W. Clement Stone

content: It is, after all, the responsibility of the expert to operate the familiar and that of the leader to transcend it.
author: Henry A. Kissinger

content: The key to being a good manager is keeping the people who hate me away from those who are still undecided.
author: Casey Stengel

content: It is rare to find a business partner who is selfless. If you are lucky it happens once in a lifetime.
author: Michael Eisner

content: A good objective of leadership is to help those who are doing poorly to do well and to help those who are doing well to do even better.
author: Jim Rohn

content: Leadership is a privilege to better the lives of others. It is not an opportunity to satisfy personal greed.
author: Mwai Kibaki

content: Leadership is a potent combination of strategy and character. But if you must be without one, be without the strategy.
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

content: Management is efficiency in climbing the ladder of success leadership determines whether the ladder is leaning against the right wall.
author: Stephen Covey

content: Leadership is a matter of having people look at you and gain confidence, seeing how you react. If you're in control, they're in control.
author: Tom Landry

author: Bill Gates

content: To expect too much is to have a sentimental view of life and this is a softness that ends in bitterness.
author: Flannery O'Connor

content: We have to be able to grow up. Our wrinkles are our medals of the passage of life. They are what we have been through and who we want to be.
author: Lauren Hutton

content: My Alma mater was books, a good library... I could spend the rest of my life reading, just satisfying my curiosity.
author: Malcolm X

content: Life is about not knowing, having to change, taking the moment and making the best of it, without knowing what's going to happen next.
author: Gilda Radner

content: As a remedy to life in society I would suggest the big city. Nowadays, it is the only desert within our means.
author: Albert Camus

content: The highest and most beautiful things in life are not to be heard about, nor read about, nor seen but, if one will, are to be lived.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

content: For God so loved the World that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.
author: Jesus Christ

content: Life is too short to spend hoping that the perfectly arched eyebrow or hottest new lip shade will mask an ugly heart.
author: Kevyn Aucoin

content: There has never yet been a man in our history who led a life of ease whose name is worth remembering.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

content: Faith is the first factor in a life devoted to service. Without it, nothing is possible. With it, nothing is impossible.
author: Mary McLeod Bethune

content: If a man can bridge the gap between life and death, if he can live on after he's dead, then maybe he was a great man.
author: James Dean

content: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

content: I'm at the age where food has taken the place of sex in my life. In fact, I've just had a mirror put over my kitchen table.
author: Rodney Dangerfield

content: If I have any worth, it is to live my life for God so as to teach these peoples even though some of them still look down on me.
author: Saint Patrick

content: I really believe that everyone has a talent, ability, or skill that he can mine to support himself and to succeed in life.
author: Dean Koontz

content: Life is all memory, except for the one present moment that goes by you so quickly you hardly catch it going.
author: Tennessee Williams

content: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
author: Lord Byron

content: Gratitude helps you to grow and expand gratitude brings joy and laughter into your life and into the lives of all those around you.
author: Eileen Caddy

content: Friends are as companions on a journey, who ought to aid each other to persevere in the road to a happier life.
author: Pythagoras

content: Take control of your consistent emotions and begin to consciously and deliberately reshape your daily experience of life.
author: Tony Robbins

content: When it comes to life the critical thing is whether you take things for granted or take them with gratitude.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

content: Haters never win. I just think that's true about life, because negative energy always costs in the end.
author: Tom Hiddleston

content: You can't make positive choices for the rest of your life without an environment that makes those choices easy, natural, and enjoyable.
author: Deepak Chopra

content: Woz is living his own life now. He hasn't been around Apple for about five years. But what he did will go down in history.
author: Steve Jobs

content: Half our life is spent trying to find something to do with the time we have rushed through life trying to save.
author: Will Rogers

content: Be thou the rainbow in the storms of life. The evening beam that smiles the clouds away, and tints tomorrow with prophetic ray.
author: Lord Byron

content: I made a mistake by being ejected from the presidency. Next time, I will choose a Cabinet which will allow me to be life President.
author: Nelson Mandela

content: Life is too short to worry about anything. You had better enjoy it because the next day promises nothing.
author: Eric Davis

content: If you have no confidence in self, you are twice defeated in the race of life. With confidence, you have won even before you have started.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

content: You know what your problem is, it's that you haven't seen enough movies - all of life's riddles are answered in the movies.
author: Steve Martin

content: When you do the common things in life in an uncommon way, you will command the attention of the world.
author: George Washington Carver

content: Part of the happiness of life consists not in fighting battles, but in avoiding them. A masterly retreat is in itself a victory.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

content: Justice in the life and conduct of the State is possible only as first it resides in the hearts and souls of the citizens.
author: Plato

content: A dog will teach you unconditional love. If you can have that in your life, things won't be too bad.
author: Robert Wagner

content: Faith means living with uncertainty - feeling your way through life, letting your heart guide you like a lantern in the dark.
author: Dan Millman

content: You see, in life, lots of people know what to do, but few people actually do what they know. Knowing is not enough! You must take action.
author: Tony Robbins

content: When life knocks you down, try to land on your back. Because if you can look up, you can get up. Let your reason get you back up.
author: Les Brown

content: A man who has been the indisputable favorite of his mother keeps for life the feeling of a conqueror.
author: Sigmund Freud

content: This is the highest wisdom that I own freedom and life are earned by those alone who conquer them each day anew.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: The highest education is that which does not merely give us information but makes our life in harmony with all existence.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

content: The game of life is a game of boomerangs. Our thoughts, deeds and words return to us sooner or later with astounding accuracy.
author: Florence Scovel Shinn

content: Black Consciousness is an attitude of the mind and a way of life, the most positive call to emanate from the black world for a long time.
author: Steven Biko

content: The safest course is to do nothing against one's conscience. With this secret, we can enjoy life and have no fear from death.
author: Voltaire

content: With an eye made quiet by the power of harmony, and the deep power of joy, we see into the life of things.
author: William Wordsworth

content: To gather with God's people in united adoration of the Father is as necessary to the Christian life as prayer.
author: Martin Luther

content: The greatest humiliation in life, is to work hard on something from which you expect great appreciation, and then fail to get it.
author: E. W. Howe

content: Being taken for granted can be a compliment. It means that you've become a comfortable, trusted element in another person's life.
author: Joyce Brothers

content: The more sand that has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.
author: Jean Paul

content: I never regret anything. Because every little detail of your life is what made you into who you are in the end.
author: Drew Barrymore

content: Take a chance! All life is a chance. The man who goes farthest is generally the one who is willing to do and dare.
author: Dale Carnegie

content: Early in life I had to choose between honest arrogance and hypocritical humility. I chose the former and have seen no reason to change.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

content: The highest use of capital is not to make more money, but to make money do more for the betterment of life.
author: Henry Ford

content: Affection is responsible for nine-tenths of whatever solid and durable happiness there is in our lives.
author: C. S. Lewis

content: Immature love says: 'I love you because I need you.' Mature love says 'I need you because I love you.'
author: Erich Fromm

content: I have found the paradox, that if you love until it hurts, there can be no more hurt, only more love.
author: Mother Teresa

content: For it was not into my ear you whispered, but into my heart. It was not my lips you kissed, but my soul.
author: Judy Garland

content: If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you.
author: A. A. Milne

content: Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war love is a growing up.
author: James A. Baldwin

content: Can miles truly separate you from friends... If you want to be with someone you love, aren't you already there?
author: Richard Bach

content: Absence diminishes mediocre passions and increases great ones, as the wind extinguishes candles and fans fires.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

content: Love is our true destiny. We do not find the meaning of life by ourselves alone - we find it with another.
author: Thomas Merton

content: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line. You really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world.
author: Lucille Ball

content: Love is always bestowed as a gift - freely, willingly and without expectation. We don't love to be loved we love to love.
author: Leo Buscaglia

content: The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved loved for ourselves, or rather, loved in spite of ourselves.
author: Victor Hugo

content: Love is of all passions the strongest, for it attacks simultaneously the head, the heart and the senses.
author: Lao Tzu

content: What love we've given, we'll have forever. What love we fail to give, will be lost for all eternity.
author: Leo Buscaglia

content: How absurd and delicious it is to be in love with somebody younger than yourself. Everybody should try it.
author: Barbara Pym

content: There is no disguise which can hide love for long where it exists, or simulate it where it does not.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

content: I love that feeling of being in love, the effect of having butterflies when you wake up in the morning. That is special.
author: Jennifer Aniston

content: Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence.
author: David Byrne

content: Love is the only reality and it is not a mere sentiment. It is the ultimate truth that lies at the heart of creation.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

content: There is no surprise more magical than the surprise of being loved: It is God's finger on man's shoulder.
author: Charles Morgan

content: If you can learn to love yourself and all the flaws, you can love other people so much better. And that makes you so happy.
author: Kristin Chenoweth

content: Love is the word used to label the sexual excitement of the young, the habituation of the middle-aged, and the mutual dependence of the old.
author: John Ciardi

content: Woe to the man whose heart has not learned while young to hope, to love - and to put its trust in life.
author: Joseph Conrad

content: Love is a springtime plant that perfumes everything with its hope, even the ruins to which it clings.
author: Gustave Flaubert

content: Love is much nicer to be in than an automobile accident, a tight girdle, a higher tax bracket or a holding pattern over Philadelphia.
author: Judith Viorst

content: When we lose one we love, our bitterest tears are called forth by the memory of hours when we loved not enough.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

content: In our life there is a single color, as on an artist's palette, which provides the meaning of life and art. It is the color of love.
author: Marc Chagall

content: Darkness cannot drive out darkness only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate only love can do that.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

content: My great hope is to laugh as much as I cry to get my work done and try to love somebody and have the courage to accept the love in return.
author: Maya Angelou

content: Don't aim for success if you want it just do what you love and believe in, and it will come naturally.
author: David Frost

content: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive - to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: Man must evolve for all human conflict a method which rejects revenge, aggression and retaliation. The foundation of such a method is love.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

content: Never forget the three powerful resources you always have available to you: love, prayer, and forgiveness.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

content: Before marriage, a girl has to make love to a man to hold him. After marriage, she has to hold him to make love to him.
author: Marilyn Monroe

content: It may be true that the law cannot make a man love me, but it can keep him from lynching me, and I think that's pretty important.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

content: Love recognizes no barriers. It jumps hurdles, leaps fences, penetrates walls to arrive at its destination full of hope.
author: Maya Angelou

content: Between men and women there is no friendship possible. There is passion, enmity, worship, love, but no friendship.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: I love being married. It's so great to find that one special person you want to annoy for the rest of your life.
author: Rita Rudner

content: If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. And if they don't, they never were.
author: Khalil Gibran

content: I say what I want to say and do what I want to do. There's no in between. People will either love you for it or hate you for it.
author: Eminem

content: The foundation stones for a balanced success are honesty, character, integrity, faith, love and loyalty.
author: Zig Ziglar

content: If you want a love message to be heard, it has got to be sent out. To keep a lamp burning, we have to keep putting oil in it.
author: Mother Teresa

content: Even the rich are hungry for love, for being cared for, for being wanted, for having someone to call their own.
author: Mother Teresa

content: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
author: Lao Tzu

content: The beauty of a woman must be seen from in her eyes, because that is the doorway to her heart, the place where love resides.
author: Audrey Hepburn

content: I honestly think it is better to be a failure at something you love than to be a success at something you hate.
author: George Burns

content: Love is like a beautiful flower which I may not touch, but whose fragrance makes the garden a place of delight just the same.
author: Helen Keller

content: I see when men love women. They give them but a little of their lives. But women when they love give everything.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: God proved His love on the Cross. When Christ hung, and bled, and died, it was God saying to the world, 'I love you.'
author: Billy Graham

content: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: Love does not consist in gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

content: Love to faults is always blind, always is to joy inclined. Lawless, winged, and unconfined, and breaks all chains from every mind.
author: William Shakespeare

content: I guess I have always been deeply terrified to really be someone's wife since I know from life one cannot love another, ever, really.
author: Marilyn Monroe

content: I have a very strong feeling that the opposite of love is not hate - it's apathy. It's not giving a damn.
author: Leo Buscaglia

content: If you want to be successful, it's just this simple. Know what you are doing. Love what you are doing. And believe in what you are doing.
author: Will Rogers

content: Find joy in everything you choose to do. Every job, relationship, home... it's your responsibility to love it, or change it.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

content: This is one of the miracles of love: It gives a power of seeing through its own enchantments and yet not being disenchanted.
author: C. S. Lewis

content: Love one another, but make not a bond of love: Let it rather be a moving sea between the shores of your souls.
author: Khalil Gibran

content: What light is to the eyes - what air is to the lungs - what love is to the heart, liberty is to the soul of man.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

content: Women love us for our defects. If we have enough of them, they will forgive us everything, even our gigantic intellects.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: Man's nature is not essentially evil. Brute nature has been know to yield to the influence of love. You must never despair of human nature.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: Is it not enough to know the evil to shun it? If not, we should be sincere enough to admit that we love evil too well to give it up.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before emperors. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.
author: Khalil Gibran

content: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.
author: Anais Nin

content: I'll love you, dear, I'll love you till China and Africa meet and the river jumps over the mountain and the salmon sing in the street.
author: W. H. Auden

content: I swear, by my life and my love of it, that I will never live for the sake of another man, nor ask another man to live for mine.
author: Ayn Rand

content: Three grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.
author: Joseph Addison

content: Today I love myself as I love my god: who could charge me with a sin today? I know only sins against my god but who knows my god?
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: Guilt for being rich, and guilt thinking that perhaps love and peace isn't enough and you have to go and get shot or something.
author: John Lennon

content: Truth is handsomer than the affectation of love. Your goodness must have some edge to it, else it is none.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: There is not enough love and goodness in the world to permit giving any of it away to imaginary beings.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: I have no hostility to nature, but a child's love to it. I expand and live in the warm day like corn and melons.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Death is a challenge. It tells us not to waste time... It tells us to tell each other right now that we love each other.
author: Leo Buscaglia

content: Hallow the body as a temple to comeliness and sanctify the heart as a sacrifice to love love recompenses the adorers.
author: Khalil Gibran

content: Sex without love is a meaningless experience, but as far as meaningless experiences go its pretty damn good.
author: Woody Allen

content: The wise are wise only because they love. The fool are fools only because they think they can understand love.
author: Paulo Coelho

content: Love thy neighbor - and if he happens to be tall, debonair and devastating, it will be that much easier.
author: Mae West

content: Men who think that a woman's past love affairs lessen her love for them are usually stupid and weak.
author: Marilyn Monroe

content: I am good, but not an angel. I do sin, but I am not the devil. I am just a small girl in a big world trying to find someone to love.
author: Marilyn Monroe

content: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
author: Albert Schweitzer

content: Love has nothing to do with what you are expecting to get - only with what you are expecting to give - which is everything.
author: Katharine Hepburn

content: The time I burned my guitar it was like a sacrifice. You sacrifice the things you love. I love my guitar.
author: Jimi Hendrix

content: I have an everyday religion that works for me. Love yourself first, and everything else falls into line.
author: Lucille Ball

content: Let us dream of tomorrow where we can truly love from the soul, and know love as the ultimate truth at the heart of all creation.
author: Michael Jackson

content: The struggle of my life created empathy - I could relate to pain, being abandoned, having people not love me.
author: Oprah Winfrey

content: The fickleness of the women I love is only equalled by the infernal constancy of the women who love me.
author: George Bernard Shaw

content: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.
author: Og Mandino

content: Love is always open arms. If you close your arms about love you will find that you are left holding only yourself.
author: Leo Buscaglia

content: Love grows by giving. The love we give away is the only love we keep. The only way to retain love is to give it away.
author: Elbert Hubbard

content: We always deceive ourselves twice about the people we love - first to their advantage, then to their disadvantage.
author: Albert Camus

content: There is no scarcity of opportunity to make a living at what you love there's only scarcity of resolve to make it happen.
author: Wayne Dyer

content: I often try to tell kids to think about all the people who love you, don't cry over the one person who doesn't.
author: Bill Cosby

content: To keep your marriage brimming, With love in the loving cup, Whenever you're wrong, admit it Whenever you're right, shut up.
author: Ogden Nash

content: The Eskimos had fifty-two names for snow because it was important to them: there ought to be as many for love.
author: Margaret Atwood

content: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others, by means of love, friendship, indignation and compassion.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

content: I am certainly not an authority on love because there are no authorities on love, just those who've had luck with it and those who haven't.
author: Bill Cosby

content: To abandon oneself to principles is really to die - and to die for an impossible love which is the contrary of love.
author: Albert Camus

content: In the silence of night I have often wished for just a few words of love from one man, rather than the applause of thousands of people.
author: Judy Garland

content: The ultimate lesson all of us have to learn is unconditional love, which includes not only others but ourselves as well.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

content: True love comes quietly, without banners or flashing lights. If you hear bells, get your ears checked.
author: Erich Segal

content: I love to think of nature as an unlimited broadcasting station, through which God speaks to us every hour, if we will only tune in.
author: George Washington Carver

content: I like America, just as everybody else does. I love America, I gotta say that. But America will be judged.
author: Bob Dylan

content: It's tangible, it's solid, it's beautiful. It's artistic, from my standpoint, and I just love real estate.
author: Donald Trump

content: Any fool knows that bravado is always a cover-up for insecurity. That's the truth. And on that note, I'll say goodnight. God love you.
author: Bobby Darin

content: If having a soul means being able to feel love and loyalty and gratitude, then animals are better off than a lot of humans.
author: James Herriot

content: There are more love songs than anything else. If songs could make you do something we'd all love one another.
author: Frank Zappa

content: What I know is, is that if you do work that you love, and the work fulfills you, the rest will come.
author: Oprah Winfrey

content: I'm not saying that love always takes you to heaven. Your life can become a nightmare. But that said, it is worth taking the risk.
author: Paulo Coelho

content: I love argument, I love debate. I don't expect anyone just to sit there and agree with me, that's not their job.
author: Margaret Thatcher

content: We can't form our children on our own concepts we must take them and love them as God gives them to us.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: For love would be love of the wrong thing there is yet faith, But the faith and the love and the hope are all in the waiting.
author: T. S. Eliot

content: Love has its place, as does hate. Peace has its place, as does war. Mercy has its place, as do cruelty and revenge.
author: Meir Kahane

content: I love America more than any other country in this world, and, exactly for this reason, I insist on the right to criticize her perpetually.
author: James A. Baldwin

content: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.
author: Elie Wiesel

content: Women have simple tastes. They get pleasure out of the conversation of children in arms and men in love.
author: H. L. Mencken

content: Among those whom I like or admire, I can find no common denominator, but among those whom I love, I can: all of them make me laugh.
author: W. H. Auden

content: All brave men love for he only is brave who has affections to fight for, whether in the daily battle of life, or in physical contests.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

content: How I Love Lucy was born? We decided that instead of divorce lawyers profiting from our mistakes, we'd profit from them.
author: Lucille Ball

content: Love, like a chicken salad or restaurant hash, must be taken with blind faith or it loses its flavor.
author: Helen Rowland

content: We cannot fashion our children after our desires, we must have them and love them as God has given them to us.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: To be in love is merely to be in a state of perceptual anesthesia - to mistake an ordinary young woman for a goddess.
author: H. L. Mencken

content: There is no time for cut-and-dried monotony. There is time for work. And time for love. That leaves no other time!
author: Coco Chanel

content: If there is such a thing as a good marriage, it is because it resembles friendship rather than love.
author: Michel de Montaigne

content: There are fathers who do not love their children there is no grandfather who does not adore his grandson.
author: Victor Hugo

content: What I am is how I came out. No one's perfect and you just have to accept your flaws and learn to love yourself.
author: Kelly Brook

content: A man always remembers his first love with special tenderness, but after that he begins to bunch them.
author: H. L. Mencken

content: Marriage is not a noun it's a verb. It isn't something you get. It's something you do. It's the way you love your partner every day.
author: Barbara de Angelis

content: There is a courtesy of the heart it is allied to love. From its springs the purest courtesy in the outward behavior.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: The body is a house of many windows: there we all sit, showing ourselves and crying on the passers-by to come and love us.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

content: Alcohol is like love. The first kiss is magic, the second is intimate, the third is routine. After that you take the girl's clothes off.
author: Raymond Chandler

content: Love seeketh not itself to please, nor for itself hath any care, but for another gives its ease, and builds a Heaven in Hell's despair.
author: William Blake

content: Love is the delightful interval between meeting a beautiful girl and discovering that she looks like a haddock.
author: John Barrymore

content: All happiness or unhappiness solely depends upon the quality of the object to which we are attached by love.
author: Baruch Spinoza

content: Love is an emotion that is based on an opinion of women that is impossible for those who have had any experience with them.
author: H. L. Mencken

content: Mothers are the people who love us for no good reason. And those of us who are mothers know it's the most exquisite love of all.
author: Maggie Gallagher

content: Our dilemma is that we hate change and love it at the same time what we really want is for things to remain the same but get better.
author: Sydney J. Harris

content: Chemistry can be a good and bad thing. Chemistry is good when you make love with it. Chemistry is bad when you make crack with it.
author: Adam Sandler

content: Whenever you hear a man speak of his love for his country, it is a sign that he expects to be paid for it.
author: H. L. Mencken

content: Love is a portion of the soul itself, and it is of the same nature as the celestial breathing of the atmosphere of paradise.
author: Victor Hugo

content: Just don't give up trying to do what you really want to do. Where there is love and inspiration, I don't think you can go wrong.
author: Ella Fitzgerald

content: The highest patriotism is not a blind acceptance of official policy, but a love of one's country deep enough to call her to a higher plain.
author: George McGovern

content: Love is an attempt at penetrating another being, but it can only succeed if the surrender is mutual.
author: Octavio Paz

content: Love is easy, and I love writing. You can't resist love. You get an idea, someone says something, and you're in love.
author: Ray Bradbury

content: Act happy, feel happy, be happy, without a reason in the world. Then you can love, and do what you will.
author: Dan Millman

content: I love you, and because I love you, I would sooner have you hate me for telling you the truth than adore me for telling you lies.
author: Pietro Aretino

content: I tore myself away from the safe comfort of certainties through my love for truth - and truth rewarded me.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

content: No woman ever hates a man for being in love with her, but many a woman hate a man for being a friend to her.
author: Alexander Pope

content: There isn't any formula or method. You learn to love by loving - by paying attention and doing what one thereby discovers has to be done.
author: Aldous Huxley

content: Where love rules, there is no will to power and where power predominates, there love is lacking. The one is the shadow of the other.
author: Carl Jung

content: If one of two lovers is loyal, and the other jealous and false, how may their friendship last, for Love is slain!
author: Marie de France

content: Why love if losing hurts so much? I have no answers anymore only the life I have lived. The pain now is part of the happiness then.
author: Anthony Hopkins

content: I'm getting a wrinkle above my eyebrow because I just can't stop lifting it, and I love that you know.
author: Angelina Jolie

content: It is with an old love as it is with old age a man lives to all the miseries, but is dead to all the pleasures.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

content: Love and kindness are never wasted. They always make a difference. They bless the one who receives them, and they bless you, the giver.
author: Barbara de Angelis

content: The impulse to cruelty is, in many people, almost as violent as the impulse to sexual love - almost as violent and much more mischievous.
author: Aldous Huxley

content: A wedding anniversary is the celebration of love, trust, partnership, tolerance and tenacity. The order varies for any given year.
author: Paul Sweeney

content: You know, all that really matters is that the people you love are happy and healthy. Everything else is just sprinkles on the sundae.
author: Paul Walker

content: Nobody loves a woman because she is handsome or ugly, stupid or intelligent. We love because we love.
author: Honore de Balzac

content: Everyone can relate to love, hurt, pain, learning how to forgive, needing to get over, needing the power of God in their life.
author: Tyler Perry

content: If you cannot inspire a woman with love of you, fill her above the brim with love of herself all that runs over will be yours.

content: In friendship as well as love, ignorance very often contributes more to our happiness than knowledge.
