content: If you can kill animals, the same attitude can kill human beings. The mentality is the same which exploits nature and which creates wars.
author: Satish Kumar

content: Nature makes boys and girls lovely to look upon so they can be tolerated until they acquire some sense.
author: William Lyon Phelps

content: God is each truly and exalted thing, therefore the individual himself to the highest degree. But are not nature and the world individuals?
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

content: Humans have certain properties and characteristics which are intrinsic to them, just as every other organism does. That's human nature.
author: Noam Chomsky

content: Societies have always been shaped more by the nature of the media by which men communicate than by the content of the communication.
author: Marshall McLuhan

content: I believe it is in my nature to dance by virtue of the beat of my heart, the pulse of my blood and the music in my mind.

content: By its very nature the beautiful is isolated from everything else. From beauty no road leads to reality.

content: He who asks of life nothing but the improvement of his own nature... is less liable than anyone else to miss and waste life.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

content: To say to the painter that Nature is to be taken as she is, is to say to the player that he may sit on the piano.

content: It's incredible how nature sets females up to take care of people, and yet it is tricky for them to take care of themselves.
author: Bjork

content: An argument fatal to the communist theory, is suggested by the fact, that a desire for property is one of the elements of our nature.
author: Herbert Spencer

content: The art of healing comes from nature, not from the physician. Therefore the physician must start from nature, with an open mind.
author: Paracelsus

content: The beautiful spring came and when Nature resumes her loveliness, the human soul is apt to revive also.
author: Harriet Ann Jacobs

content: The stars, that nature hung in heaven, and filled their lamps with everlasting oil, give due light to the misled and lonely traveller.
author: John Milton

content: The body is ready to have babies. Nature wants it done then, when the body can handle it, not after 40, when the income can handle it.
author: Toni Morrison

content: It is a law of human nature that in victory even the coward may boast of his prowess, while defeat injures the reputation even of the brave.

content: Cruelty is a part of nature, at least of human nature, but it is the one thing that seems unnatural to us.

content: Poetry is emotion put into measure. The emotion must come by nature, but the measure can be acquired by art.

content: Conservatives sense a link between television and drugs, but they do not grasp the nature of this connection.
author: Christopher Lasch

content: All a musician can do is to get closer to the sources of nature, and so feel that he is in communion with the natural laws.

content: Many people believe that they are attracted by God, or by Nature, when they are only repelled by man.
author: William Ralph Inge

content: Is there some principal of nature which states that we never know the quality of what we have until it is gone?

content: It's human nature to start taking things for granted again when danger isn't banging loudly on the door.
author: David Hackworth

content: There's a constantly applicable nature to soul music, whereas sometimes pop music can be a periodical.
author: John Mayer

content: What is called an acute knowledge of human nature is mostly nothing but the observer's own weaknesses reflected back from others.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

content: I've probably understood men too well. I realise they are predatory by nature, and I have a certain acceptance of the male animal.
author: Jacqueline Bisset

content: Greed is a basic part of animal nature. Being against it is like being against breathing or eating. It means nothing.
author: Ben Stein

content: Many difficulties which nature throws in our way, may be smoothed away by the exercise of intelligence.
author: Titus Livius

content: Whatsoever is contrary to nature is contrary to reason, and whatsoever is contrary to reason is absurd.
author: Baruch Spinoza

content: I wish that all of nature's magnificence, the emotion of the land, the living energy of place could be photographed.
author: Annie Leibovitz

content: I can tell you for sure: people who are at their peak right now will not sustain that. You can't. It's against the law of nature.
author: Bryan Cranston

content: Don't be afraid in nature: one must be bold, at the risk of having been deceived and making mistakes.
author: Camille Pissarro

content: I attribute the quarrelsome nature of the Middle Ages young men entirely to the want of the soothing weed.
author: Jerome K. Jerome

content: Human nature doesn't include all human beings. There are human beings who are indifferent to politics, religion, virtually anything.
author: Conor Cruise O'Brien

content: Nature never said to me: Do not be poor still less did she say: Be rich her cry to me was always: Be independent.
author: Nicolas Chamfort

content: Listen, if there's one sure-fire rule that I have learned in this business, it's that I don't know anything about human nature.
author: Francis Ford Coppola

content: The highest purpose is to have no purpose at all. This puts one in accord with nature, in her manner of operation.
author: John Cage

content: The exposed nature of life in the public square affects leaders' attitudes toward risk - and failure.
author: Dee Dee Myers

content: Such is the audacity of man, that he hath learned to counterfeit Nature, yea, and is so bold as to challenge her in her work.
author: Pliny the Elder

content: The gifts of nature are infinite in their variety, and mind differs from mind almost as much as body from body.
author: Quintilian

content: I don't think I'll ever be able to stay in one place for more than a year or two. It's not in my nature.
author: Ricky Williams

content: Compassion is a call, a demand of nature, to relieve the unhappy as hunger is a natural call for food.
author: Joseph Butler

content: The noble simplicity in the works of nature only too often originates in the noble shortsightedness of him who observes it.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

content: Nature is not only all that is visible to the eye... it also includes the inner pictures of the soul.
author: Edvard Munch

content: I don't understand the notion that modern farming is anything do to with nature. It's a pretty gross interference with nature.
author: Peter Singer

content: Beauty is nature's brag, and must be shown in courts, at feasts, and high solemnities, where most may wonder at the workmanship.
author: John Milton

content: Love of man for woman - love of woman for man. That's the nature, the meaning, the best of life itself.
author: Zane Grey

content: Growing hemp as nature designed it is vital to our urgent need to reduce greenhouse gases and ensure the survival of our planet.
author: Jack Herer

content: It's a great event to get outside and enjoy nature. I find it very exciting no matter how many times I see bald eagles.
author: Karen Armstrong

content: Only that thing is free which exists by the necessities of its own nature, and is determined in its actions by itself alone.
author: Baruch Spinoza

content: Natural science, does not simply describe and explain nature it is part of the interplay between nature and ourselves.
author: Werner Heisenberg

content: Nature says women are human beings, men have made religions to deny it. Nature says women are human beings, men cry out no!
author: Taslima Nasrin

content: I found myself in a race with Mother Nature to play as much baseball as I could before she forced me to stop.
author: Willie Stargell

content: Mothers all want their sons to grow up to be president, but they don't want them to become politicians in the process.
author: John F. Kennedy

content: Parentage is a very important profession, but no test of fitness for it is ever imposed in the interest of the children.
author: George Bernard Shaw

content: Most children threaten at times to run away from home. This is the only thing that keeps some parents going.
author: Phyllis Diller

content: At the end of the day, the most overwhelming key to a child's success is the positive involvement of parents.
author: Jane D. Hull

content: I think a dad has to make his daughter feel that he's genuinely interested in what she's going through.
author: Harry Connick, Jr.

content: Loving a child doesn't mean giving in to all his whims to love him is to bring out the best in him, to teach him to love what is difficult.
author: Nadia Boulanger

content: The interesting thing about being a mother is that everyone wants pets, but no one but me cleans the kitty litter.
author: Meryl Streep

content: Having a baby changes the way you view your in-laws. I love it when they come to visit now. They can hold the baby and I can go out.
author: Matthew Broderick

content: There are only two lasting bequests we can hope to give our children. One of these is roots, the other, wings.
author: Hodding Carter

content: It is a sad commentary of our times when our young must seek advice and counsel from 'Dear Abby' instead of going to Mom and Dad.
author: Abigail Van Buren

content: What good mothers and fathers instinctively feel like doing for their babies is usually best after all.
author: Benjamin Spock

content: No one knows his true character until he has run out of gas, purchased something on the installment plan and raised an adolescent.
author: Marcelene Cox

content: I don't think children's inner feelings have changed. They still want a mother and father in the very same house they want places to play.
author: Beverly Cleary

content: What feeling is so nice as a child's hand in yours? So small, so soft and warm, like a kitten huddling in the shelter of your clasp.
author: Marjorie Holmes

content: I think I'm going to have to live vicariously through my daughter's rebellion because I certainly never did go through adolescence.
author: Brooke Shields

content: Do you want to be an artist and a writer, or a wife and a lover? With kids, your focus changes. I don't want to go to PTA meetings.
author: Stevie Nicks

content: Home life's great, man. The kids are great, happy and healthy. I've reached this sort of wonderful precipice.
author: Ryan Phillippe

content: Mama and Daddy King represent the best in manhood and womanhood, the best in a marriage, the kind of people we are trying to become.
author: Coretta Scott King

content: What lingers from the parent's individual past, unresolved or incomplete, often becomes part of her or his irrational parenting.
author: Virginia Satir

content: Parenting is the most important job on the planet next to keeping Gary Busey off the nation's highways.
author: Dennis Miller

content: Indeed - judicious, consistent parenting is a dream of mine. No judgements, learning space and listening carefully are my goals.
author: Emma Thompson

content: I barely have time for my own children. To adopt more children and not have time for them, that would be poor parenting on my part.
author: Mary J. Blige

content: I hope to find the roles that are age appropriate but not yearning to be younger, or parenting ad nauseam.
author: Debra Winger

content: So, you know, parenting is a very intimate and amazing experience and one of the best experiences of my life.
author: Uma Thurman

content: Parents are key when it comes to keeping kids off drugs. Good parenting is the best anti-drug we have.
author: Mel Carnahan

content: How many a man has thrown up his hands at a time when a little more effort, a little more patience would have achieved success.
author: Elbert Hubbard

content: It is easier to find men who will volunteer to die, than to find those who are willing to endure pain with patience.
author: Julius Caesar

content: There is something good in all seeming failures. You are not to see that now. Time will reveal it. Be patient.
author: Sivananda

content: Let him that hath no power of patience retire within himself, though even there he will have to put up with himself.
author: Baltasar Gracian

content: Patience is the most necessary quality for business, many a man would rather you heard his story than grant his request.
author: Lord Chesterfield

content: A healthy male adult bore consumes each year one and a half times his own weight in other people's patience.
author: John Updike

content: Good ideas are not adopted automatically. They must be driven into practice with courageous patience.
author: Hyman Rickover

content: A wise man is superior to any insults which can be put upon him, and the best reply to unseemly behavior is patience and moderation.
author: Moliere

content: If patience is worth anything, it must endure to the end of time. And a living faith will last in the midst of the blackest storm.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: I have just three things to teach: simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures.
author: Lao Tzu

content: The marvel of all history is the patience with which men and women submit to burdens unnecessarily laid upon them by their governments.
author: George Washington

content: It is strange that the years teach us patience that the shorter our time, the greater our capacity for waiting.
author: Elizabeth Taylor

content: I learned patience, perseverance, and dedication. Now I really know myself, and I know my voice. It's a voice of pain and victory.
author: Anthony Hamilton

content: Patience and perseverance have a magical effect before which difficulties disappear and obstacles vanish.
author: John Quincy Adams

content: A garden is a grand teacher. It teaches patience and careful watchfulness it teaches industry and thrift above all it teaches entire trust.
author: Gertrude Jekyll

content: Affliction is the wholesome soil of virtue, where patience, honor, sweet humility, and calm fortitude, take root and strongly flourish.
author: David Mallet

content: I have declared that patience is never more than patient. I too have declared, that I who am not patient am patient.
author: Gertrude Stein

content: It is impossible to practice parliamentary politics without having patience, decency, politeness and courtesy.
author: Khaleda Zia

content: I have all the patience in the world about Sirens. For me it's not a Grateful Dead project, it's a Me project.
author: Jerry Garcia

content: Gardeners are good at nurturing, and they have a great quality of patience, they're tender. They have to be persistent.
author: Ralph Fiennes

content: Patience can't be acquired overnight. It is just like building up a muscle. Every day you need to work on it.
author: Eknath Easwaran

content: There is no substitute for hard work, 23 or 24 hours a day. And there is no substitute for patience and acceptance.
author: Cesar Chavez

content: If I could have one prayer answered, I would pray for patience. I move so fast sometimes. I try to slow down.
author: Debra Winger

content: It's a war of attrition. If you have patience and a modicum of faith in yourself your chances are not too bad.
author: Julie Bowen

content: I don't play pyrotechnic scales. I play about frustration, patience, anger. Music is an extension of my soul.
author: Dick Dale

content: Only those who have patience to do simple things perfectly ever acquire the skill to do difficult things easily.
author: James J. Corbett

content: I believe there's too little patience and context to many of the investigations I read or see on television.
author: Bob Woodward

content: Artists know that diligence counts as much, if not more, as inspiration in art, as in politics, patience counts as much as revolution.
author: Tony Kushner

content: Patience was not something that came naturally to me, but in cooking it is the quintessential skill.
author: Gail Simmons

content: You have to find the peace and patience within yourself to be a model and an example to others and not judge.
author: Judith Light

content: No, you're not allowed to be bossy when you're married. You have to learn compromise, and compassion and patience.
author: Star Jones

content: Honestly, I didn't have the patience for biology or history in an academic sense, but I always liked the kind of big questions.
author: Andrew Bird

content: Secretary of War Stanton used to get out of patience with Lincoln because he was all the time pardoning men who ought to be shot.
author: Elihu Root

content: My advice to someone to follow in my footsteps is to have patience. I've been doing this for twelve years.
author: Christina Milian

content: Is the patience of the American people that long suffering? Is there no outrage left in the country?
author: Andrew Greeley

content: Everything is out there if you know how to find it, and have the patience. I don't and haven't, but that's my problem.
author: Tom Holt

content: Americans have less and less patience for the intrusive and divisive moral scolds who thrived in the bubbles of the Clinton and Bush years.
author: Frank Rich

content: Tolerance, compromise, understanding, acceptance, patience - I want those all to be very sharp tools in my shed.
author: Cee Lo Green

content: Constant repetition of tongue-twisters was like lifting weights for me, but patience and persistence have paid off.
author: Nicholas Brendon

content: I've learned the importance of loving what you do. I have also learned more patience due to the nature of the music business.
author: Randy Travis

content: It's amazing. My kids have grown me in ways I never knew possible. The patience I've received and the love I get from them is just amazing.
author: Candace Cameron Bure

content: So it's been a slow process and it's taken some patience. That's why patients are called patients I think - patience is required.
author: Bowie Kuhn

content: You're not supposed to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who says it.
author: Malcolm X

content: Patriotism is your conviction that this country is superior to all others because you were born in it.

content: The highest patriotism is not a blind acceptance of official policy, but a love of one's country deep enough to call her to a higher plain.

content: Patriotism is easy to understand in America. It means looking out for yourself by looking out for your country.

content: Patriotism is when love of your own people comes first nationalism, when hate for people other than your own comes first.

content: The greater the state, the more wrong and cruel its patriotism, and the greater is the sum of suffering upon which its power is founded.

content: A nation is a society united by a delusion about its ancestry and by common hatred of its neighbours.

content: We'll try to cooperate fully with the IRS, because, as citizens, we feel a strong patriotic duty not to go to jail.

content: I do think the patriotic thing to do is to critique my country. How else do you make a country better but by pointing out its flaws?

content: Unless our conception of patriotism is progressive, it cannot hope to embody the real affection and the real interest of the nation.

content: Intellectually I know that America is no better than any other country emotionally I know she is better than every other country.

content: I'm an advocate of the great Dr. Johnson, the English man of letters who said that patriotism was the last refuge of the scoundrel.

content: The proper means of increasing the love we bear our native country is to reside some time in a foreign one.

content: The most tragic paradox of our time is to be found in the failure of nation-states to recognize the imperatives of internationalism.

content: I saw courage both in the Vietnam War and in the struggle to stop it. I learned that patriotism includes protest, not just military service.

content: Heroism on command, senseless violence, and all the loathsome nonsense that goes by the name of patriotism - how passionately I hate them!

content: I define nothing. Not beauty, not patriotism. I take each thing as it is, without prior rules about what it should be.

content: You're not supposed to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong no matter who does it or who says it.

content: Patriotism, when it wants to make itself felt in the domain of learning, is a dirty fellow who should be thrown out of doors.

content: During times of war, hatred becomes quite respectable even though it has to masquerade often under the guise of patriotism.

content: Patriotism is an ephemeral motive that scarcely ever outlasts the particular threat to society that aroused it.

content: Patriotism consists not in waving the flag, but in striving that our country shall be righteous as well as strong.

content: Patriotism is not a short and frenzied outburst of emotion but the tranquil and steady dedication of a lifetime.

content: There are those who wrap themselves in flags and blow the tinny trumpet of patriotism as a means of fooling the people.

content: It is our conduct, our patriotism and belief in our American way of life, our courage that will win the final battle.

content: The most valuable possession you can own is an open heart. The most powerful weapon you can be is an instrument of peace.

content: Peace and friendship with all mankind is our wisest policy, and I wish we may be permitted to pursue it.

content: War will never cease until babies begin to come into the world with larger cerebrums and smaller adrenal glands.

content: Guilt for being rich, and guilt thinking that perhaps love and peace isn't enough and you have to go and get shot or something.

content: In the Peace Corps, the volunteer must be a fully developed, mature person. He must not join to run abroad or escape problems.

content: The Peace Corps would give thousands of young Americans a chance to see at first hand the conditions in remote areas of the world.

content: A diplomatic peace is not yet the real peace. It is an essential step in the peace process leading towards a real peace.

content: You have to find the peace and patience within yourself to be a model and an example to others and not judge.

content: Challenging the integrity of the non-proliferation regime is a matter which can affect international peace and security.

content: Let's win the peace and democracy the good people of Iraq so richly deserve after decades of tyranny.

content: Obsessed by a fairy tale, we spend our lives searching for a magic door and a lost kingdom of peace.

content: Isaac and I are going to Israel to ride for peace enviromental justice and a safer world for us all.

content: I know of no greater work for humanity than in the cause of peace, which can only be achieved by the earnest efforts of nations and peoples.

content: I share the opinion of those of broader vision, who see in the signs of the time hope of humanity for peace.

content: Some people put up a peace sign with one hand. Some people put up the middle finger instead. I use two hands and put up both.

content: But since independence, Gabon is one of the few countries in Central Africa that enjoys peace and stability.

content: Our civilization is now in the transition stage between the age of warring empires and a new age of world unity and peace.

content: Mr. Speaker, I rise today to recognize the Peace Corps as it reached its 45th anniversary on March 1, 2006.

content: In addition to serving overseas, the Peace Corps' Crisis Corps Volunteers have helped their fellow Americans.

content: Well I think it has always been a mistake to reduce the peace process in Ireland to a decommissioning process.

content: I have often supported Israel, I have often visited the country and want the country to exist and at last find peace with its neighbours.

content: Since creation of the E.U. a half century ago, Europe has enjoyed the longest period of peace in its history.

content: Freedom of expression comes with responsibilities, especially when it comes with serious implications for peace.

content: We must join with the tens of millions all over the world who see in peace our most sacred responsibility.

content: There are different things one can do to establish and hasten the peace process. Meditation is one way.

content: Poetry brings all possible experience to the same degree: a degree in the consciousness beyond which the consciousness itself cannot go.

content: No art form points like poetry to this originality of language as to its essential and abiding concern.

content: Conversation may be compared to a lyre with seven chords - philosophy, art, poetry, love, scandal, and the weather.

content: Whereas with poetry no one has to show anybody really, and you don't have to tell anyone you're doing it.

content: Poetry had far better imply things than preach them directly... in the open pulpit her voice grows hoarse and fails.

content: Prior to Wordsworth, humor was an essential part of poetry. I mean, they don't call them Shakespeare comedies for nothing.

content: I think that the job of poetry, its political job, is to refresh the idea of justice, which is going dead in us all the time.

content: Some Marines made fun of the fact that I had done plays and studied poetry, but then I won the award for physical training.

content: Freedom is poetry, taking liberties with words, breaking the rules of normal speech, violating common sense. Freedom is violence.

content: Stadium rock and commercial rock are the opposite of what poetry needs. An audience of around 200 is ideal for poetry.

content: The urge to write poetry is like having an itch. When the itch becomes annoying enough, you scratch it.

content: Poetry is an art, and chief of the fine art the easiest to dabble in, the hardest in which to reach true excellence.

content: Poetry is like making a joke. If you get one word wrong at the end of a joke, you've lost the whole thing.

content: One of the penalties for refusing to participate in politics is that you end up being governed by your inferiors.

content: If you put the federal government in charge of the Sahara Desert, in 5 years there'd be a shortage of sand.

content: A conservative is a man with two perfectly good legs who, however, has never learned how to walk forward.

content: Always vote for principle, though you may vote alone, and you may cherish the sweetest reflection that your vote is never lost.

content: In this world of sin and sorrow there is always something to be thankful for as for me, I rejoice that I am not a Republican.

content: The darkest places in hell are reserved for those who maintain their neutrality in times of moral crisis.

content: Politicians also have no leisure, because they are always aiming at something beyond political life itself, power and glory, or happiness.

content: Only government can take perfectly good paper, cover it with perfectly good ink and make the combination worthless.

content: A healthy democracy requires a decent society it requires that we are honorable, generous, tolerant and respectful.

content: Politics: A strife of interests masquerading as a contest of principles. The conduct of public affairs for private advantage.

content: There ain't no answer. There ain't gonna be any answer. There never has been an answer. That's the answer.

content: Whenever men take the law into their own hands, the loser is the law. And when the law loses, freedom languishes.

content: When bad men combine, the good must associate else they will fall one by one, an unpitied sacrifice in a contemptible struggle.

content: A diplomat is a person who can tell you to go to hell in such a way that you actually look forward to the trip.

content: Half of the American people have never read a newspaper. Half never voted for President. One hopes it is the same half.

content: When they see me holding fish, they can see that I am comfortable with kings as well as with paupers.

content: So long as we have enough people in this country willing to fight for their rights, we'll be called a democracy.

content: Confronted with the choice, the American people would choose the policeman's truncheon over the anarchist's bomb.

content: I have some very personal feelings about politics, but I don't get into it because I do comedy already.

content: It is money, money, money! Not ideas, not principles, but money that reigns supreme in American politics.

content: Politics, as a practise, whatever its professions, has always been the systematic organization of hatreds.
author: Henry Adams

content: I don't want to express my opinion about actual politics, because if I do, I have to be responsible for my decision.

content: A lot of men in politics suddenly woke up to the issue of women in politics when they realised: hey, there are votes in this!

content: In general people feel more relaxed about participating in politics. They aren't frightened as they used to be.

content: At the end of the day, money is just a proxy for votes. That is what makes politics so vulnerable to social media.

content: I try not to tune in to politics until it's two or three months before the election. Till then, it's like watching preseason football.

content: Artists know that diligence counts as much, if not more, as inspiration in art, as in politics, patience counts as much as revolution.

content: Human nature doesn't include all human beings. There are human beings who are indifferent to politics, religion, virtually anything.

content: The idea that religion and politics don't mix was invented by the Devil to keep Christians from running their own country.

content: I hate injustice, and I can't help but speak against it. But I don't want to get involved in politics.

content: I get asked a lot about getting into politics. I say, 'Take a look at politics. You tell me what seems appealing about that.'

content: In the world of energy politics, the sudden vanishing of the word 'coal' is a remarkable and unprecedented event.

content: Bloomberg is famously impatient with beltway politics and believes that to get anything done you need to work from the ground up.

content: I was really lucky that I came to puberty at a time when music and politics were completely intertwined.

content: Politics is much too serious to be taken too seriously equally, there are many aspects of it so laughable as to be lamentable.

content: The journey for women, no matter what venue it is - politics, business, film - it's, it's a long journey.

content: I understand the damage the expenses crisis has done to Parliament, and the paramount importance of restoring trust in our politics.

content: I don't take a great deal of interest in party politics. Social politics interests me a great deal more.

content: I've committed myself to serve my constituents in South Shields and I have committed myself to British politics.

content: You have to believe that it's through politics that societies can lead social and economic and political change.

content: Whenever you discuss politics, it is always better to use individual names rather then the term neocon.

content: The art of politics consists in knowing precisely when it is necessary to hit an opponent slightly below the belt.

content: In my early 20s, I studied history and politics, and I really thought that perhaps I would devote my life to that.

content: I'm not taking any interest in politics. I'm not involved in politics in any way. My life is in writing now.

content: Politics should share one purpose with religion: the steady emancipation of the individual through the education of his passions.

content: Value your freedom or you will lose it, teaches history. 'Don't bother us with politics', respond those who don't want to learn.

content: No. I probably do better not being in politics. They have too much control over you when you are in politics.

content: There's not a single chef I know of that does not think about the politics of the food they're serving.

content: I am not at all a politician. I don't think I'm cut out for politics. I am certainly not going to stand for election.

content: Things happen in American politics in the political center. If the President will meet us in the center, there are things we can accomplish.

content: I think Ralph Nader is the biggest liar in American politics when he said it didn't matter who was president.

content: Yes, you need substance in politics - but I think your style also says something about how you arrive at some of your conclusions.

content: The challenge in working in politics, particularly if you're working for a political party, is that everyone's a messenger.

content: Macroeconomic policy can never be devoid of politics: it involves fundamental trade-offs and affects different groups differently.

content: Even if we don't know it or aren't aware of it, politics and philosophy are really what make our up lives.

content: I'm interested in current affairs and social policy as a whole, but I don't watch politics for sport.

content: I think the rules are going to have to change for me to ever run for public office. My checkered past will always keep me out of politics.

content: I'm not entirely sure what my end goal is, but I'd love to get involved in city politics and broadcast TV.

content: I was supposed to be women's lib, and now I'd exceeded it and gone over into international politics.

content: Politics, like theater, is one of those things where you've got to be wise enough to know when to leave.

content: I take a very practical view of raising children. I put a sign in each of their rooms: 'Checkout Time is 18 years.'
author: Erma Bombeck

content: You cannot run away from weakness you must some time fight it out or perish and if that be so, why not now, and where you stand?

content: Many people take no care of their money till they come nearly to the end of it, and others do just the same with their time.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: The future rewards those who press on. I don't have time to feel sorry for myself. I don't have time to complain. I'm going to press on.

content: If you have time to whine and complain about something then you have the time to do something about it.
author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

content: The first time that I performed as an actor was the first day on the set of 'The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air.'

content: For a long time I tried to manage an honesty and openness about my personal life because I'm human and I'm normal - well, semi-normal.
author: Johnny Depp

content: We cast away priceless time in dreams, born of imagination, fed upon illusion, and put to death by reality.
author: Judy Garland

content: Every time I go and shave, I assume there's someone else on the planet shaving. So I say, 'I'm gonna go shave, too.'

content: A wise man will make haste to forgive, because he knows the true value of time, and will not suffer it to pass away in unnecessary pain.

content: For a long time now I have tried simply to write the best I can. Sometimes I have good luck and write better than I can.
author: Ernest Hemingway

content: We always live in an uncertain world. What is certain is that the United States will go forward over time.

content: We need to internalize this idea of excellence. Not many folks spend a lot of time trying to be excellent.

content: In Hollywood you can see things at night that are fast enough to be in the Olympics in the day time.

content: Y'know, you can't please all the people all the time... and last night, all those people were at my show.

content: Ezra was right half the time, and when he was wrong, he was so wrong you were never in any doubt about it.
author: Ernest Hemingway

content: If you set out to be liked, you would be prepared to compromise on anything at any time, and you would achieve nothing.

content: A dying man needs to die, as a sleepy man needs to sleep, and there comes a time when it is wrong, as well as useless, to resist.

content: Time and health are two precious assets that we don't recognize and appreciate until they have been depleted.

content: It may be true that you can't fool all the people all the time, but you can fool enough of them to rule a large country.

content: To keep your character intact you cannot stoop to filthy acts. It makes it easier to stoop the next time.

content: I remember the time I was kidnapped and they sent a piece of my finger to my father. He said he wanted more proof.

content: Death is a commingling of eternity with time in the death of a good man, eternity is seen looking through time.

content: Everything that goes up must come down. But there comes a time when not everything that's down can come up.

content: There comes a time in the affairs of man when he must take the bull by the tail and face the situation.

content: When my time on earth is gone, and my activities here are passed, I want they bury me upside down, and my critics can kiss my ass!

content: Faith is deliberate confidence in the character of God whose ways you may not understand at the time.

content: There is no time for cut-and-dried monotony. There is time for work. And time for love. That leaves no other time!

content: Art is always and everywhere the secret confession, and at the same time the immortal movement of its time.

content: We have what we seek, it is there all the time, and if we give it time, it will make itself known to us.

content: Whatever the universal nature assigns to any man at any time is for the good of that man at that time.

content: The wise man should restrain his senses like the crane and accomplish his purpose with due knowledge of his place, time and ability.

content: Regret for the things we did can be tempered by time it is regret for the things we did not do that is inconsolable.

content: Men have a much better time of it than women. For one thing, they marry later for another thing, they die earlier.

content: It pays to know the enemy - not least because at some time you may have the opportunity to turn him into a friend.

content: In rivers, the water that you touch is the last of what has passed and the first of that which comes so with present time.

content: Mr. President, you were elected to lead. You chose to follow. And now it's time for you to get out of the way.

content: Lives of great men all remind us, we can make our lives sublime, and, departing, leave behind us, footprints on the sands of time.

content: There is one kind of robber whom the law does not strike at, and who steals what is most precious to men: time.

content: Our dilemma is that we hate change and love it at the same time what we really want is for things to remain the same but get better.

content: Everybody thinks making films back to back is a big deal but they did it all the time in the old days.

content: Oh, God, I struggle with low self-esteem all the time! I think everyone does. I have so much wrong with me, it's unbelievable!

content: A man's brain has a more difficult time shifting from thinking to feeling than a women's brain does.

content: Every great architect is - necessarily - a great poet. He must be a great original interpreter of his time, his day, his age.

content: It's life isn't it? You plow ahead and make a hit. And you plow on and someone passes you. Then someone passes them. Time levels.

content: Acting deals with very delicate emotions. It is not putting up a mask. Each time an actor acts he does not hide he exposes himself.

content: I cannot be awake for nothing looks to me as it did before, Or else I am awake for the first time, and all before has been a mean sleep.

content: I have long known that it is part of God's plan for me to spend a little time with each of the most stupid people on earth.

content: Digital reading will completely take over. It's lightweight and it's fantastic for sharing. Over time it will take over.

content: The secret of a happy marriage is finding the right person. You know they're right if you love to be with them all the time.

content: I've done everything I wanted to do, even if I have had to pay a very high price - which has been the case most of the time.

content: People with clear, written goals, accomplish far more in a shorter period of time than people without them could ever imagine.

content: I like to do weird things in the shower, like drink my coffee, brush my teeth and drink a smoothie. It's good time management.

content: This is the miracle that happens every time to those who really love: the more they give, the more they possess.

content: 'The time has come,' the walrus said, 'to talk of many things: of shoes and ships - and sealing wax - of cabbages and kings.'

content: The loss of a friend is like that of a limb time may heal the anguish of the wound, but the loss cannot be repaired.

content: I have made the tough decisions, always with an eye toward the bottom line. Perhaps it's time America was run like a business.

content: Saying goodbye doesn't mean anything. It's the time we spent together that matters, not how we left it.

content: There is never time in the future in which we will work out our salvation. The challenge is in the moment the time is always now.

content: Leadership to me means duty, honor, country. It means character, and it means listening from time to time.

content: You are your greatest asset. Put your time, effort and money into training, grooming, and encouraging your greatest asset.

content: There is one thing stronger than all the armies in the world, and that is an idea whose time as come.

content: Religion is about turning untested belief into unshakable truth through the power of institutions and the passage of time.

content: We see past time in a telescope and present time in a microscope. Hence the apparent enormities of the present.

content: You are not a beautiful, unique snowflake... This is your life, and it's ending one minute at a time.

content: Under all speech that is good for anything there lies a silence that is better, Silence is deep as Eternity speech is shallow as Time.

content: A play should give you something to think about. When I see a play and understand it the first time, then I know it can't be much good.

content: We look forward to the time when the Power of Love will replace the Love of Power. Then will our world know the blessings of peace.

content: In every adversity there lies the seed of an equivalent advantage. In every defeat is a lesson showing you how to win the victory next time.

content: Nobody sees a flower really it is so small. We haven't time, and to see takes time - like to have a friend takes time.

content: For the very first time the young are seeing history being made before it is censored by their elders.

content: Men seldom, or rather never for a length of time and deliberately, rebel against anything that does not deserve rebelling against.

content: Every time you don't follow your inner guidance, you feel a loss of energy, loss of power, a sense of spiritual deadness.

content: The more time you spend contemplating what you should have done... you lose valuable time planning what you can and will do.

content: If a little dreaming is dangerous, the cure for it is not to dream less but to dream more, to dream all the time.

content: People say that if you find water rising up to your ankle, that's the time to do something about it, not when it's around your neck.

content: Sometimes overturning brutal regimes takes time and costs lives. I wish it weren't so. I really, really do.

content: Vision without action is merely a dream. Action without vision just passes the time. Vision with action can change the world.

content: The intellectual is different from the ordinary man, but only in certain sections of his personality, and even then not all the time.

content: When you stop learning, stop listening, stop looking and asking questions, always new questions, then it is time to die.

content: Poetry should help, not only to refine the language of the time, but to prevent it from changing too rapidly.

content: I try to keep it real. I don't have time to worry about what I'm projecting to the world. I'm just busy being myself.

content: Both in thought and in feeling, even though time be real, to realise the unimportance of time is the gate of wisdom.

content: Don't get too comfortable with who you are at any given time - you may miss the opportunity to become who you want to be.

content: It's time to say goodbye, but I think goodbyes are sad and I'd much rather say hello. Hello to a new adventure.

content: Next time I tell you someone from Texas should not be president of the United States, please pay attention.

content: I wish life was not so short, he thought. languages take such a time, and so do all the things one wants to know about.

content: If I hold back, I'm no good. I'm no good. I'd rather be good sometimes, than holding back all the time.

content: I feel when somebody has been playing cricket for a long time, he creates a separate identity for himself.

content: One of the most pervasive political visions of our time is the vision of liberals as compassionate and conservatives as less caring.

content: Every parent is at some time the father of the unreturned prodigal, with nothing to do but keep his house open to hope.

content: Thanks to television, for the first time the young are seeing history made before it is censored by their elders.

content: The shortest period of time lies between the minute you put some money away for a rainy day and the unexpected arrival of rain.

content: The time at our disposal each day is elastic the passions we feel dilate it, those that inspire us shrink it, and habit fills it.

content: One never reaches home, but wherever friendly paths intersect the whole world looks like home for a time.

content: Portland, Oregon won't build a mile of road without a mile of bike path. You can commute there, even with that weather, all the time.

content: Realize that if you have time to whine and complain about something then you have the time to do something about it.

content: I tell people I'm too stupid to know what's impossible. I have ridiculously large dreams, and half the time they come true.

content: From the time I was a kid, I always knew something was going to happen to me. Didn't know exactly what.

content: I do believe sometimes discipline is very important. I'm not just lying around like a lazy cow all the time.

content: That's my only goal. Surround myself with funny people, and make sure everyone has a good time and works hard.

content: I never said I wanted to be around for a long time. I always said I wanted to be here for a good time.

content: The first time you say something, it's heard. The second time, it's recognized, and the third time it's learned.

content: I passionately hate the idea of being with it I think an artist has always to be out of step with his time.

content: If one is master of one thing and understands one thing well, one has at the same time, insight into and understanding of many things.

content: Don't forget it's daylight savings time. You spring forward, then you fall back. It's like Robert Downey Jr. getting out of bed.

content: I think there are certain folks in Missouri that don't trust government. And they haven't trusted government for a long time.

content: Every time I write something, I think, this is the most offensive thing I will ever write. But no. I always surprise myself.

content: A pain stabbed my heart as it did every time I saw a girl I loved who was going the opposite direction in this too-big world.

content: Old age is an excellent time for outrage. My goal is to say or do at least one outrageous thing every week.

content: In order to experience everyday spirituality, we need to remember that we are spiritual beings spending some time in a human body.

content: Love is a piano dropped from a fourth story window, and you were in the wrong place at the wrong time.

content: Every possession and every happiness is but lent by chance for an uncertain time, and may therefore be demanded back the next hour.

content: Any time you think you have the game conquered, the game will turn around and punch you right in the nose.

content: You never give away your heart you lend it from time to time. If it were not so, how could we take it back without asking?

content: Children are smarter than any of us. Know how I know that? I don't know one child with a full time job and children.

content: The proper function of man is to live, not to exist. I shall not waste my days in trying to prolong them. I shall use my time.

content: I'm being treated like a sex object, cried the lady. No matter. I will take care of it, said Time soothingly.
author: Mason Cooley

content: Suicide, moreover, was at the time in vogue in Paris: what more suitable key to the mystery of life for a skeptical society?

content: No story is the same to us after a lapse of time or rather we who read it are no longer the same interpreters.
author: George Eliot

content: Sixth grade was a big time, in my childhood, of hoops and friendship, and coming up with funny things.
author: Adam Sandler

content: It's plain hokum. If you can't convince 'em, confuse 'em. It's an old political trick. But this time it won't work.

content: It's time to get real, folks. Hope and change ain't working. Hope and change is not a solution. Hope and change is not a job.

content: To be a Negro in this country and to be relatively conscious is to be in a rage almost all the time.
author: James A. Baldwin

content: If you wish to travel far and fast, travel light. Take off all your envies, jealousies, unforgiveness, selfishness and fears.

content: Reminds me of my safari in Africa. Somebody forgot the corkscrew and for several days we had to live on nothing but food and water.

content: No one realizes how beautiful it is to travel until he comes home and rests his head on his old, familiar pillow.

content: You know more of a road by having traveled it than by all the conjectures and descriptions in the world.
author: William Hazlitt

content: The world is a country which nobody ever yet knew by description one must travel through it one's self to be acquainted with it.

content: Certainly, travel is more than the seeing of sights it is a change that goes on, deep and permanent, in the ideas of living.

content: I never make a trip to the United States without visiting a supermarket. To me they are more fascinating than any fashion salon.

content: Everyone carries his own inch rule of taste, and amuses himself by applying it, triumphantly, wherever he travels.
author: Henry Adams

content: I am not a great cook, I am not a great artist, but I love art, and I love food, so I am the perfect traveller.

content: Certain travellers give the impression that they keep moving because only then do they feel fully alive.
author: Ella Maillart

content: We are what our thoughts have made us so take care about what you think. Words are secondary. Thoughts live they travel far.
author: Swami Vivekananda

content: If you want to succeed you should strike out on new paths, rather than travel the worn paths of accepted success.

content: The land created me. I'm wild and lonesome. Even as I travel the cities, I'm more at home in the vacant lots.

content: For my part, I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move.

content: Everywhere is nowhere. When a person spends all his time in foreign travel, he ends by having many acquaintances, but no friends.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

content: The whole object of travel is not to set foot on foreign land it is at last to set foot on one's own country as a foreign land.

content: The cool thing about being famous is traveling. I have always wanted to travel across seas, like to Canada and stuff.
author: Britney Spears

content: It always rains on tents. Rainstorms will travel thousands of miles, against prevailing winds for the opportunity to rain on a tent.
author: Dave Barry

content: I never saw a discontented tree. They grip the ground as though they liked it, and though fast rooted they travel about as far as we do.
author: John Muir

content: Travel and society polish one, but a rolling stone gathers no moss, and a little moss is a good thing on a man.
author: John Burroughs

content: To read a writer is for me not merely to get an idea of what he says, but to go off with him and travel in his company.
author: Andre Gide

content: The photograph reverses the purpose of travel, which until now had been to encounter the strange and unfamiliar.
author: Marshall McLuhan

content: I travel light. I think the most important thing is to be in a good mood and enjoy life, wherever you are.
author: Diane von Furstenberg

content: The one thing I regret was that my work required an enormous amount of my time, and a lot of travel.
author: Neil Armstrong

content: The good news is that real-world hands-on conservation is alive and well and catching on across the America I travel.
author: Ted Nugent

content: Thanks to the Interstate Highway System, it is now possible to travel across the country from coast to coast without seeing anything.
author: Charles Kuralt

content: Travel in all the four quarters of the earth, yet you will find nothing anywhere. Whatever there is, is only here.
author: Ramakrishna

content: Of all possible subjects, travel is the most difficult for an artist, as it is the easiest for a journalist.
author: W. H. Auden

content: I see my path, but I don't know where it leads. Not knowing where I'm going is what inspires me to travel it.
author: Rosalia de Castro

content: Nothing in the universe can travel at the speed of light, they say, forgetful of the shadow's speed.
author: Howard Nemerov

content: I get a friend to travel with me... I need somebody to bring me back to who I am. It's hard to be alone.

content: I like to go to work, and also, I don't have any kids. I don't have any hobbies. I don't like to travel. So going to work is kind of it.
author: Christopher Walken

content: Own only what you can always carry with you: know languages, know countries, know people. Let your memory be your travel bag.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

content: I think kids ought to travel. I think it's very good to carry kids around. It's good for them. Of course it's tough on the parents.
author: Doris Lessing

content: Restore human legs as a means of travel. Pedestrians rely on food for fuel and need no special parking facilities.
author: Lewis Mumford

content: Your lost friends are not dead, but gone before, advanced a stage or two upon that road which you must travel in the steps they trod.
author: Aristophanes

content: If you have enthusiasm, you have a very dynamic, effective companion to travel with you on the road to Somewhere.
author: Loretta Young

content: I am a passionate traveler, and from the time I was a child, travel formed me as much as my formal education.
author: David Rockefeller

content: When I travel, I like to take advantage of room service. I'm really into eggs Benedict in the morning.
author: Jenny McCarthy

content: The helicopter is a fine way to travel, but it induces a view of the world that only God and CEOs share on a regular basis.
author: Morley Safer

content: If you travel to Germany, it's still absolutely Germany. If you travel to Sweden, it still has a Swedish identity.
author: Steven Patrick Morrissey

content: Since I travel so much, it's always great to be home. There's nothing like getting to raid my own refrigerator at two in the morning.
author: Amy Grant

content: Extensive traveling induces a feeling of encapsulation, and travel, so broadening at first, contracts the mind.
author: Paul Theroux

content: In Heaven, I believe my dad is somewhere doing something nice. I feel I've been too lucky to travel this far without somebody guiding me.
author: Katherine Jenkins

content: I fly economy. I do often fly first class, but I don't travel with a posse, or bodyguard, or an assistant.
author: Gene Simmons

content: It's wonderful to travel with somebody that you love and we never travel anywhere without one another.
author: Roger Moore

content: I enjoy the preparatory elements of travel - packing my bags and choosing my outfits - but my favourite part is getting there.
author: Dominic Monaghan

content: I am traveling less in order to be able to write more. I select my travel destinations according to their degree of usefulness to my work.
author: Jose Saramago

content: Don Quixote's 'Delusions' is an excellent read - far better than my own forthcoming travel book, 'Walking Backwards Across Tuscany.'

content: Travel books are, by and large, boring. They lodge uncomfortably between fact, fiction and autobiography.
author: Arthur Smith

content: You do not travel if you are afraid of the unknown, you travel for the unknown, that reveals you with yourself.
author: Ella Maillart

content: Some minds improve by travel, others, rather, resemble copper wire, or brass, which get the narrower by going farther.
author: Thomas Hood

content: Our career is a dream. I mean, we get to act, travel around the world, and meet cool people. What's not to love!
author: Mary-Kate Olsen

content: I can create countries just as I can create the actions of my characters. That is why a lot of travel seems to me a waste of time.
