author: Oscar Wilde

content: An error does not become truth by reason of multiplied propagation, nor does truth become error because nobody sees it.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: Truth is by nature self-evident. As soon as you remove the cobwebs of ignorance that surround it, it shines clear.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: All truth passes through three stages. First, it is ridiculed. Second, it is violently opposed. Third, it is accepted as being self-evident.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

content: Truth is a deep kindness that teaches us to be content in our everyday life and share with the people the same happiness.
author: Khalil Gibran

content: All fixed set patterns are incapable of adaptability or pliability. The truth is outside of all fixed patterns.
author: Bruce Lee

content: Stand upright, speak thy thoughts, declare The truth thou hast, that all may share Be bold, proclaim it everywhere: They only live who dare.
author: Voltaire

content: A dog barks when his master is attacked. I would be a coward if I saw that God's truth is attacked and yet would remain silent.
author: John Calvin

content: I maintain that Truth is a pathless land, and you cannot approach it by any path whatsoever, by any religion, by any sect.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

content: My mother taught me that when you stand in the truth and someone tells a lie about you, don't fight it.
author: Whitney Houston

content: For my part, whatever anguish of spirit it may cost, I am willing to know the whole truth to know the worst and provide for it.
author: Patrick Henry

content: It is always the best policy to speak the truth, unless, of course, you are an exceptionally good liar.
author: Jerome K. Jerome

content: If you would be a real seeker after truth, it is necessary that at least once in your life you doubt, as far as possible, all things.
author: Rene Descartes

content: I tore myself away from the safe comfort of certainties through my love for truth - and truth rewarded me.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

content: Truth, like gold, is to be obtained not by its growth, but by washing away from it all that is not gold.
author: Leo Tolstoy

content: There are trivial truths and the great truths. The opposite of a trivial truth is plainly false. The opposite of a great truth is also true.
author: Niels Bohr

content: To myself I am only a child playing on the beach, while vast oceans of truth lie undiscovered before me.
author: Isaac Newton

content: We swallow greedily any lie that flatters us, but we sip only little by little at a truth we find bitter.
author: Denis Diderot

content: There are only two people who can tell you the truth about yourself - an enemy who has lost his temper and a friend who loves you dearly.
author: Antisthenes

content: The truth is you don't know what is going to happen tomorrow. Life is a crazy ride, and nothing is guaranteed.
author: Eminem

content: The pursuit of truth and beauty is a sphere of activity in which we are permitted to remain children all our lives.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Whoever undertakes to set himself up as a judge of Truth and Knowledge is shipwrecked by the laughter of the gods.
author: Albert Einstein

content: In a controversy the instant we feel anger we have already ceased striving for the truth, and have begun striving for ourselves.
author: Buddha

content: Of life's two chief prizes, beauty and truth, I found the first in a loving heart and the second in a laborer's hand.
author: Khalil Gibran

content: Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities Truth isn't.
author: Mark Twain

content: I know where I'm going and I know the truth, and I don't have to be what you want me to be. I'm free to be what I want.
author: Muhammad Ali

content: A nation that is afraid to let its people judge the truth and falsehood in an open market is a nation that is afraid of its people.
author: John F. Kennedy

content: All things are subject to interpretation whichever interpretation prevails at a given time is a function of power and not truth.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: There is another old poet whose name I do not now remember who said, 'Truth is the daughter of Time.'
author: Abraham Lincoln

content: Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing had happened.
author: Winston Churchill

content: He who knows nothing is closer to the truth than he whose mind is filled with falsehoods and errors.
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: All the religions of the world, while they may differ in other respects, unitedly proclaim that nothing lives in this world but Truth.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: We occasionally stumble over the truth but most of us pick ourselves up and hurry off as if nothing had happened.
author: Winston Churchill

content: Man will occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of the time he will pick himself up and continue on.
author: Winston Churchill

content: Ignorance is preferable to error, and he is less remote from the truth who believes nothing than he who believes what is wrong.
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: God is, even though the whole world deny him. Truth stands, even if there be no public support. It is self-sustained.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: My religion is based on truth and non-violence. Truth is my God. Non-violence is the means of realising Him.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: When you are sorrowful look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight.
author: Khalil Gibran

content: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before emperors. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.
author: Khalil Gibran

content: A liar begins with making falsehood appear like truth, and ends with making truth itself appear like falsehood.
author: William Shenstone

content: Speak the truth, do not yield to anger give, if thou art asked for little by these three steps thou wilt go near the gods.
author: Confucius

content: Truth is handsomer than the affectation of love. Your goodness must have some edge to it, else it is none.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: There is some self-interest behind every friendship. There is no friendship without self-interests. This is a bitter truth.
author: Chanakya

content: Not when truth is dirty, but when it is shallow, does the enlightened man dislike to wade into its waters.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: It is not when truth is dirty, but when it is shallow, that the lover of knowledge is reluctant to step into its waters.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: Words are but symbols for the relations of things to one another and to us nowhere do they touch upon absolute truth.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: There are various eyes. Even the Sphinx has eyes: and as a result there are various truths, and as a result there is no truth.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: Truth is always in harmony with herself, and is not concerned chiefly to reveal the justice that may consist with wrong-doing.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: Let us dream of tomorrow where we can truly love from the soul, and know love as the ultimate truth at the heart of all creation.
author: Michael Jackson

content: No face which we can give to a matter will stead us so well at last as the truth. This alone wears well.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: Truth, like light, blinds. Falsehood, on the contrary, is a beautiful twilight that enhances every object.
author: Albert Camus

content: The truth is, hardly any of us have ethical energy enough for more than one really inflexible point of honor.
author: George Bernard Shaw

content: How can sincerity be a condition of friendship? A taste for truth at any cost is a passion which spares nothing.
author: Albert Camus

content: Love is the only reality and it is not a mere sentiment. It is the ultimate truth that lies at the heart of creation.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

content: The thing you fear most has no power. Your fear of it is what has the power. Facing the truth really will set you free.
author: Oprah Winfrey

content: Any fool knows that bravado is always a cover-up for insecurity. That's the truth. And on that note, I'll say goodnight. God love you.
author: Bobby Darin

content: It is the nature of truth in general, as of some ores in particular, to be richest when most superficial.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

content: Truth is something which can't be told in a few words. Those who simplify the universe only reduce the expansion of its meaning.
author: Anais Nin

content: It is hard to believe that a man is telling the truth when you know that you would lie if you were in his place.
author: H. L. Mencken

content: Everyone who knows me will know the truth, which is that my children come first in my life and that I would never harm any child.
author: Michael Jackson

content: It is my feeling that Time ripens all things with Time all things are revealed Time is the father of truth.
author: Francois Rabelais

content: Ah, well, the truth is always one thing, but in a way it's the other thing, the gossip, that counts. It shows where people's hearts lie.
author: Paul Scott

content: It may not always be easy, convenient, or politically correct to stand for truth and right, but it is the right thing to do. Always.
author: M. Russell Ballard

content: It seems that the first victim of an Obama campaign is the truth. It seems that the first victim of an Obama campaign is the truth.
author: Mitt Romney

content: Nine times out of ten, in the arts as in life, there is actually no truth to be discovered there is only error to be exposed.
author: H. L. Mencken

content: To kill an error is as good a service as, and sometimes even better than, the establishing of a new truth or fact.
author: Charles Darwin

content: I love you, and because I love you, I would sooner have you hate me for telling you the truth than adore me for telling you lies.
author: Pietro Aretino

content: A half truth, like half a brick, is always more forcible as an argument than a whole one. It carries better.
author: Stephen Leacock

content: He who does not bellow the truth when he knows the truth makes himself the accomplice of liars and forgers.
author: Charles Peguy

content: Friendless. Having no favors to bestow. Destitute of fortune. Addicted to utterance of truth and common sense.
author: Ambrose Bierce

content: We should not pretend to understand the world only by the intellect. The judgement of the intellect is only part of the truth.
author: Carl Jung

content: Truth is so obscure in these times, and falsehood so established, that, unless we love the truth, we cannot know it.
author: Blaise Pascal

content: If you seek truth you will not seek victory by dishonorable means, and if you find truth you will become invincible.
author: Epictetus

content: 'Men have forgotten this truth,' said the fox. 'But you must not forget it. You become responsible, forever, for what you have tamed.'
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

content: Religion is about turning untested belief into unshakable truth through the power of institutions and the passage of time.
author: Richard Dawkins

content: Wine comes in at the mouth And love comes in at the eye That's all we shall know for truth Before we grow old and die.
author: William Butler Yeats

content: But such is the irresistable nature of truth, that all it asks, and all it wants is the liberty of appearing.
author: Thomas Paine

content: God's truth judges created things out of love, and Satan's truth judges them out of envy and hatred.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

content: He that takes truth for his guide, and duty for his end, may safely trust to God's providence to lead him aright.
author: Blaise Pascal

content: We all know that Art is not truth. Art is a lie that makes us realize the truth, at least the truth that is given to us to understand.
author: Pablo Picasso

content: When I tell the truth, it is not for the sake of convincing those who do not know it, but for the sake of defending those that do.
author: William Blake

content: We are either in the process of resisting God's truth or in the process of being shaped and molded by his truth.
author: Charles Stanley

content: The truth is that sometimes it is hard even for me to recognize the Hillary Clinton that other people see.
author: Hillary Clinton

content: Nothing that was worthy in the past departs no truth or goodness realized by man ever dies, or can die.
author: Thomas Carlyle

content: However greatly we distrust the sincerity of those we converse with, yet still we think they tell more truth to us than to anyone else.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

content: The best way to obtain truth and wisdom is not to ask from books, but to go to God in prayer, and obtain divine teaching.
author: Joseph Smith, Jr.

content: In matters of truth the fact that you don't want to publish something is, nine times out of ten, a proof that you ought to publish it.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

content: Some counterfeits reproduce so very well the truth that it would be a flaw of judgment not to be deceived by them.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

content: The truth is, I'm proud of the life I've lived so far, and though I've made my share of mistakes, I have no regrets.
author: Carly Fiorina

content: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
author: Jane Austen

content: I believe there's an inner power that makes winners or losers. And the winners are the ones who really listen to the truth of their hearts.
author: Sylvester Stallone

content: One must know oneself. If this does not serve to discover truth, it at least serves as a rule of life and there is nothing better.
author: Blaise Pascal

content: The opposite of a fact is falsehood, but the opposite of one profound truth may very well be another profound truth.
author: Niels Bohr

content: The enlightenment is under threat. So is reason. So is truth. So is science, especially in the schools of America.
author: Richard Dawkins

content: So near is falsehood to truth that a wise man would do well not to trust himself on the narrow edge.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

content: One of the reasons people hate politics is that truth is rarely a politician's objective. Election and power are.
author: Cal Thomas

content: Today I bent the truth to be kind, and I have no regret, for I am far surer of what is kind than I am of what is true.
author: Robert Brault

content: Mental fight means thinking against the current, not with it. It is our business to puncture gas bags and discover the seeds of truth.
author: Virginia Woolf

content: I speak the truth not so much as I would, but as much as I dare, and I dare a little more as I grow older.
author: Michel de Montaigne

content: Truth is a good dog but always beware of barking too close to the heels of an error, lest you get your brains kicked out.
author: Francis Bacon

content: It is a universal truth that the loss of liberty at home is to be charged to the provisions against danger, real or pretended, from abroad.
author: James Madison

content: To the scientist there is the joy in pursuing truth which nearly counteracts the depressing revelations of truth.
author: H. P. Lovecraft

content: If the Republicans will stop telling lies about the Democrats, we will stop telling the truth about them.
author: Adlai E. Stevenson

content: I left in love, in laughter, and in truth, and wherever truth, love and laughter abide, I am there in spirit.
author: Bill Hicks

content: It is more from carelessness about truth than from intentionally lying that there is so much falsehood in the world.
author: Samuel Johnson

content: Tell the truth. Sing with passion. Work with laughter. Love with heart. 'Cause that's all that matters in the end.
author: Kris Kristofferson

content: A man must be both stupid and uncharitable who believes there is no virtue or truth but on his own side.
author: Joseph Addison

content: Science, my lad, is made up of mistakes, but they are mistakes which it is useful to make, because they lead little by little to the truth.
author: Jules Verne

content: It seems a fantastic paradox, but it is nevertheless a most important truth, that no architecture can be truly noble which is not imperfect.
author: John Ruskin

content: The truth is that life is delicious, horrible, charming, frightful, sweet, bitter, and that is everything.
author: Anatole France

content: The thing about black history is that the truth is so much more complex than anything you could make up.
author: Henry Louis Gates

content: Chase after the truth like all hell and you'll free yourself, even though you never touch its coat tails.
author: Clarence Darrow

content: I think it better that in times like these a poet's mouth be silent, for in truth we have no gift to set a statesman right.
author: William Butler Yeats

content: The only way into truth is through one's own annihilation through dwelling a long time in a state of extreme and total humiliation.
author: Simone Weil

content: The truth does not require a majority to prevail, ladies and gentlemen. The truth is its own power. The truth will out. Never forget that.
author: Rush Limbaugh

content: In order that all men may be taught to speak the truth, it is necessary that all likewise should learn to hear it.
author: Samuel Johnson

content: Some men love truth so much that they seem to be in continual fear lest she should catch a cold on overexposure.
author: Samuel Butler

content: Every legend, moreover, contains its residuum of truth, and the root function of language is to control the universe by describing it.
author: James A. Baldwin

content: I am a lover of truth, a worshipper of freedom, a celebrant at the altar of language and purity and tolerance.
author: Stephen Fry

content: Every man has a right to utter what he thinks truth, and every other man has a right to knock him down for it. Martyrdom is the test.
author: Samuel Johnson

content: The truth is of course is that there is no journey. We are arriving and departing all at the same time.
author: David Bowie

content: Defending the truth is not something one does out of a sense of duty or to allay guilt complexes, but is a reward in itself.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

content: A writer should have this little voice inside of you saying, Tell the truth. Reveal a few secrets here.
author: Quentin Tarantino

content: It is one thing to show a man that he is in an error, and another to put him in possession of the truth.
author: John Locke

content: Freedom and order are not incompatible... truth is strength... free discussion is the very life of truth.
author: Thomas Huxley

content: When we believe ourselves in possession of the only truth, we are likely to be indifferent to common everyday truths.
author: Eric Hoffer

content: Once to every person and nation come the moment to decide. In the conflict of truth with falsehood, for the good or evil side.
author: James Russell Lowell

content: Truth, after all, wears a different face to everybody, and it would be too tedious to wait till all were agreed.
author: James Russell Lowell

content: When I can look life in the eyes, grown calm and very coldly wise, life will have given me the truth, and taken in exchange - my youth.
author: Sara Teasdale

content: If history and science have taught us anything, it is that passion and desire are not the same as truth.
author: E. O. Wilson

content: The Teutons have been singing the swan song ever since they entered the ranks of history. They have always confounded truth with death.
author: Henry Miller

content: The world is indeed a mixture of truth and make-believe. Discard the make-believe and take the truth.
author: Ramakrishna

content: The more rapidly truth is spread among mankind the better it will be for them. Only let us be sure that it is the truth.
author: Thomas Huxley

content: Let's not be afraid to speak the common sense truth: you can't have high standards without good discipline.
author: William Hague

content: The greatest friend of truth is Time, her greatest enemy is Prejudice, and her constant companion is Humility.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

content: To tell the truth is to become beautiful, to begin to love yourself, value yourself. And that's political, in its most profound way.
author: June Jordan

content: It is an old maxim of mine that when you have excluded the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

content: The truth is, I often like women. I like their unconventionality. I like their completeness. I like their anonymity.
author: Virginia Woolf

content: I want to be distinguished from the rest to tell the truth, a friend to all mankind is not a friend for me.
author: Moliere

content: I read less and less. I have not forgiven books for their failure to tell me the truth and make me happy.
author: Mason Cooley

content: Enhance and intensify one's vision of that synthesis of truth and beauty which is the highest and deepest reality.
author: Ovid

content: It is a clear truth that those who every day barter away other men's liberty will soon care little for their own.
author: James Otis

content: Clouds and darkness surround us, yet Heaven is just, and the day of triumph will surely come, when justice and truth will be vindicated.
author: Mary Todd Lincoln

content: It is a puzzling thing. The truth knocks on the door and you say, 'Go away, I'm looking for the truth,' and so it goes away. Puzzling.
author: Robert M. Pirsig

content: How often have I said to you that when you have eliminated the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth?
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

content: Violence does, in truth, recoil upon the violent, and the schemer falls into the pit which he digs for another.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

content: When truth has no burning, then it is philosophy, when it gets burning from the heart, it becomes poetry.
author: Muhammad Iqbal

content: The truth is often a terrible weapon of aggression. It is possible to lie, and even to murder, with the truth.
author: Alfred Adler

content: Many speak the truth when they say that they despise riches, but they mean the riches possessed by others.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

content: The teller of a mirthful tale has latitude allowed him. We are content with less than absolute truth.
author: Charles Lamb

content: Art has a double face, of expression and illusion, just like science has a double face: the reality of error and the phantom of truth.
author: Publilius Syrus

content: Without the way, there is no going without the truth, there is no knowing without the life, there is no living.
author: Thomas a Kempis

content: A priest is he who lives solely in the realm of the invisible, for whom all that is visible has only the truth of an allegory.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

content: Since obscenity is the truth of our passion today, it is the only stuff of art - or almost the only stuff.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

content: I pefer an ugly truth to a pretty lie. If someone is telling me the truth that is when I will give my heart.
author: Shakira

content: A dog barks when his master is attacked. I would be a coward if I saw that God's truth is attacked and yet would remain silent.
author: Pearl S. Buck

content: Truth is inseperable from the illusory belief that from the figures of the unreal one day, in spite of all, real deliverance will come.
author: Theodor Adorno

content: The price of being close to the President is delivering bad news. You fail him if you don't tell him the truth. Others won't do it.
author: Donald Rumsfeld

content: Popular opinions, on subjects not palpable to sense, are often true, but seldom or never the whole truth.
author: John Stuart Mill

content: Truth may be stretched, but cannot be broken, and always gets above falsehood, as does oil above water.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

content: I'll continue to try and balance like a circus act. And I will just fight to always tell the truth. Even if it's difficult.
author: Katy Perry

content: Scientific truth is marvelous, but moral truth is divine and whoever breathes its air and walks by its light has found the lost paradise.
author: Horace Mann

content: Your experiences will be yours alone. But truth and best friendship will rarely if ever disappoint you.
author: Anne Lamott

content: The truth is, I had always wanted to be a comedian, but I really didn't have that kind of personality, and it's a terrifying thing to say.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

content: Most people live in a myth and grow violently angry if anyone dares to tell them the truth about themselves.
author: Robert Anton Wilson

content: Truth indeed rather alleviates than hurts, and will always bear up against falsehood, as oil does above water.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

content: It shows the truth - that the real meaning of a word is only as powerful or harmless as the emotion behind it.
author: Sarah Silverman

content: I don't want any yes-men around me. I want everybody to tell me the truth even if it costs them their job.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

content: The said truth is that it is the greatest happiness of the greatest number that is the measure of right and wrong.
author: Jeremy Bentham

content: The first ingredient in conversation is truth, the next good sense, the third good humor, and the fourth wit.
author: William Temple

content: The reason for the sadness of this modern age and the men who live in it is that it looks for the truth in everything and finds it.
author: Edmond de Goncourt

content: You can hate me. You can go out there and say anything you want about me, But you will love me later because I told you the truth.
author: Mary J. Blige

content: The truth knocks on the door and you say, go away, I'm looking for the truth, and it goes away. Puzzling.
author: Robert M. Pirsig

content: It is unfortunate, considering that enthusiasm moves the world, that so few enthusiasts can be trusted to speak the truth.
author: Arthur Balfour

content: The time has come to tell the truth about the corruption of the government employee unions in this country.
author: Newt Gingrich

content: Death comes in a flash, and that's the truth of it, the person's gone in less than 24 frames of film.
author: Martin Scorsese

content: Happiness is spiritual, born of truth and love. It is unselfish therefore it cannot exist alone, but requires all mankind to share it.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

content: To become properly acquainted with a truth, we must first have disbelieved it, and disputed against it.
author: Novalis

content: Any person seasoned with a just sense of the imperfections of natural reason, will fly to revealed truth with the greatest avidity.
author: David Hume

content: I was not out to paint beautiful pictures even painting good pictures was not important to me. I wanted only to help the truth burst forth.
author: Alice Miller

content: The oppressed peoples can liberate themselves only through struggle. This is a simple and clear truth confirmed by history.
author: Kim Il-sung

content: I will make a bargain with the Republicans. If they will stop telling lies about Democrats, we will stop telling the truth about them.
author: Adlai Stevenson

content: Gradually I came to realize that people will more readily swallow lies than truth, as if the taste of lies was homey, appetizing: a habit.
author: Martha Gellhorn

content: Every so often, I feel I should graduate to classical music, properly. But the truth is, I'm more likely to listen to rock music.
author: Tony Blair

content: There is no excuse for perjury - never, never, never. There is truth, and the truth demands respect.
author: Kenneth Starr

content: Not every truth is the better for showing its face undisguised and often silence is the wisest thing for a man to heed.
author: Pindar

content: We are volcanoes. When we women offer our experience as our truth, as human truth, all the maps change. There are new mountains.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin

content: Man has gone long enough, or even too long, without being man enough to face the simple truth that the trouble with man is man.
author: James Thurber

content: I'm not a tough guy. I'm just delivering the truth and only the truth and if you can't deal with it, too bad.
author: Kevin O'Leary

content: I think Hollywood has a class system. The actors are like the inmates, but the truth is they're running the asylum.
author: Robert De Niro

content: The genuine truth, and I do think about this a lot, is that I'm one of the least competitive people you'll ever meet. Except with myself.
author: Daniel Craig

content: I know what I like in other actors: truth. That's the best. It makes you say, 'OK, I'll go with you on this.'
author: Daniel Craig

content: Everything will line up perfectly when knowing and living the truth becomes more important than looking good.
author: Alan Cohen

content: The truth, the absolute truth, is that the chief beauty for the theatre consists in fine bodily proportions.
author: Sarah Bernhardt

content: I'm someone who believes the truth needs to be heard. And if I'm empowered with the truth, I'm not going to shut up.
author: Scott Ritter

content: It is terrible to destroy a person's picture of himself in the interests of truth or some other abstraction.
author: Doris Lessing

content: Eternal truth, eternal righteousness, eternal love these only can triumph, for these only can endure.
author: Joseph Barber Lightfoot

content: To attempt seeing Truth without knowing Falsehood. It is the attempt to see the Light without knowing the Darkness. It cannot be.
author: Frank Herbert

content: If there is one eternal truth of politics, it is that there are always a dozen good reasons for doing nothing.
author: John le Carre

content: No human being will ever know the Truth, for even if they happen to say it by chance, they would not even known they had done so.
author: Xenophanes

content: Only the dreamer shall understand realities, though in truth his dreaming must be not out of proportion to his waking.
author: Margaret Fuller

content: There's a terrible truth for many women in the picture business: Aging typically takes its toll and means fewer and less desirable roles.
author: Maureen O'Hara

content: Individuals need to be willing to face truth about their attitudes, behaviors, even what we want out of life.
author: Joyce Meyer

content: I make one pledge above all others - to seek and speak the truth with all the resources of mind and spirit I command.
author: George McGovern

content: Also, I used to think that one day I might get someone to iron my shirts, but the truth is I really like doing them myself.
author: David Sedaris

content: Confidence and superiority: It's the usual fundamentalist stuff: I've got the truth, and you haven't.
author: Jeanette Winterson

content: The audience is the best judge of anything. They cannot be lied to. Truth brings them closer. A moment that lags - they're gonna cough.
author: Barbra Streisand

content: Every night I go over what I did in the day, in ethical or moral terms. Have I treated people properly? Did I tell the truth?
author: Jeanne Moreau

content: I intend to explode the myths about myself and get down to the real truth about the legend that is Batman.
author: Bob Kane

content: One of the greatest casualties of the war in Vietnam is the Great Society... shot down on the battlefield of Vietnam.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

content: The release of atomic energy has not created a new problem. It has merely made more urgent the necessity of solving an existing one.
author: Albert Einstein

content: War will exist until that distant day when the conscientious objector enjoys the same reputation and prestige that the warrior does today.
author: John F. Kennedy

content: It is forbidden to kill therefore all murderers are punished unless they kill in large numbers and to the sound of trumpets.
author: Voltaire

content: What is human warfare but just this an effort to make the laws of God and nature take sides with one party.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: In my dreams I hear again the crash of guns, the rattle of musketry, the strange, mournful mutter of the battlefield.
author: Douglas MacArthur

content: To walk through the ruined cities of Germany is to feel an actual doubt about the continuity of civilization.
author: George Orwell

content: The direct use of force is such a poor solution to any problem, it is generally employed only by small children and large nations.
author: David Friedman

content: We have war when at least one of the parties to a conflict wants something more than it wants peace.
author: Jeane Kirkpatrick

content: A visitor from Mars could easily pick out the civilized nations. They have the best implements of war.
author: Herbert V. Prochnow

content: Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war love is a growing up.

content: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.

content: We must concentrate not merely on the negative expulsion of war but the postive affirmation of peace.

content: Be at war with your vices, at peace with your neighbors, and let every new year find you a better man.

content: The republican is the only form of government which is not eternally at open or secret war with the rights of mankind.

content: Politics is almost as exciting as war, and quite as dangerous. In war you can only be killed once, but in politics many times.

content: No bastard ever won a war by dying for his country. He won it by making the other poor dumb bastard die for his country.

content: Those who can win a war well can rarely make a good peace and those who could make a good peace would never have won the war.

content: War is a game that is played with a smile. If you can't smile, grin. If you can't grin, keep out of the way till you can.

content: As long as war is regarded as wicked, it will always have its fascination. When it is looked upon as vulgar, it will cease to be popular.

content: Communism has never come to power in a country that was not disrupted by war or corruption, or both.

content: War is an instrument entirely inefficient toward redressing wrong and multiplies, instead of indemnifying losses.

content: Once we have a war there is only one thing to do. It must be won. For defeat brings worse things than any that can ever happen in war.

content: War against a foreign country only happens when the moneyed classes think they are going to profit from it.

content: War will never cease until babies begin to come into the world with larger cerebrums and smaller adrenal glands.

content: The essential act of war is destruction, not necessarily of human lives, but of the products of human labor.

content: May the same Almighty Goodness banish the accursed monster, war, from all lands, with her hated associates, rapine and insatiable ambition!

content: I think I'm just someone that just tries to get by. I'm kind of - if it was during the Second World War, I'd be a black marketeer, I think.

content: I think if you're at the point where you're popular enough to sell your wedding photos to OK! Magazine then you don't need the money.

content: I am usually part of any disaster at a wedding if I'm a bridesmaid, which I've been lucky enough to be several times.

content: A man must be big enough to admit his mistakes, smart enough to profit from them, and strong enough to correct them.

content: We should not judge people by their peak of excellence but by the distance they have traveled from the point where they started.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

content: Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit.
author: Elbert Hubbard

content: Wisdom stands at the turn in the road and calls upon us publicly, but we consider it false and despise its adherents.
author: Khalil Gibran

content: Don't follow any advice, no matter how good, until you feel as deeply in your spirit as you think in your mind that the counsel is wise.
author: Joan Rivers

content: It is a common experience that a problem difficult at night is resolved in the morning after the committee of sleep has worked on it.
author: John Steinbeck

content: Never tell people how to do things. Tell them what to do and they will surprise you with their ingenuity.
author: George S. Patton

content: Good nature is worth more than knowledge, more than money, more than honor, to the persons who possess it.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

content: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
author: Lord Byron

content: This is the highest wisdom that I own freedom and life are earned by those alone who conquer them each day anew.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: The more sand that has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.
author: Jean Paul

content: Honesty is the rarest wealth anyone can possess, and yet all the honesty in the world ain't lawful tender for a loaf of bread.
author: Josh Billings

content: The best way to obtain truth and wisdom is not to ask from books, but to go to God in prayer, and obtain divine teaching.
author: Joseph Smith, Jr.

content: A heart well prepared for adversity in bad times hopes, and in good times fears for a change in fortune.
author: Horace

content: When an opponent comes forward, move in and greet him if he wants to pull back, send him on his way.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

content: When I can look life in the eyes, grown calm and very coldly wise, life will have given me the truth, and taken in exchange - my youth.
author: Sara Teasdale

content: He who devotes sixteen hours a day to hard study may become at sixty as wise as he thought himself at twenty.
author: Mary Wilson Little

content: Singleness of purpose is one of the chief essentials for success in life, no matter what may be one's aim.
author: John D. Rockefeller

content: Wise kings generally have wise counselors and he must be a wise man himself who is capable of distinguishing one.
author: Diogenes

content: It is astonishing with how little wisdom mankind can be governed, when that little wisdom is its own.
author: William Ralph Inge

content: Wisdom ceases to be wisdom when it becomes too proud to weep, too grave to laugh, and too selfish to seek other than itself.
author: Khalil Gibran

content: Science investigates religion interprets. Science gives man knowledge which is power religion gives man wisdom which is control.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

content: The attempt to combine wisdom and power has only rarely been successful and then only for a short while.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.
author: Khalil Gibran

content: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.
author: Socrates

content: I hope our wisdom will grow with our power, and teach us, that the less we use our power the greater it will be.
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: Wisdom I know is social. She seeks her fellows. But Beauty is jealous, and illy bears the presence of a rival.
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom. It is healthy to be reminded that the strongest might weaken and the wisest might err.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: Pain and foolishness lead to great bliss and complete knowledge, for Eternal Wisdom created nothing under the sun in vain.
author: Khalil Gibran

content: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
author: Isaac Asimov

content: Where is the Life we have lost in living? Where is the wisdom we have lost in knowledge? Where is the knowledge we have lost in information?
author: T. S. Eliot

content: Data is not information, information is not knowledge, knowledge is not understanding, understanding is not wisdom.
author: Clifford Stoll

content: Few people have the wisdom to prefer the criticism that would do them good, to the praise that deceives them.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

content: Women always excel men in that sort of wisdom which comes from experience. To be a woman is in itself a terrible experience.
author: H. L. Mencken

content: Fear is the main source of superstition, and one of the main sources of cruelty. To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Bertrand Russell

content: Experience - the wisdom that enables us to recognise in an undesirable old acquaintance the folly that we have already embraced.
author: Ambrose Bierce

content: The wisdom of man never yet contrived a system of taxation that would operate with perfect equality.
author: Andrew Jackson

content: To make no mistakes is not in the power of man but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.
author: Plutarch

content: We don't receive wisdom we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us.
author: Marcel Proust

content: Gray hairs are signs of wisdom if you hold your tongue, speak and they are but hairs, as in the young.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

content: Earthly wisdom is doing what comes naturally. Godly wisdom is doing what the Holy Spirit compels us to do.
author: Charles Stanley

content: Start with God - the first step in learning is bowing down to God only fools thumb their noses at such wisdom and learning.
author: King Solomon

content: Both in thought and in feeling, even though time be real, to realise the unimportance of time is the gate of wisdom.
author: Bertrand Russell

content: I am thinking of taking a fifth wife. Why not? Solomon had a thousand wives and he is a synonym for wisdom.
author: John Barrymore

content: However glorious an action in itself, it ought not to pass for great if it be not the effect of wisdom and intention.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

content: Of all the things which wisdom provides to make us entirely happy, much the greatest is the possession of friendship.
author: Epicurus

content: Magnanimity in politics is not seldom the truest wisdom and a great empire and little minds go ill together.
author: Edmund Burke

content: Science is always discovering odd scraps of magical wisdom and making a tremendous fuss about its cleverness.
author: Aleister Crowley

content: The war... was an unnecessary condition of affairs, and might have been avoided if forebearance and wisdom had been practiced on both sides.
author: Robert E. Lee

content: The final wisdom of life requires not the annulment of incongruity but the achievement of serenity within and above it.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

content: At sixty, I know little more about wisdom than I did at thirty, but I know a great deal more about folly.
author: Mason Cooley

content: There's a beauty to wisdom and experience that cannot be faked. It's impossible to be mature without having lived.
author: Amy Grant

content: The philosophies of one age have become the absurdities of the next, and the foolishness of yesterday has become the wisdom of tomorrow.
author: William Osler

content: Our own physical body possesses a wisdom which we who inhabit the body lack. We give it orders which make no sense.
author: Henry Miller

content: Teach you children poetry it opens the mind, lends grace to wisdom and makes the heroic virtues hereditary.
author: Walter Scott

content: The seat of knowledge is in the head of wisdom, in the heart. We are sure to judge wrong, if we do not feel right.
author: William Hazlitt

content: He who is taught to live upon little owes more to his father's wisdom than he who has a great deal left him does to his father's care.
author: William Penn

content: If you were to offer a thirsty man all wisdom, you would not please him more than if you gave him a drink.
author: Sophocles

content: Lord, bless me with the ability to achieve all that I can, and the wisdom to realize it doesn't all have to be by tomorrow!
author: William Eardley IV

content: In my definition of consciousness, consciousness is the same thing as life. What wisdom traditions also call spirit.
author: Deepak Chopra

content: I love being. There's so much wisdom in it. You wake up in the morning and you think, Hey, isn't it great just being?

content: Wisdom and penetration are the fruit of experience, not the lessons of retirement and leisure. Great necessities call out great virtues.
author: Abigail Adams

content: Moderation is the inseparable companion of wisdom, but with it genius has not even a nodding acquaintance.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

content: In complete darkness we are all the same, it is only our knowledge and wisdom that separates us, don't let your eyes deceive you.
author: Janet Jackson

content: To know how to grow old is the master work of wisdom, and one of the most difficult chapters in the great art of living.
author: Herman Melville

content: The stupidity of people comes from having an answer for everything. The wisdom of the novel comes from having a question for everything.
author: Milan Kundera

content: That which seems the height of absurdity in one generation often becomes the height of wisdom in another.
author: Adlai E. Stevenson

content: Every speaker has a mouth An arrangement rather neat. Sometimes it's filled with wisdom. Sometimes it's filled with feet.
author: Robert Orben

content: If I am fool, it is, at least, a doubting one and I envy no one the certainty of his self-approved wisdom.
author: George Byron

content: People always blame the girl she should have said no. A monosyllable, but conventional wisdom has always been that boys can't manage it.
author: Anna Quindlen

content: Life is the only real counselor wisdom unfiltered through personal experience does not become a part of the moral tissue.
author: Edith Wharton

content: If we continue to develop our technology without wisdom or prudence, our servant may prove to be our executioner.
author: Omar N. Bradley

content: Novels are the Socratic dialogues of our time. Practical wisdom fled from school wisdom into this liberal form.

content: Some of the best lessons we ever learn are learned from past mistakes. The error of the past is the wisdom and success of the future.
author: Dale Turner

content: I don't think you can come into your wisdom until you have made mistakes on your own skin and felt them in reality of your own life.

content: In the frank expression of conflicting opinions lies the greatest promise of wisdom in governmental action.
author: Louis D. Brandeis

content: I keep my friends as misers do their treasure, because, of all the things granted us by wisdom, none is greater or better than friendship.
author: Pietro Aretino

content: I don't turn to greeting cards for wisdom and advice, but they are a fine reflection of the general drift of the culture.
author: Susan Orlean

content: I'm married. My wife, Stella - a beautiful woman. She's brought a lot of peace to my life, a lot of wisdom.
author: Anthony Hopkins

content: Great wisdom is generous petty wisdom is contentious. Great speech is impassioned, small speech cantankerous.
author: Zhuang Zi

content: Whenever you argue with another wiser than yourself in order that others may admire your wisdom, they will discover your ignorance.
author: Saadi

content: Lessons of wisdom have the most power over us when they capture the heart through the groundwork of a story, which engages the passions.
author: Laurence Sterne

content: Experiences are savings which a miser puts aside. Wisdom is an inheritance which a wastrel cannot exhaust.
author: Karl Kraus

content: To build a great company, which is a CEO's job, sometimes you have to stand up against conventional wisdom.
author: Carly Fiorina

content: It is almost everywhere the case that soon after it is begotten the greater part of human wisdom is laid to rest in repositories.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

content: I'm not wise, but the beginning of wisdom is there it's like relaxing into - and an acceptance of - things.

content: I always see where I didn't do things the right way. I only see the heavy lifting. That's a bit of my wisdom, if you want to call it that.

content: If you have the guts to keep making mistakes, your wisdom and intelligence leap forward with huge momentum.
author: Holly Near

content: As you walk in God's divine wisdom, you will surely begin to see a greater measure of victory and good success in your life.

content: Spending two years on my uncle's ranch in Montana as a young man gave me the wisdom and the thrust to do westerns.
author: Robert Duvall

content: He was gifted with the sly, sharp instinct for self-preservation that passes for wisdom among the rich.
author: Evelyn Waugh

content: Even when you have doubts, take that step. Take chances. Mistakes are never a failure - they can be turned into wisdom.
author: Cat Cora

content: It is astonishing what force, purity, and wisdom it requires for a human being to keep clear of falsehoods.
author: Margaret Fuller

content: I don't think I really have any wisdom. Stay out of trouble. Good luck. Stay away from women because they will burn you, haha.
author: Jason Aldean

content: There is no knowledge, no light, no wisdom that you are in possession of, but what you have received it from some source.
author: Brigham Young

content: Humility is the only true wisdom by which we prepare our minds for all the possible changes of life.
author: George Arliss

content: No man is the wiser for his learning it may administer matter to work in, or objects to work upon but wit and wisdom are born with a man.
author: John Selden

content: A great memory is never made synonymous with wisdom, any more than a dictionary would be called a treatise.
author: John Henry Newman

content: Unhappy is that Grandeur which makes us too great to be good and that Wit which sets us at a distance from true Wisdom.
author: Mary Astell

content: Imagination allows us to escape the predictable. It enables us to reply to the common wisdom that we cannot soar by saying, 'Just watch!'
author: Bill Bradley

content: My past is my wisdom to use today... my future is my wisdom yet to experience. Be in the present because that is where life resides.
author: Gene Oliver

content: There is as much wisdom in listening as there is in speaking - and that goes for all relationships, not just romantic ones.
author: Daniel Dae Kim

content: The greater the step forward in knowledge, the greater is the one taken backward in search of wisdom.
author: Stephen Gardiner

content: We live in a culture that doesn't acknowledge or validate human intuition and doesn't encourage us to rely on our intuitive wisdom.
author: Shakti Gawain

content: Education makes us more stupid than the brutes. A thousand voices call to us on every hand, but our ears are stopped with wisdom.
author: Jean Giraudoux

content: This fear of the Lord is indeed the beginning of wisdom. This consciousness of sin is the straight pathway to heaven.
author: Joseph Barber Lightfoot

content: The marvel of the Bhagavad-Gita is its truly beautiful revelation of life's wisdom which enables philosophy to blossom into religion.

content: I'm someone who's done the opposite of whatever the received wisdom is, to keep your career going into your 50s.
author: Elizabeth McGovern

content: Conventional wisdom holds that setting a timetable for getting American troops out of Iraq would be a mistake.
author: Nick Clooney

content: When I wrote Living in the Light, I wanted to share about how I live my own life and to encourage people to tap into their own inner wisdom.
author: Shakti Gawain

content: Mainstream media tend to just mouth the conventional wisdom, to see everything through the filter of right and left.
author: Arianna Huffington

content: I'm not a money manager, but I can tell you what the conventional wisdom is. The younger you are, the more risk you can take on.
author: Maria Bartiromo

content: Lord, give us the wisdom to utter words that are gentle and tender, for tomorrow we may have to eat them.
author: Mo Udall

content: Nobility of spirit has more to do with simplicity than ostentation, wisdom rather than wealth, commitment rather than ambition.
author: Riccardo Muti

content: Every indication of wisdom, taken from the effect, is equally an indication of power to execute what wisdom planned.
author: Thomas Reid

content: A monarchy conducted with infinite wisdom and infinite benevolence is the most perfect of all possible governments.
author: Ezra Stiles

content: You know, it's sort of common wisdom among New York publishers that short story collections don't make money.
author: Chad Harbach

content: I find the fact that billionaires are quoted as if the fact that they are billionaires gives them some kind of wisdom is outrageous.
author: Ben Elton

content: The most important lesson of New Labour is this: Every time we made progress we did it by challenging the conventional wisdom.
author: Ed Miliband

content: He read his mind. He's a strange sort of man, isn't he? It's not just the advice and the wisdom that he has.
author: Omar Sharif

content: Most things break, including hearts. The lessons of life amount not to wisdom, but to scar tissue and callus.
author: Wallace Stegner

content: Losing faith in your own singularity is the start of wisdom, I suppose also the first announcement of death.
author: Peter Conrad

content: You want people walking away from the conversation with some kernel of wisdom or some kind of impact.
author: Harry Dean Stanton

content: Follow the wisdom of the great actor, James Cagney, you hit your mark, you look the other guy in the eye, and you tell the truth.
author: Larry Merchant

content: Wisdom is a kind of knowledge. It is knowledge of the nature, career, and consequences of human values.
author: Sidney Hook

content: I don't want to put a pause on the rest of my life I'm really enjoying getting older and the wisdom that comes from that.
author: Rosemarie DeWitt

content: If the highest things are unknowable, then the highest capacity or virtue of man cannot be theoretical wisdom.
author: Leo Strauss

content: One reason the human race has such a low opinion of itself is that it gets so much of its wisdom from writers.
author: Wilfrid Sheed

content: Men are April when they woo, December when they wed. Maids are May when they are maids, but the sky changes when they are wives.
author: William Shakespeare

content: Clever and attractive women do not want to vote they are willing to let men govern as long as they govern men.
author: George Bernard Shaw

content: Women have simple tastes. They get pleasure out of the conversation of children in arms and men in love.
author: H. L. Mencken

content: Women always excel men in that sort of wisdom which comes from experience. To be a woman is in itself a terrible experience.
author: H. L. Mencken

content: Women need real moments of solitude and self-reflection to balance out how much of ourselves we give away.
author: Barbara de Angelis

content: There's no evidence whatsoever that men are more rational than women. Both sexes seem to be equally irrational.
author: Albert Ellis

content: One can find women who have never had one love affair, but it is rare indeed to find any who have had only one.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

content: In too many instances, the march to globalization has also meant the marginalization of women and girls. And that must change.
author: Hillary Clinton

content: God gave women intuition and femininity. Used properly, the combination easily jumbles the brain of any man I've ever met.
author: Farrah Fawcett

content: Only men who are not interested in women are interested in women's clothes. Men who like women never notice what they wear.
author: Anatole France

content: Girls have an unfair advantage over men: if they can't get what they want by being smart, they can get it by being dumb.
author: Yul Brynner

content: I guess at the end of the day, all women like to be appreciated and treated with respect and kindness.
author: Sofia Vergara

content: Being a sex symbol has to do with an attitude, not looks. Most men think it's looks, most women know otherwise.
author: Kathleen Turner

content: Friends are generally of the same sex, for when men and women agree, it is only in the conclusions their reasons are always different.
author: George Santayana

content: Childbirth is more admirable than conquest, more amazing than self-defense, and as courageous as either one.
author: Gloria Steinem

content: Single women have a dreadful propensity for being poor. Which is one very strong argument in favor of matrimony.
author: Jane Austen

content: Speaking very generally, I find that women are spiritually, emotionally, and often physically stronger than men.
author: Gary Oldman

content: Women, like men, should try to do the impossible. And when they fail, their failure should be a challenge to others.
author: Amelia Earhart

content: I think that women just have a primeval instinct to make soup, which they will try to foist on anybody who looks like a likely candidate.
author: Dylan Moran

content: There is a physical relationship with a woman that you don't have with anybody else, but that's not about love. Love is a spiritual thing.
author: Ziggy Marley

content: What we women need to do, instead of worrying about what we don't have, is just love what we do have.
author: Cameron Diaz

content: On the whole, I think women wear too much and are to fussy. You can't see the person for all the clutter.
author: Julie Andrews

content: To understand how any society functions you must understand the relationship between the men and the women.
author: Angela Davis

content: They say that women talk too much. If you have worked in Congress you know that the filibuster was invented by men.
author: Clare Boothe Luce

content: In politics women type the letters, lick the stamps, distribute the pamphlets and get out the vote. Men get elected.
author: Clare Boothe Luce

content: Men are allowed to have passion and commitment for their work... a woman is allowed that feeling for a man, but not her work.
author: Barbra Streisand

content: Why is it men are permitted to be obsessed about their work, but women are only permitted to be obsessed about men?
author: Barbra Streisand

content: You can't raise the standard of women's morals by raising their pay envelope. It lies deeper than that.
author: Billy Sunday

content: You're not working with models, you're working with real women who have, like, anatomy. Models do not have anatomy.
author: Isaac Mizrahi

content: Women hate everything which strips off the tinsel of sentiment, and they are right, or it would rob them of their weapons.
author: George Byron

content: The women's movement completely changed attitudes all over the world in ways we'll never be able to count.
author: Holly Near

content: I always say God should have given women one extra decade at least, especially if you want a family. You're trying to pack a lot in.
author: Christine Baranski

content: What bugs me is that movies don't reflect how interesting and vibrant women are. We don't treasure women as they get older.
author: Jill Clayburgh

content: Between men and women there is no friendship possible. There is passion, enmity, worship, love, but no friendship.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: I see when men love women. They give them but a little of their lives. But women when they love give everything.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: Men kick friendship around like a football, but it doesn't seem to crack. Women treat it like glass and it goes to pieces.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

content: The marvel of all history is the patience with which men and women submit to burdens unnecessarily laid upon them by their governments.
author: George Washington

content: Sometimes I wonder if men and women really suit each other. Perhaps they should live next door and just visit now and then.
author: Katharine Hepburn

content: The battle for the individual rights of women is one of long standing and none of us should countenance anything which undermines it.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

content: Women love us for our defects. If we have enough of them, they will forgive us everything, even our gigantic intellects.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: Long before history began we men have got together apart from the women and done things. We had time.
author: C. S. Lewis

content: Women are considered deep - why? Because one can never discover any bottom to them. Women are not even shallow.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: The reason women don't play football is because 11 of them would never wear the same outfit in public.
author: Phyllis Diller

content: Stupid as a man, say the women: cowardly as a woman, say the men. Stupidity in a woman is unwomanly.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: A man has a tendency to accept you the way you are, while most women immediately start to pick flaws and want to change you.
author: Marilyn Monroe

content: I can promise you that women working together - linked, informed and educated - can bring peace and prosperity to this forsaken planet.
author: Isabel Allende

content: Genteel women suppose that those things do not really exist about which it is impossible to talk in polite company.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: To a philosopher all news, as it is called, is gossip, and they who edit and read it are old women over their tea.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: The man who loves other countries as much as his own stands on a level with the man who loves other women as much as he loves his own wife.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

content: The fickleness of the women I love is only equalled by the infernal constancy of the women who love me.
author: George Bernard Shaw

content: All women do have a different sense of sexuality, or sense of fun, or sense of like what's sexy or cool or tough.
author: Angelina Jolie

content: Very learned women are to be found, in the same manner as female warriors but they are seldom or ever inventors.
author: Voltaire

content: The big divide in this country is not between Democrats and Republicans, or women and men, but between talkers and doers.
author: Thomas Sowell

content: Deprived of meaningful work, men and women lose their reason for existence they go stark, raving mad.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

content: Once we hit forty, women only have about four taste buds left: one for vodka, one for wine, one for cheese, and one for chocolate.
author: Gina Barreca

content: If I became a philosopher, if I have so keenly sought this fame for which I'm still waiting, it's all been to seduce women basically.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

content: Welcome to Lake Wobegon, where all the women are strong, all the men are good-looking, and all the children are above average.
author: Garrison Keillor

content: What makes a woman beautiful is her loyalty to and her friendships with other women, and her honesty with men.
author: Vanessa Marcil

content: Men have a much better time of it than women. For one thing, they marry later for another thing, they die earlier.
author: H. L. Mencken

content: Love is an emotion that is based on an opinion of women that is impossible for those who have had any experience with them.
author: H. L. Mencken

content: Men and women of every faith and good people with none at all sincerely strive to do right and lead a purpose-driven life.
author: Mitt Romney

content: If women believed in their husbands they would be a good deal happier and also a good deal more foolish.
author: H. L. Mencken

content: A man's brain has a more difficult time shifting from thinking to feeling than a women's brain does.
author: Barbara de Angelis

content: No one is more arrogant toward women, more aggressive or scornful, than the man who is anxious about his virility.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

content: Feminism is hated because women are hated. Anti-feminism is a direct expression of misogyny it is the political defense of women hating.
author: Andrea Dworkin

content: But what of black women?... I most sincerely doubt if any other race of women could have brought its fineness up through so devilish a fire.
author: W. E. B. Du Bois

content: When men attempt bold gestures, generally it's considered romantic. When women do it, it's often considered desperate or psycho.
author: Sarah Jessica Parker

content: I fought all my life for women to make their own choices, in their personal and professional lives. I made mine.
author: Hillary Clinton

content: Sheer flattery got me into the theater. Flattery always works with me, particularly the flattery of women.
author: Carroll O'Connor

content: If everybody in this town connected with politics had to leave town because of chasing women and drinking, you would have no government.
author: Barry Goldwater

content: You can find women who have never had an affair, but it is hard to find a woman who has had just one.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

content: Convent - a place of retirement for women who wish for leisure to meditate upon the sin of idleness.
author: Ambrose Bierce

content: It's funny how you never think about the women you've had. It's always the ones who get away that you can't forget.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

content: Decisiveness is a characteristic of high-performing men and women. Almost any decision is better than no decision at all.
author: Brian Tracy

content: Women have served all these centuries as looking glasses possessing the power of reflecting the figure of man at twice its natural size.
author: Virginia Woolf

content: Women desire six things: They want their husbands to be brave, wise, rich, generous, obedient to wife, and lively in bed.
author: Geoffrey Chaucer

content: Our duty, as men and women, is to proceed as if limits to our ability did not exist. We are collaborators in creation.
author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

content: Good women always think it is their fault when someone else is being offensive. Bad women never take the blame for anything.
author: Anita Brookner

content: Many societies have educated their male children on the simple device of teaching them not to be women.
author: Margaret Mead

content: Men become much more attractive when they start looking older. But it doesn't do much for women, though we do have an advantage: make-up.
author: Bette Davis

content: Few women, I fear, have had such reason as I have to think the long sad years of youth were worth living for the sake of middle age.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

content: The generality of virtuous women are like hidden treasures, they are safe only because nobody has sought after them.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

content: It is true that a fellow cannot ignore women - but he can think of them as he ought - as sisters, not as sparring partners.
author: Jim Elliot

content: Women's virtue is frequently nothing but a regard to their own quiet and a tenderness for their reputation.
author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

content: Women, as they grow older, rely more and more on cosmetics. Men, as they grow older, rely more and more on a sense of humor.
author: George Jean Nathan

content: All of the women on The Apprentice flirted with me - consciously or unconsciously. That's to be expected.
author: Donald Trump

content: We must make it clear that a platform of 'I hate gay men and women' is not a way to become president of the United States.
author: Jimmy Carter

content: To be born woman is to know - although they do not speak of it at school - women must labor to be beautiful.
author: William Butler Yeats

content: Feminism encourages women to leave their husbands, kill their children, practice witchcraft, destroy capitalism and become lesbians.
author: Pat Robertson

content: If you don't love yourself, you can't love anybody else. And I think as women we really forget that.
author: Jennifer Lopez

content: Being a woman is of special interest only to aspiring male transsexuals. To actual women, it is simply a good excuse not to play football.
author: Fran Lebowitz

content: People are more violently opposed to fur than leather because it's safer to harass rich women than motorcycle gangs.
author: Alexei Sayle

author: Storm Jameson

content: It is now common knowledge that the average American gains 7 pounds between Thanksgiving and New Year's Day.
author: Marilu Henner

content: Even though we're a week and a half away from Thanksgiving, it's beginning to look a lot like Christmas.
author: Richard Roeper

content: If you think Independence Day is America's defining holiday, think again. Thanksgiving deserves that title, hands-down.
author: Tony Snow

content: If a fellow isn't thankful for what he's got, he isn't likely to be thankful for what he's going to get.
author: Frank A. Clark

content: Drink and be thankful to the host! What seems insignificant when you have it, is important when you need it.
author: Franz Grillparzer

content: It's so warm now, and Thanksgiving came so early - is it just me, or does it not really feel like Ramadan?
author: David Letterman

content: Not to sound too much like Christopher Guest in 'Waiting for Guffman,' but on Thanksgiving you're putting on a show!
author: Ted Allen

content: As much as I love crisp, clean whites, there's always a time for rich but balanced Chardonnays with oak, especially at Thanksgiving.
author: Gary Vaynerchuk

content: My favorite meal is turkey and mashed potatoes. I love Thanksgiving, it's just my favorite. I can have Thanksgiving all year round.
author: Cindy Margolis

content: My fondest memories are generally the day after Thanksgiving. I get the total decorating Christmas itch.
author: Katharine McPhee

content: The act is unjustifiable that either begs for a blessing, or, having succeeded gives no thanksgiving.
author: Merle Shain

content: I'll love you, dear, I'll love you till China and Africa meet and the river jumps over the mountain and the salmon sing in the street.
author: W. H. Auden

content: The Eskimos had fifty-two names for snow because it was important to them: there ought to be as many for love.
author: Margaret Atwood

content: True love comes quietly, without banners or flashing lights. If you hear bells, get your ears checked.
author: Erich Segal

content: I'm into all that sappy stuff - a surprise picnic, nice dinner, or traveling. I'm kind of an old romantic.
author: Will Estes
